events.id: Gardens Magic-Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell-Wellington NZ
events.name: Gardens Magic
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā, Soundshell
events.long_description:
The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic. The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January. The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell. 
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks. Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more. Come early to grab a good picnic spot and sit back and enjoy the show with the whanau or a group of friends. Prolong your stay in the gardens by exploring the evening light display afterwards. The pathways near the Soundshell will be colourfully illuminated between 9 and 10:30pm every evening. During the day, the Botanic Gardens host a Kids Garden Trail and Kids Explorer Days. 
See the full 2026 programme online and keep an eye out for rain day announcements. This is your chance to join in on a beloved local tradition.
events.description:
The Wellington summer nights just got warmer with the return of Gardens Magic.
The capital’s talented musicians are on full display across January.
The annual event, brought by Wellington City Council, presents a series of free concerts in the Botanic Garden Soundshell.
Each year, a huge range of music genres is represented across three weeks.
Choose from rock, folk, country and western, soul, jazz, pop, reggae and many more.

events.id: Michelangelo — A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Michelangelo — A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.long_description:
There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.

events.id: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.

events.id: Heathers the Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Heathers the Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.

events.id: Practice as a Yogi - 6 week beginners course- Daily morning practice-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Practice as a Yogi - 6 week beginners course- Daily morning practice
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The challenging opportunity to practice every day as a yogi in the morning and experience how it can change your life. We come to know our body and ourselves better through the regular daily practice, practicing with full awareness and experiencing the effect of yoga on our body, mind and soul.
Going earlier to bed and not eat too much in the evening are the prerequisites to not give up after few days/weeks though
According to the ancient yoga scriptures, yoga needs to be practiced during the period of sunrise, when an immense amount of Prana (cosmic energy) enters our system nourishing our body, mind, intellect, and soul. Daily practice is crucial if we want to master any skill. You will notice an increased level of energy and positive change in your mood as wel as an improvement in your attention span and concentration. You will experience more inspiration, joy, and love in your daily life.

The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.
Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.

Monday - Friday 6.30 - 7.30am
Starts: 12 January 2026

Cost: 6 weeks| $171
For this course we require booking. 04-801 7012 or info@yogaindailylife.org.nz

There is no discount for this course. Possibility to join the course any time. We will practice each week a different part from the Level 1. If you could make just one or two weeks, you might like to buy a week pass for $54. Or feel free to contact us.

events.long_description:
Yoga in the Park
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!
Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!
What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)
Pricing:
$15 for a single class
$150 for an Outdoor Pass (covers the whole season: Nov to March, 20 classes + additional beach yoga sessions starting in 2026)
I can’t wait to see familiar faces and welcome new ones this season! Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.

events.id: Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 12th January 2026-199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 12th January 2026
events.venue: 199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 12th January 2026
Outside the tavern, a fog lies across the town. The damp, cobbled pavement glistens as the lights of street lanterns dance across the slick stones. The night chills the bones and shivers the soul of anyone outside.

Yet inside these tavern walls the food is hearty, and the ale is warm and frothy. A fire blazes in the hearth, and the tavern is alive with the voices and laughter.

Suddenly, the tavern door swings open, and you all notice it at the same time. Framed by the lamp-lit fog, a form strides through the doorway. His brightly coloured clothes are draped in loose folds about him, and his hat hangs askew, hiding his eyes in shadows. Without hesitation, he walks up to your table and pulls from his tunic a sealed letter, addressed to all of you in beautiful flowing script. He drops the letter on the table and turns and leaves the tavern, vanishing into the fog.

‘Curse of Strahd’ is a D&D5E gothic horror campaign. It has everything you and your party needs to have a grand experience. It will take you to the mysterious village of Barovia, a realm surrounded by deadly fog and ruled by a wizard, the vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich, the master of Castle Ravenloft. ‘Curse of Strahd’ is a rich narrative story you are part of as it’s unfolding. It’s not just about fighting monsters and hunting for treasure in dungeons; there is a compelling story arc and a richly realized antagonist.

events.id: Botanical insights display - Ancient plants-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Botanical insights display - Ancient plants
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ancient plants and a few animals

A boom in ‘modern’ palaeobotany started in the early 19th century and continues to the present day. A pictorial display at Wellington Botanic Garden’s Tree House highlights key discoveries in this long trek, and also gives us a glimpse of some of the animals that shared the world with plants.
The display is in two halves. From 1 November to mid-December, the ‘scene’ is set, and includes a look at the landscape preceding the rise of trees. It then moves on to the Silurian, Devonian and Carboniferous periods, characterised by the appearance of the likes of scale trees, seed ferns and calamites…. and the swamp forests that gave rise to the production of coal.
The mid-December to 31 January half focuses on the Permian period, including Gondwana before its eventual breakup, and the beautiful, strange, gymnosperm Glossopteris that was widespread in the ancient southern continents. It then, finally, progresses to the world of ‘living fossils’ such as ginkgo and the even more primitive horsetails.
A public talk associated with the display will be held at the Tree House on 2 December.

Treehouse Visitor Centre
1 Nov 2025 to 31 January 2026
Monday - Friday 9am - 4pm
Weekends & Public holidays 10am - 4pm
Closed Christmas Day
Free

events.id: Book binding - Creative Arts Holiday Programme for teens-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Book binding - Creative Arts Holiday Programme for teens
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this workshop you will be guided in assembling your chosen materials for your book, create decorative covers and learn Coptic binding - an elegant and simple binding that is unlimited in versatility.

No special tools or materials are needed and yet a wide spectrum of creative results can be created, from a notebook, sketch book and album to a highly crafted artwork. The books themselves can be made from found items, recycled material or quality art papers and card. You will produce one bound book and one bound album. Once you have Coptic binding in your skill set you can produce your choice of books in any shape or form, for any purpose.

All basic materials supplied.

Recommended age for this course is 12-16 years
events.description:
In this workshop you will be guided in assembling your chosen materials for your book, create decorative covers and learn Coptic binding - an elegant and simple binding that is unlimited in versatility.
No special tools or materials are needed and yet a wide spectrum of creative results can be created, from a notebook, sketch book and album to a highly crafted artwork.
The books themselves can be made from found items, recycled material or quality art papers and card.
You will produce one bound book and one bound album.
Once you have Coptic binding in your skill set you can produce your choice of books in any shape or form, for any purpose.

events.id: Colossal Squid: Freaky Features-Cobblestones Museum & Early Settlers Village, 169 Main Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Colossal Squid: Freaky Features
events.venue: Cobblestones Museum & Early Settlers Village, 169 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
Colossal Squid: Freaky Features comes to Cobblestones, Greytown

The ever-popular Te Papa exhibition Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua opens at Cobblestones on 11th December 2025 and runs through until 1st February 2026.

The Colossal Squid is so rarely seen that only eight adult colossal squid have ever been scientifically reported. Now venue name, in co-operation with Te Papa, is set to reveal some of the fascinating science and wonderful secrets of one of New Zealand’s most significant natural history specimens.

Te Papa's Head of Natural History, Phil Edgar, said, “In learning about this weird and mysterious creature, we hope visitors will have a greater appreciation for life in the deep sea, much of which remains undiscovered.”

The Colossal Squid is one of the most iconic specimens at Te Papa, and while touring the complete specimen is impossible, some of the important parts of the squid have found their way to Cobblestones.
Te Papa’s Curator of Invertebrates, Dr Rodrigo Salvador, explains how important the Colossal Squid has been for the science community, and how popular it has been among the public.

“Te Papa’s Colossal Squid has been a major source of information for scientists and the museum’s most popular exhibit since its debut. They live in the deep Antarctic waters, and despite being one of the largest invertebrate species in existence, they are very rarely captured”.

Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua centres around an interactive table displaying many different objects, including the lens from an eye of the Colossal Squid, part of a tentacle, and a complete tiny squid, a miniature of its colossal relative. Touchable rotating models of a squid’s tentacle hook and the Colossal Squid's beak are also on display.

The exhibition also displays two documentaries which show life in the depths of the Southern Ocean, and how the most complete Colossal Squid ever found ended up at Te Papa.

The public can continue the experience and learn beyond the exhibition with a new Te Papa press book for children, Whiti: Colossal Squid of the Deep, and online Te Papa resources, including a free downloadable Colossal Squid Activity Book.

“Thanks to the support of WBS and Te Papa, Cobblestones is delighted to be bringing this fascinating exhibition to Wairarapa during the summer holidays. It’s a must-see exhibition for the young and young at heart to learn about this fascinating creature, its world, and habitat.”

Colossal Squid Ngu Tipua is developed and toured by the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

For further information, please contact:
Cobblestones Museum - 063049687 or cobblestonesmuseumgreytown@gmail.com

Te Papa's Head of Natural History, Phil Edgar, said, “In learning about this weird and mysterious creature, we hope visitors will have a greater appreciation for life in the deep sea, much of which remains undiscovered.” The Colossal Squid is one of the most iconic specimens at Te Papa, and while touring the complete specimen is impossible, some of the important parts of the squid have found their way to Cobblestones.

events.name: Historic Jackson Street Scavenger Hunt

events.long_description:
Grab the family or friends for this fun, interactive scavenger hunt and learn about our history at the same time.

Did you know that Petone (Pito-one, “end of the sandy beach”) was New Zealand’s first European settlement in 1840, established by the New Zealand Company?

Winners will be drawn on Monday, the 2nd of February and will be notified via email.

When you finish, pop your entry into the box outside the Historic Police Station at 274B Jackson Street to go into the draw to win!

Download the booklet: https://jacksonstreet.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Scavenger-Hunt-booklet.png

events.id: Introduction to the darkroom & camera-less photography for teens-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Introduction to the darkroom & camera-less photography for teens
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Explore the magic of the darkroom in this hands-on, three-day photography workshop for tweens and teens. We’ll be exploring camera-less and alternative photographic processes, including the photogram, painting with developer, texture screens, and chemigrams.

On Day 1, you’ll learn how to safely use the darkroom and make your first photograms. Day 2 introduces positive photograms, where you’ll reverse tones by printing from your originals; we’ll also create painterly effects using different application techniques and texture screens. On Day 3, you’ll explore the chemigram process, working with photographic papers and chemistry to create expressive abstractions.

We’ll work with a collection of objects that play with translucency, texture, and shape, including foliage, feathers, lace, and glass. You’re welcome to bring small items from home – ornaments, jewellery, plants, or other treasures — to experiment with. This workshop gives you the opportunity to discover how light, chemistry, and imagination can come together to create unique photographic prints.

Recommended age for this course is tweens & teens ages 10 and above.

Duration: Three day workshop from Monday 12 January - Wednesday 14 January. 10 am - 2 pm daily.
Materials provided.

events.id: Michelangelo - A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Michelangelo - A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Last 4pm last entry

Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers the most complete and authentic reproduction of Michelangelo’s beautiful ceiling frescoes of the Sistine Chapel to be shown outside the Vatican.

Featuring over 50 stunning pieces, including a life-sized reproduction of The Genesis, famously painted on the Sistine Chapel ceiling. But instead of craning your neck to look up, A Different View invites you to experience Michelangelo’s genius from an entirely new perspective – from above and up close.

This immersive experience, completed with guided audio, allows visitors to admire every intricate detail of Michelangelo’s work, many from just two metres away – offering a far more intimate and comfortable viewing experience than the Vatican itself, where some 20,000 people queue daily for a glimpse.

With no time constraints, visitors can allow these masterpieces to truly soak in.

As an addition to – and to complete – Michelangelo — A Different View, reproductions of 14 of these impressive frescoes await visitors inside the exhibition. Scenes from the lives of Jesus and Moses, painted by Sandro Botticelli, Pietro Perugino, Domenico Ghirlandaio and Cosimo Rosselli, provide additional historical background and allow for a deeper insight into this epoch.

Enhancing the exhibition further, VIP guided tours will be led by Dr Christopher Longhurst, a theologian and aesthete who served for 17 years as an operatore didattico at the Sistine Chapel, St Peter’s Basilica, and the Vatican Museums' Papal Art Galleries.

* Booking and credit card fees apply

events.id: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Eat Your Art Out: High Tea
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.

Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse. Each dish is a playful nod to the world of art, clever, colourful, and made to be shared.

Your high tea includes your choice of tea or coffee. Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.

------

Set Menu
(Includes one of each item per person)

Cheery Cherry Curator
A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet

Mint to Be
Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together

Madeleine Moment
A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist

Sweet William’s Dish
Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan. A refined take on New Zealand’s liquid gold

The Golden Ratio
A perfectly proportioned cheese scone layered with sundried tomatoes, olives, and fresh basil brings Mediterranean flavours in perfect balance

The Pecking Order
Tender horopito-spiced chicken layered with creamy Tatua mayo and peppery watercress on fresh focaccia fingers, with native pepper leaf adding a bold, warming kick

Still Life with Eggplant
Tangy eggplant and native kawakawa caponata with buffalo bocconcini and fragrant basil pesto on artisanal brioche. A bold sandwich blending native botanicals and classic flavours.

Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.
Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.

events.name: Rubber Duck decorating competition
events.venue: Queen Elizabeth Park,Masterton, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Rubber Duck decorating competition
🦆🎉 Quack-tastic news — it’s Rubber Ducky Day!
Dive into the fun and decorate your very own Rubber Duckie. Get creative with colours, glitter, googly eyes, costumes — whatever makes your duck stand out from the flock! Decorate on the day or take your duckie home, give it the full makeover treatment, and bring it back to the Library to enter our community vote.

🏆🗳️ Will your duck reign supreme?

Decorated duckies will be displayed for the public to admire and vote on.

Voting closes Friday 23 January — so waddle on in and join the fun!

Look out for updates on our Facebook page in the event of bad weather. Tamariki aged under 14 are required to have a parent or guardian remain with them during all Library programmes.

events.name: Book group catch up
events.venue: The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place,51 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Book group catch up
For those around, we're having a relaxed catch up on Tuesday 13 January. Same time (6-7.30pm), same venue (The Library) as our regular sessions - and no pre-reading required!

It's a chance to catch up, or if you're new, to meet us; to see how we're all going with the Dostoevsky (there's still time to start); perhaps to get some insight from our Russian-speaking members; perhaps to indulge in one of the 2-for-1 dessert specials...

Looking forward to seeing you if you can make it.

Note: For this catch up we'll likely be in the area right behind the entrance/cash register - those couches/chairs in a rectangular arrangement. (We'll return to our usual spot for our early Feb book group.)

events.id: Getting Started in Standup - Wellington-Cavern Club,18 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Getting Started in Standup - Wellington
events.venue: Cavern Club,18 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Getting Started in Standup - Wellington
Have you always wanted to try stand-up comedy but don’t know how to start?

Comedian and writer Brendon Green brings you a fun low-pressure comedy workshop.

Sign up here: https://www.nzcomedyschool.com/enroll

Suggested koha: $20

Everything you need to know to get a mic in your face:
-generating ideas
-joke writing
-effective delivery
-where and how to get practice
-how to avoid many common mistakes new performers make.

Brendon Green is a professional comedian and writer with over 15 years of experience. He has written and performed 10 NZ Comedy Festival shows, receiving the Best Newcomer Award in 2012, a Billy T Nomination in 2014, and a FRED Award Nomination for Best Show in 2023.

------
This class is also an intro to our upcoming "Complete Course" in Wellington

Wellington January 2026 (w Brendon Green)

Getting Started (open to all): Tuesday, 13th January 6:00pm (Cavern Club)
Class 1: Tuesday, 20th January 6:00-9:00pm
Class 2: Tuesday, 27th January 6:00-9:00pm
Class 3: Tuesday, 3rd February 6:00-9:00pm
Class 4: Tuesday, 10th February 6:00-9:00pm
Graduation Show: Thursday, 12th February 6:00-9:00pm

Price $450 - Includes all classes and materials, two private writing/coaching sessions, and your graduation video

More info: https://www.nzcomedyschool.com/

Brendon Green is a professional comedian and writer with over 15 years of experience. He has written and performed 10 NZ Comedy Festival shows, receiving the Best Newcomer Award in 2012, a Billy T Nomination in 2014, and a FRED Award Nomination for Best Show in 2023. A prolific MC and line-up comedian, he is known for his friendly and consistent stage presence. His comedy is thoughtful, kind, and emotionally playful - allowing him to play to audiences of all sizes and backgrounds. He's been teaching for the NZ Comedy School in Auckland for several years, with graduates who made the finals of the Raw Quest!

events.name: Children's Creative Arts Holiday Programme for 6-10 years

events.long_description:
The school holiday programme has been designed to challenge and encourage children 6 -10 years old who love art.

The programme is a mixed media experience, used to teach the creative possibilities in the various art genres. Students will have made a variety of art objects by the end of the week and can take them home.

All materials are supplied including smocks to help keep your angels clean!

events.id: Men's World Floorball Championships 2026 AOFC Qualification-72 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Men's World Floorball Championships 2026 AOFC Qualification
events.venue: 72 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The stage is set for the World Floorball Championships 2026 Asia-Oceania Qualification, where 10 teams from across the region (New Zealand, Australia, Singapore, China, Hong Kong (China), Japan, Korea, Thailand, the Philippines, and Solomon Islands) will gather to compete for just 4 golden tickets to the biggest stage in floorball.
Over seven days of fast-paced action, lightning-quick plays, and relentless determination, these teams will leave everything on the court in pursuit of making it to the World Championships. Each match promises intensity, emotion, and energy as the teams fight for pride, passion, and a place among the world's best.
Click the link below to view the draw and obtain further information. https://www.floorball.org.nz/mens-wfcq-2026

events.id: Whānau Print Making-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whānau Print Making
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us at Zealandia these school holidays for a free, nature inspired craft event!

Local artist Tayla Hartemink has designed a series of unique stamps featuring beautiful native manu and ika, perfect for decorating cards, and printing fabric and clothing. A limited amount of materials will be provided, but we encourage you to bring your own T-shirts, tote bags, tea towels, or other fabric items to personalise with these stunning designs.

Tayla Hartemink (Tūhoe) is a multi-media artist, illustrator and creative workshop facilitator based in Te-Whanganui-ā-Tara. Tayla’s work is rooted in a deep connection to whakapapa and indigenous storytelling. Her work incorporates graphic design, painting, print-making and traditional motifs. Through her artwork she hopes to inspire and empower people to connect with Te Ao Māori.

Suitable for all ages— drop in, get hands-on, and make something colourful to take home!

This show event will be held in the Visitor Centre Foyer and is suitable for all ages, normal admission to the sanctuary applies. Overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.

events.id: Weber Bros 'The Circus'-Avalon Park, Taita Drive, Avalon, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Weber Bros 'The Circus'
events.venue: Avalon Park, Taita Drive, Avalon, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Join us for an unforgettable experience at ’The Circus’, where excitement and wonder come alive under the grand big top! Prepare to be amazed by exhilarating performers showcasing death-defying acts that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

From the heart-pounding thrills of the Globe of Death to the jaw-dropping spectacle of the human cannon, each act promises a breathtaking display of skill and bravery. Marvel at our dazzling aerialists as they soar through the air, and don’t miss the delightful slapstick comedy that adds a lighthearted touch to this extraordinary show and so much more.

This 2-hour family-friendly event features international artists whose captivating performances will charm audiences of all ages. Bring your family and friends for a night filled with laughter, gasps of astonishment, and memories to cherish forever.

Experience the magic of the circus like never before.

The yoga exercises from Yoga in Daily Life Level 1 and 2 are designed for beginners and those who want to build a firm foundation to their existing practice. Includes: yoga exercises to increase flexibility and strength of muscles and improve the function of internal organs; yogic breathing to reduce stress and anxiety; traditional pranayama, relaxation and meditation techniques.

events.venue: Amador, 80 Willis Street, Wellington
events.description:
Come join us for the newest weekly ritual on a Tuesday night at one of the coolest little venues on Willis St!
You and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with your Gee Quiz host Craig.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.

events.name: Gardens Magic Concert Series
events.venue: Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Presented by Wellington City Council, Gardens Magic is back in January 2026 with its iconic Concert Series, Light Display, Kids Garden Trail, and Kids Explorer Days.

The Gardens Magic Concert Series will once again fill the January summer nights with the sounds of our capital’s vivacious talent, set in the Botanic Gardens ki Paekākā Soundshell. The free concerts will start with a warm-up solo act from 7pm, before the main act, 8pm - 9.15pm. Come early to grab a good picnic spot and stay after to take in the stunning Light Display.

Concerts are on Tuesdays to Sundays, with Sunday afternoons from 1pm to 3.15pm kept as a backup day.

Light Display on 9pm - 10.30pm daily, 6 - 25 Jan 2026
Kids Gardens Trail on 9am - 5pm, daily, 6 - 25 Jan

events.id: Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Floral Bunny: CANCELLED-Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Floral Bunny: CANCELLED
events.venue: Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

events.id: Moon Jam Nite-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Moon Jam Nite
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Get your 15 minutes of fame at Newtown's famous Moon Jam Nite, every Tuesday from 7.30pm

The evening starts off as a regular open mic, and transforms into a full on jam towards the end.

Put your moniker into the sign up sheet, and own your time slot. You can call upon the many talented muso's available to help you play your slot.

A full stage with electric guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, mics, lights and full support from our sound tech.

Bring your own songs, poems, and friends (and make some new ones too)

Come along for dinner, drink specials & enjoy the show!
events.description:
Get your 15 minutes of fame at Newtown's famous Moon Jam Nite, every Tuesday from 7.30pm The evening starts off as a regular open mic, and transforms into a full on jam towards the end.
Put your moniker into the sign up sheet, and own your time slot.
You can call upon the many talented muso's available to help you play your slot.
A full stage with electric guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, mics, lights and full support from our sound tech.
Bring your own songs, poems, and friends (and make some new ones too) Come along for dinner, drink specials & enjoy the show!

events.id: Plant & Learn in the WELLfed Garden (2026)-54 Hampshire Street, New Zealand 5024,54 Hampshire St, Cannons Creek, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Plant & Learn in the WELLfed Garden (2026)
events.venue: 54 Hampshire Street, New Zealand 5024,54 Hampshire St, Cannons Creek, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Plant & Learn in the WELLfed Garden (2026)
ALL WELCOME! Join us for "Plant and Learn" in the WELLfed Garden again in 2026

Join the WELLfed Garden crew each Wednesday morning to spend some time gardening and learning!

No experience or skills are necessary - our awesome team can teach you about when and how garden tasks need doing and lots of skills you can use in your own garden.

Garden tasks include composting, seed starting, seed sowing, plant health, biology first gardening (working with nature).
Sharing morning tea (delicious WELLfed snacks provided!) is also a great chance to connect with other awesome humans in our community.

Pre-schoolers are welcome during term time and during the school holidays you are welcome to bring school-aged kids. They can get stuck in and connect with Papatunuku as well, or there is space for outdoor play. Children must be supervised by their caregivers whilst onsite.

Plant and Learn session are weather and staffing dependent - we will post in the event if we won't be gardening due to rain or sickness

WIDance are excited to partner with the Royal Academy of Dance for the second TIAHO summer school!

Tiaho offers fun, accessible dance classes for students with disabilities, encouraging confidence, self-expression and well-being.

Daily two-hour workshops exploring movement and creativity culminating in a studio presentation in celebration of the students' achievements.

events.id: Shai Hulud Aotearoa 2026 - Wellington-154 Vivian Street, New Zealand 6011,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Shai Hulud Aotearoa 2026 - Wellington
events.venue: 154 Vivian Street, New Zealand 6011,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Shai Hulud Aotearoa 2026 - Wellington
SHAI HULUD
AOTEAROA TOUR 2026

14 JAN - VALHALLA, WELLINGTON
15 JAN - WHAMMY, AUCKLAND


TICKETS UTR.CO.NZ

Following their triumphant reunion show with former vocalist Geert van der Velde at Furnace Fest 2024, legendary American progressive metalcore band Shai Hulud is thrilled to announce their return to the road in 2025. The upcoming world tour will mark Shai Hulud’s first extended run of shows in over a decade, featuring van der Velde on vocals.

The Furnace Fest performance was a monumental moment in the band’s history, bringing together, for the first time since 2004, the full lineup that recorded the landmark 2003 album That Within Blood Ill-Tempered. For many fans, it was the first chance to see van der Velde back on the mic, and he did not disappoint. If anything, his vocals have grown stronger and even more ferocious with time, while the chemistry on stage was undeniable, a testament to the band’s enduring spirit and technical mastery. Fans and newcomers alike were left buzzing about the energy, emotion, and sheer force of the performance.

While the upcoming world tour will feature Shai Huluds current lineup, van der Velde will helm vocal duties for all shows, delivering performances that span the band’s celebrated catalog, including a spotlight on tracks from That Within Blood Ill-Tempered.

Shai Hulud is back. Stronger. Louder. And more pissed off than ever before and happy to return to Aotearoa after twenty years
events.description:
The Furnace Fest performance was a monumental moment in the band’s history, bringing together, for the first time since 2004, the full lineup that recorded the landmark 2003 album That Within Blood Ill-Tempered.
For many fans, it was the first chance to see van der Velde back on the mic, and he did not disappoint.
If anything, his vocals have grown stronger and even more ferocious with time, while the chemistry on stage was undeniable, a testament to the band’s enduring spirit and technical mastery.
Fans and newcomers alike were left buzzing about the energy, emotion, and sheer force of the performance.
Shai Hulud is back.

events.name: Creative Writing - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join writer and creative practitioner Anna Persson for this 3-day workshop for those aged 11-16 with an interest in stories, writing, and expressing their creativity. Each day, we’ll explore different creative prompts, incorporating collaborative games and fun into the writing process. We’ll touch on using our senses to enrich our stories, creating interesting characters from scratch, and writing inspired by art and paintings.

This programme is suited for teens ages 11-16 years of age.

Students will need to bring writing materials (pen, paper/notebook), a water bottle, and lunch.

Duration: Three day workshop from 10 am - 2 pm daily. Wednesday 14 - Friday 16 January.

events.id: Pick Your Own Sunflowers - A Fundraiser For Hōkai Tahi-Stolte Ag Dairy Farm, 153 Wiltons Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Pick Your Own Sunflowers - A Fundraiser For Hōkai Tahi
events.venue: Stolte Ag Dairy Farm, 153 Wiltons Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Come and enjoy the simple joy of sunflowers, grown by the Stolte Dairy Farm team!

Wander through the sunflower field, pick your own blooms, and take home a bunch of sunshine - all while supporting Hōkai Tahi, a local not-for-profit organisation providing free pregnancy, baby loss, and perinatal support to whānau across the Wairarapa.

Updates on opening days/times, bloom availability etc will be posted on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/17bUymPdWU/

Event details:
- Open Wednesdays and Saturdays throughout January 2026
- Entry: FREE (koha welcome)
- Sunflowers: $2 per stem
- Location: Gate entry just past 153 Wiltons Road on the left-hand side - look for the flag when we’re open
- Payment options: Cash, bank transfer, or online via debit card

What to bring:
• Your own secateurs or scissors
• Sun hat, sunscreen, and water bottle

The field includes a small number of florist-grade blooms, with the majority being the classic bright yellow sunflowers we all love. Whether you bring a picnic and stay for a while, or just pop in for some photos and a quick ice block treat, it’s a beautiful way to support a local charity and enjoy the season.

Please note: Opening days and times are weather and bloom-dependent.
Dates may change, and updates will always be posted on Facebook

We can’t wait to welcome you to the farm!

events.name: Pottery for tweens & teens - Creative arts holiday programme
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for this fun and relaxing two hour pottery where you'll handcraft your own garden orb from clay with experienced ceramicist, Christine Winbush. You will have the option of creating your orb into a hanging planter or a unique decoration for your room or garden. Teens will learn basic hand-building techniques to create with clay.

The pieces will be decorated with underglaze and fired. All art will be ready for pickup approximately 3 weeks later depending on drying times.

Recommended age for this workshop is tweens & teens ages 10 and above.

events.id: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Explore Stonehenge Aotearoa at Your Own Pace

Our self-guided tour includes a map and a 12-minute audio-visual presentation to help you uncover the secrets of the henge. Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.

A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun. The bigger your group, the better the experience!

Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.
Available during our opening hours: 10 AM – 4 PM.

events.name: Art workshops for children
events.venue: Toi Mahara, 20 Mahara Place, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Toi MAHARA is offering two workshops for children during the school holidays

Make a transfer print of a New Zealand insect
In this workshop with artist and teacher Chrissie Sallis, children will create a transfer print of an insect from Aotearoa.
Children can create their own drawings or make a print from found images.
Suitable for age 7+.
All materials are provided.

Draw your favourite character
In this workshop with artist and teacher Kimbra Taylor, children will draw a favourite film or TV character. Kimbra will teach the children how to engage their right hemisphere to enhance their drawing skills.
Suitable for 10–14 year olds.
All materials are provided. Children can bring an image of a favourite character if there is one they’d particularly like to draw.

Cost is $10/child/workshop.

Book for all the workshops via our website: www.toimahara.nz/events/

Throughout January, we're also offering free art-making drop-ins. Find out more: https://toimahara.nz/events/school-holiday-fun-at-toi-mahara-2/

events.id: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join a Shared Guided Tour and experience Stonehenge Aotearoa through the eyes of an expert. In this 90-minute journey, you’ll uncover how ancient cultures measured time, tracked the Sun and Moon, and connected the heavens with life on Earth.

Your experience begins with a captivating introduction and a 15-minute audio-visual presentation explaining how the Henge works. Then, step outside with your guide for a detailed tour of the stone circle, where astronomy, archaeology, and mythology come together in one unforgettable setting.

Perfect for visitors seeking a deeper understanding of the stars and stories that shaped human history.

events.long_description:
Do you want to meet fellow sapphics but you don't feel super comfortable in environments that are loud and pressure you to drink alcohol and flirt? events.id: Yoga in the Sanctuary-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga in the Sanctuary
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Find peace and tranquility while participating in our Sanctuary Yoga sessions this summer.

Meet at the Visitor Centre and take a calming hīkoi/walk up Lake Road to Tūī Terrace in the heart of the valley. Lay out your mats and be led in a hatha yoga session that is uniquely facilitated with a te ao Māori kaupapa.

Our Wednesday evening sessions run from 5.30-7.30pm, and our morning sessions on Sundays run from 9.00-11.00am.

This experience is outdoors so make sure to dress appropriately. There will be a gentle 15 min walk up and back from the site along an accessible path. These sessions are designed to suit all levels of ability.

If you have your own yoga mat then bring it along, as while Zealandia does have a few to loan out, supplies are limited.

In the event of bad weather the session may be moved indoors but may have a short walk out in the valley before hand, or else cancelled with credit offered to customers for another session.

Terms and conditions:
Non-member ticket price includes general admission to the sanctuary on the day of the yoga session.
Poor weather conditions may result in the event being moved indoors, or else cancelled with refunds or credit offered to customers for another session.
Photos and video of these sessions may be taken for marketing purposes. If you do not want your photo taken, please advise staff on the day.

events.id: SHAI HULUD-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: SHAI HULUD
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
SHAI HULUD
AOTEAROA TOUR 2026
TICKETS UTR.CO.NZ
Following their triumphant reunion show with former vocalist Geert van der Velde at Furnace Fest 2024, legendary American progressive metalcore band Shai Hulud is thrilled to announce their return to the road in 2025. The upcoming world tour will mark Shai Hulud’s first extended run of shows in over a decade, featuring van der Velde on vocals.
The Furnace Fest performance was a monumental moment in the band’s history, bringing together, for the first time since 2004, the full lineup that recorded the landmark 2003 album That Within Blood Ill-Tempered. For many fans, it was the first chance to see van der Velde back on the mic, and he did not disappoint. If anything, his vocals have grown stronger and even more ferocious with time, while the chemistry on stage was undeniable, a testament to the band’s enduring spirit and technical mastery. Fans and newcomers alike were left buzzing about the energy, emotion, and sheer force of the performance.
While the upcoming world tour will feature Shai Huluds current lineup, van der Velde will helm vocal duties for all shows, delivering performances that span the band’s celebrated catalog, including a spotlight on tracks from That Within Blood Ill-Tempered.
Shai Hulud is back. Stronger. Louder. And more pissed off than ever before and happy to return to Aotearoa after twenty years

Fans and newcomers alike were left buzzing about the energy, emotion, and sheer force of the performance.
While the upcoming world tour will feature Shai Huluds current lineup, van der Velde will helm vocal duties for all shows, delivering performances that span the band’s celebrated catalog, including a spotlight on tracks from That Within Blood Ill-Tempered.
Shai Hulud is back.

events.id: Sunset Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Sunset Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.
Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

events.venue: Whitby,Porirua Pa, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Trapline Training
Have you thought about what you can do to help restore your local ngahere or native bush?

One of the things you should consider is to set up a few predator traps on your section or help with established trapline around one of the local reserves.

We are having a Trapline training session on the 15 of January (7:00-9:00pm) in Whitby.

If you want to know more, drop us a line with your contact details and address. We'd love to get you started.

events.id: Jackie Bristow and Barry Saunders @ Wellington Bluegrass Society-Abandoned Petone,38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Jackie Bristow and Barry Saunders @ Wellington Bluegrass Society
events.venue: Abandoned Petone,38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Jackie Bristow and Barry Saunders @ Wellington Bluegrass Society
Wow, you're in for a treat with this showcase concert featuring two great singer songwriters who meld perfectly!

Jackie Bristow was brought up in Gore, honed her craft in the pubs and clubs of Sydney, Australia and now lives in Nashville Tennessee, USA. Jackie has released five critically acclaimed studio albums and spent the last few years opening for Chris Isaak, Boz Skaggs, Bonnie Raitt and Tommy Emmanuel, as well as headlining her own shows.

Joined by Barry Saunders, A genuine Kiwi music hero, and singer and principal songwriter for the legendary country band The Warratahs. Barry has also had a parallel solo career spanning six albums, along with collaborations with Sam Hunt and Delaney Davidson.

Jackie's life was turned around in 2020 whilst visiting New Zealand, when the Covid-19 lockdown hit. Unable to return to her home in Nashville, she “made the best of the crazy world” of that time by focusing her creative energy in new directions. A silver lining saw Jackie connecting with Barry Saunders and an amazing friendship and music partnership was made. Jackie and Barry went on to perform shows around New Zealand and releasing their debut single collaboration Good Miles to Go in 2024.

"We're two seasoned songwriters who have teamed up as we love singing together and our voices and songs work so well together.

"We combine our catalogues of songs. We perform as a duo, with two acoustic guitars and two voices, harmonies, harp, including some solo performances and stories.

Jackie Bristow and Barry Saunders - Good Miles To Go

events.id: Festival of Pots and Garden Art 2026-Anam Cara Gardens, 150 Rangiuru Road, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Festival of Pots and Garden Art 2026
events.venue: Anam Cara Gardens, 150 Rangiuru Road, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
The Festival of Pots and Garden Art will take place from January 15 to January 19, 2026, at Anam Cara Gardens in Ōtaki, coinciding with the Wellington Anniversary weekend. This vibrant event celebrates pottery and garden art, providing a platform for both emerging and established artists to showcase their work and engage with the community.

The festival features a diverse array of activities, including:

-Exhibitions and Artisan Market: Stunning displays of pottery and garden art for visitors to admire with the chance to purchase unique pieces to take home.
-"Have a Go" Opportunities: Interactive sessions allow attendees to dive into hands-on experiences, learn new techniques, and create their own pieces.
-Live Demonstrations: Artists will showcase their creative processes, offering insights into the art of pottery and other art forms.
-Discussions: Engaging talks exploring the history and evolution of guest artist's pottery and artwork.

Additionally, Friday night will feature extended hours until 8 PM, allowing visitors to enjoy food options and picnic opportunities while listening to live music in the gardens.

The festival promises a welcoming atmosphere with both indoor and outdoor spaces. Attendees can enjoy refreshments at an onsite café, creating a perfect spot for relaxation and socialising with fellow art enthusiasts in the park-like surroundings.

Mark your calendars for this enriching celebration of artistry and creativity. The Festival of Pots and Garden Art promises to be a memorable experience for all attendees, whether artists or art lovers.

events.id: Whānau Sculpture - Creative arts holiday programme-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whānau Sculpture - Creative arts holiday programme
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Children and their caregivers are invited to learn how to sculpt with clay!

Our popular whānau workshops are designed to allow tamariki and their caregivers work on their own projects side-by-side and learn basic hand-building techniques from our wonderful tutor Christine Winbush.

The pieces will be fired once, (bisqued) and can be decorated with paint at home. All creatures will be ready for pickup approximately 3 weeks later depending on drying times.

Recommended age for children is 6 and up. The booking is for one child and one adult and an addition.

events.name: Quercus @ Vogelmorn Upstairs
events.venue: 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Spend an evening basking in soulful folk music, at our free Thursday gig. Quercus are duo, from Tāmaki Makaurau and the UK, who formed after spending three months busking around Europe on bicycle!
*Free Event / Koha Welcomed*
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.

events.long_description:

This quiz night we are hosting is a fundraiser to cover some of the production costs.

events.id: Summer League in the City 2026-570 Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Summer League in the City 2026
events.venue: 570 Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Back by popular demand, Summer League in the City returns for 2026.
Similar to leagues at Harcourt Park, Summer League in the City will be an 8 week, PDGA Sanctioned league, run on Thursday nights between Jan 15th and March 5th, 2026.
League Layout:
Weeks 1-4 - Gold Layout (Long Clubhouse 10/Normal Eastern

Weeks 5-8 - Black Layout (Main tees both sides)
This year will feature three ratings-based divisions:
Gold - 900 and Above
Red - Between 850 and 899
Green - Below 850
Prizes:
This league is mainly about ratings points and bragging rights (did someone say distance multiplier?), but with enough players, we will put up a small prize for the player who shoots the highest round above their rating.
Summer in the City Entry Fee:
$15 for Greater Wellington Disc Golf members.
$30 for Non-members.
$5 for Single Round/Casual Play
*Entry Fee does not include Berhampore Greens Fee
(No better time to become a Mornington Club Member)
Please pay your Summer League in the City fee directly into the GW League Account and use "City26" & your last name as reference.
KiwiBank: 38-9016-0650973-03
Otherwise you can pay in cash on the night.
Please meet in the Adelaide Road carpark a few minutes before 6:30 for the creation of cards.

events.id: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia-The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 25- 39 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃
#speeddating

events.id: Altum Academy Open Days-66 Albemarle Road, Wilton, Northland 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Altum Academy Open Days
events.venue: 66 Albemarle Road, Wilton, Northland 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Altum Classical Academy’s upcoming open days are an invitation to discover what a quality education could mean for your child. There will be two information sessions. One on a weekday evening and one on a weekend afternoon. Families interested in understanding more about classical education, and Altum, are invited to join.
You’ll find it’s 90 minutes well spent.
30 minutes will be spent sharing information about the school, curriculum and ethos.
The following 30 minutes will consist of a question/answer time; where the principal, school board and teachers field questions from parents and interested parties.
The last 30 minutes will be spent touring the grounds and viewing Altum’s school facilities.
Altum Classical Academy is starting next year in Wellington. It’s a charter high school that believes that every student should be given a chance to excel, whatever their circumstances. Take the chance. Make a change.
Dates:
Thursday 15th January, 7:00-8:30pm
Sunday 25th January, 2:00-3:30pm
Free to attend, but please register so we know you're coming.

events.long_description:
Get ready because Wellington comedy show Silly Billies is about to fly off the rails! 
Hosted by two of Welly's most fearlessly experimental comedians (Mo Munn and Aaron James Douglas), Silly Billies is serving up a wild night of alternative comedy jam packed with laughs and crowdwork!
Joined by some of the city’s sharpest and strangest comedians - Silly Billies will let comedians run wild and anything goes. Stand-up, sketch, improv, character, musical comedy - no rules, just chaos and comedy.

events.id: Summer Camp Launch Party | Half Angel and King Hit -San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Summer Camp Launch Party | Half Angel and King Hit
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Start your new year off right with two of this city's premier alternative acts! 

Half/Angel toe the line of alt-rock, post punk & ambient psychedelia. They unpredictably juxtapose intimate, soft, vocals and delicate instrumental passages with raucous, high-energy outbursts. They’re exciting to listen to, and their singles ‘Debt Collector’ & ‘Boat Ramp + Jitterbug’ will have you struggling to put them in a box and itching to hear what’s next.
New noise in the scene, King Hit, is a Te Whanganui A Tara based four piece that blends together the jarring-ness of shoe-gaze, the punch of hardcore, with the sombreness of midwest emo. After a successful release of their debut single ‘asterisk’, King Hit are poised to release their follow up single ‘Sap’, an grungy-yet-ethereal longing love song.

San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance
events.description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!
Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.
Start your new year off right with two of this city's premier alternative acts!
Half/Angel toe the line of alt-rock, post punk & ambient psychedelia.
They unpredictably juxtapose intimate, soft, vocals and delicate instrumental passages with raucous, high-energy outbursts.

events.id: Women's Football Training-Te Whaea Artificial Turf, Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Women's Football Training
events.venue: Te Whaea Artificial Turf, Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington
events.long_description:
Try Football This Summer — Free Sessions for All Women*!

Ever wanted to try football but didn’t know where to start?
Or keen to get back into the game after a break?

The Women’s Football Centre is hosting free, beginner-friendly football lessons for women aged 18+ (no upper age limit!), designed to help you build skills, confidence, and community this summer.
No experience? No worries, this is for you!

You’ll learn the basics of the game — passing, dribbling, movement, teamwork — in a supportive and empowering environment created specifically for new and returning players. You'll also have a chance to socialise and meet new people! All sessions are run by women coaches and supported by an awesome volunteer crew.

Stay after the session for Extra Time, where you can try goalkeeping or get one-on-one guidance from our coaches.

Bring a bottle of water and your sports shoes or football boots, and get ready to give football a go in a fun, inclusive space.

No sign ups or registrations! Just turn up to any session and we'll see you there!

*including cis women, transfeminine and trans women

events.id: Jackie Bristow and Barry Saunders @ Wellington Bluegrass Society-Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Jackie Bristow and Barry Saunders @ Wellington Bluegrass Society
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Wow, you're in for a treat with this showcase concert featuring two great singer songwriters who meld perfectly!

Jackie Bristow was brought up in Gore, honed her craft in the pubs and clubs of Sydney, Australia and now lives in Nashville Tennessee, USA. Jackie has released five critically acclaimed studio albums and spent the last few years opening for Chris Isaak, Boz Skaggs, Bonnie Rait and Tommy Emmanuel, as well as headlining her own shows.

Joined by Barry Saunders, A genuine Kiwi music hero, and singer and principal songwriter for the legendary country band The Warratahs. Barry has also had a parallel solo career spanning six albums, along with collaborations with Sam Hunt and Delaney Davidson.

Jackie's life was turned around in 2020 whilst visiting New Zealand, when the Covid-19 lockdown hit. Unable to return to her home in Nashville, she “made the best of the crazy world” of that time by focusing her creative energy in new directions. A silver lining saw Jackie connecting with Barry Saunders and an amazing friendship and music partnership was made. Jackie and Barry went on to perform shows around New Zealand and releasing their debut single collaboration Good Miles to Go in 2024.

"We're two seasoned songwriters who have teamed up as we love singing together and our voices and songs work so well together

"We combine our catalogues of songs. We perform as a duo, with two acoustic guitars and two voices, harmonies, harp, including some solo performances and stories".

events.id: Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Once a month - Recurrent event-8 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Make friends & BlaBla Language Exchange Wellington - Once a month - Recurrent event
events.venue: 8 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Welcome to BlaBla & Make Friends Events!
A fun, friendly place to meet new people, make friends from around the world, practice languages, and just enjoy good vibes

................
What to Expect
Forget the boring setup — this is a free-flow mingle event!
No fixed tables, just conversations.
English and the local language are the main ones.
Want to practice another language? Ask one of our organizers or find someone who does!
Need help finding a partner? Try our matchmaking service:
http://blablalanguageexchange.com/.../speak-connect...
................
A Few Simple Rules
To keep things fun and respectful for everyone:
Register on our website before you come.
Please order at least one drink when you arrive (venue rule).
No outside food or drinks.
Be kind to the staff and help keep the place clean.
Respect others — good vibes only!
Breaking the rules can lead to a ban without warning.
................
Photos & Safety
Photos/videos are often taken to capture the fun! If you’d rather not appear, just let our photographer know.
Keep your belongings safe — we can’t be responsible for lost items.
................
Want to Get Involved?
Skip the fees and become part of the BlaBla Crew!
Event Organizer: Help us bring BlaBla to more cities → https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers
Photographer/Videographer: Capture the moments and share your talent → https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/photographer
................
A Quick Note
We reuse the same Facebook event links, so we update event dates about 20 minutes after the start time.
The dates and participant numbers you see on Facebook might not be accurate — please ignore them.
................
More Info
For news, updates, and global events: www.blablacommunity.com
................
BlaBla is active in 150+ cities worldwide — come join the fun and make international friends!

events.venue: Ranui Essentials, 284c Dry River Road, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Exclusive evening - Discover the Magic of Martinborough Nights!

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

Watch the sun set over the lavender fields, pick your own bunch of lavender, and explore our charming lavender shop.
Indulge in delightful lavender treats that will tantalize your taste buds.

Limited tickets available – only 20 per night!

Entry: $80 per Adult and $50 Children under 18 years (includes stargazing, lavender flowers and treats)

Please note: No pets and no smoking allowed.

In case of unfavorable stargazing conditions, we will contact you on the day to offer a refund or reschedule.

events.id: The Music Of Django Reinhardt-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: The Music Of Django Reinhardt
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Les Tripes ,(French for 'The Guts'), Present:
The Music of Django Reinhardt

Dynamic woodwind virtuoso Oscar Lavën joins forces with swing guitarist specialists Adrian Jensen & James Quick, and double bass raconteur Robert Henderson to present a homage to the unique music of guitarist Django Reinhardt and violinist Stephane Grapelli. Together they will create hard-working interpretations of the infectious, foot-stomping, film noir music known in 1940s Paris as Hot Club.

9pm Downbeat. Free Entry, Koha Encouraged

events.name: Men's WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Korea vs Japan
events.venue: Ākau Tangi Sports Centre,72 Kemp Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's WFCQ 2026 AOFC | Korea vs Japan
The AOFC Qualification is the Asia–Oceania region’s pathway to the Men’s World Floorball Championships. Ten teams are split into two groups and battle through pool play. The top teams advance to the playoffs and only four teams will qualify for the Men’s World Floorball Championships in Finland in December.

Join us in welcoming teams from:
> New Zealand
> Australia
> Singapore
> Thailand
> Philippines
> Japan
> Korea
> Hong Kong, China
> China
> Solomon Islands

Be there when history happens.

Whether you’re a floorball fan or brand new to the sport, this is your chance to watch world-class international competition on home soil.

Tickets are now available. You have the option of purchasing adult only, child only or family passes in the following options:
> Tournament passes
> Full-day passes
> Evening passes for 7PM games
> Finals passes for 19 January

Secure your seat early.
events.description:

Join us in welcoming teams from: > New Zealand > Australia > Singapore > Thailand > Philippines > Japan > Korea > Hong Kong, China > China > Solomon Islands Be there when history happens.
Whether you’re a floorball fan or brand new to the sport, this is your chance to watch world-class international competition on home soil.
Tickets are now available.

events.id: VOCAL REBIRTH RETREAT-Strathean Retreat Centre,201 Old Hautere Rd, Hautere, Otaki 5582, New Zealand, Otaki-All Events In
events.name: VOCAL REBIRTH RETREAT
events.venue: Strathean Retreat Centre,201 Old Hautere Rd, Hautere, Otaki 5582, New Zealand, Otaki
events.long_description:
VOCAL REBIRTH RETREAT
LIMITED PLACES REMAINING - BOOK NOW!!!

** Are you looking for a new, empowered sense of your voice? **

** Are you keen to dive deep into your energy and your connectio with yourself? **

You are warmly invited to join this unique FOUR DAY Heartsong Healing weekend HIGH-VIBTATIONAL retreat in a beautiful venue on the Kapiti Coast

Come, explore and celebrate the powerful energies of Vocal Rebirth together with other women, led by international Voice expert Bryony Rogers, originally from the UK now living in Kapiti.

This nurturing and deeply enjoyable retreat is a fabulous opportunity to dive deep into powerful Voice Empowerment, Singing, Conscious Sounding, Song work, Energy Healing and Visioning - all in peaceful, beautiful natural surroundings, and within a framework of mid-summer celebrations.

Also included are daily Yoga Sessions, Yin Yoga and Sound Healing, Qigong, Cacao Ceremony, Meditation, an Extra special Sauna experience and Nature Connection.

This retreat is open to any woman of any level of confidence and skill with her voice. The work will support those who are not confident with their voice and will also give new skills and tools to more confident singers and speakers.

Empower yourself through exploring deeply uplifting and energizing practices which enable you to connect with your authentic voice in an embodied way!

The powerful and transformative Voice practices will be held within the context of ritual, meditation and profound nature connection - including a healing cacao ceremony.

All these practices have a positive effect on the physical, emotional, mental and spiritual senses and are a great stress-relieving energizer!!

There will also be time and space to rest, journal, to be in nature in an unstructured way, to integrate the powerful energies of the Voice work, and to receive healing.

Look at the retreat website on https://www.songofawakening.com/vocal-rebirth-retreat

All of this wonder will be taught in a held safely facilitated space by Bryony from Heartsong Healing. Bryony has been working with the Voice and Energy in a dedicated conscious way for 27 years, after these practices helped her heal from chronic fatigue syndrome in the 1990s.

Bryony says:
** 'I have seen enormous positive change in the people I work with. My work has developed immensely over the past five years and I can truly say that it is transformational.' **

You can see many positive testimonials on her Heartsong Healing Facebook and Google reviews page and on her website https://www.heartsonghealing.life

** Thank you, I loved every minute of it! Your teachings have been life-changing. My voice is becoming more empowered and I'm excited about what my future will bring' ** Alexandra Xena

Bryony says - ** I can't wait to gather for a deep sacred time with you in this deeply beautiful location and to share powerful healing and uplifting energy work with you. **

This retreat will be held at the quality accommodation of Strathean Retreat Centre - including extremely comfortable hotel standard beds - and with exceptional, quality vegetarian food.

This Retreat is open to all women - please make contact to receive the participants questionnaire.

This retreat will include high quality vegetarian food, comfortable accommodation, expert training, nurturing support, great company and deep heartfelt connection and group healing, as well as a number of valuable resources.

Here is the website with all booking information and also with some wonderful video testimonials from past participants of Bryony's retreats - https://www.songofawakening.com/vocal-rebirth-retreat

The investment for the Retreat is all-inclusive of quality accommodation, high quality food, all facilitation, expert training, special facilities, resources, sauna, preparation group call and follow up Zoom call.

SECURE YOUR PLACE WITH ONLY A DEPOSIT PAYMENT on the website - https://www.songofawakening.com/vocal-rebirth-retreat/

It will be possible to book a 121 voice coaching (online) or an energy healing session (distance or in person) with Bryony to take place before or after the retreat

Be in touch by phone or on messenger or whatsapp or book in a video conversation here - https://calendly.com/bryonyheartsong/free-consult

To fill in the participants questionnaire - click here -

Cancellation Policy:
If Heartsong Healing needs to cancel the Retreat all payments are fully refunded. 100% deposit refund for cancellation 60+ days before retreat start date. 50% deposit refund for cancellation 30-59 days before retreat start date. 0% deposit refund for cancellation 0-29 days before retreat start date.
