events.name: LIQUID PRAYER - Somatic Dance
events.venue: Thistle Hall Community Venue,293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
LIQUID PRAYER - Somatic Dance
𝐋𝐈𝐐𝐔𝐈𝐃 𝐏𝐑𝐀𝐘𝐄𝐑 - (𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐧) 𝐚 𝐬𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐣𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐲...

Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of ritual, connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.

Tickets: https://events.humanitix.com/liquid-prayer

🌑 𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐚𝐲 𝟏𝟔 𝐉𝐚𝐧𝐮𝐚𝐫𝐲
🕕 𝟕–𝟗.𝟑𝟎𝐩𝐦
📍 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐥𝐞 𝐇𝐚𝐥𝐥, 𝐖𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐭𝐨𝐧
🎟️ $𝟑𝟓–$𝟓𝟓
✨ 𝐒𝐨𝐛𝐞𝐫 · 𝐍𝐨𝐧-𝐣𝐮𝐝𝐠𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐥 · 𝐀𝐥𝐥 𝐰𝐞𝐥𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐞 · 𝐍𝐨 𝐞𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐝𝐞𝐝

No door sales - tickets must be purchased online prior to the event.

As we land in the new year, we gather in reverence of what it means to be human...each of us; the entire ocean in a drop. When we connect to the rivers that flow within, we are reminded of our divinity: we are nature and we can find liberation in our sense of belonging as a part of the whole.

This is a space to FLOW FREELY, FEEL FULLY and anchor in any new year intentions as we transition from the year of the snake to the year of the fire horse.

We’ll begin our ritual with ceremonial cacao and a grounding meditation, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. Barefoot and phone-free, you’re invited to drop deep into free-form movement, awakening the divine currents that flow through you.

Come as you are.
Move with what you feel.
Leave feeling empowered, connected, and alive

𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐬...

𝐉𝐞𝐧𝐧𝐚 𝐉𝐨𝐚𝐧 | 𝐄𝐦𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫
Jenna Joan | Embodiment Facilitator
Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.

𝐒𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐜 𝐒𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐚 | 𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐃𝐉
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide dancers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

events.id: Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
Get your kids ready for a fun, screen-free holiday programme full of mindful, holistic activities. Vegan kai will be provided daily too!

About this Event

At Mindful Kids we will explore nature, get creative cooking and crafting, play music and dance, do mindfulness exercises and more in a peaceful, safe environment. The programme has been crafted with care to give your kids the best experience and will be facilitated by a NZ qualified primary school teacher.
The programme will run for three Fridays over the course of three weeks as per details below.
Times: Drop off time: 8.30am - 9am; Pick up time: 3pm - 3.30pm
Dates: Friday 16th January, Friday 23rd January, Friday 30th January
Location: Bhakti Lounge - 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro Wellington
What to bring: A drink bottle, sun protection, weather-appropriate clothing, regular Medic*tion, and walking shoes.
Age range: 7 - 10 year olds
General daily schedule: Each day will run according to the following structure incorporating the daily theme as per below.
8.30 - 9am - Drop off time
9am - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story, circle time
9.30am - Activity
10.30am - Morning tea time
11am - Activity
12.30pm - Lunch time
1.30pm - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story
1.45pm - Activity
2.30pm - Afternoon tea and pack up time
3 - 3.30pm - Pick up time

Activities for each day: Check out the cool activities we will do each day!

Cooking and Crafts Day -16th January
Vegan cooking class - Learn to make sushi, sweets and more..
Masterchef Jr contest
Table decorating and restaurant designing
Arts and crafts afternoon
Nature Day - 23rd January
Nature treasure hunt at Central Park
Decorating pots and gardening
Nature hike
Fun at the playground and flying fox
Picnic at the park
Music and Dance Day - 30th January
Make your own instruments
Disco dancing with disco ball and lights
Dress up costume play
Music and dance games
Talent quest
Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa. As well as being a qualified primary school teacher for six years, she also has a degree majoring in Psycholgy and Spanish, experience running a yoga and wellbeing student club at Victoria University and experience being a school Sports Coordinator. Additionally, she has taught in schools in Spain, been the Positive Behaviour for Learning Team Leader and has initiated mindfulness sessions for teachers at various schools. She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.
We hope to see you and your kids soon! :)

Gathering Shadows 2026
Hot Goth Summer has arrived!

Gathering Shadows, Aotearoa's biggest mini goth festival, returns for a two-night ritual at Pōneke's Valhalla in January.

This year's festival showcases artists from a wide range of styles while still honouring the ethos of crushed velvet and candelabras.

Night 1
* Erase Everything

* Talmar
* Dead Queens
* Integument
* Gravedigger (dj)

Night 2
* buffcat

* Varda
* TV DiSKO (dj)

events.id: Lavender Magic Flower Farm - Pick your own Lavender-Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Lavender Magic Flower Farm - Pick your own Lavender
events.venue: Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Snap the ultimate summer photo and come and enjoy the best of the Lavender Season from mid-December to mid-January, before the harvesting starts.

Early in the season we start picking English Lavender - short stem but beautifully scented and vibrant in colour. Then we pick the more traditional French Lavender. You can pick your own, take home to dry and enjoy the fragrance all year. Or just wander the garden.

There are rows of lavender and we have pockets of cut flowers nestled in our country garden with magnificent mountain views. The Tararua Ranges and foothills create a stunning backdrop to this romantic relaxing location. Wander through the garden and pick your favorite flowers or just sit and breathe. Ditch the city chaos for some quality time out, picking lavender flowers is relaxing.

Come alone, with a friend or friends to enjoy the experience with others or get a group of together.

At this Magic location you will tune into the sound of nature, see the butterflies flutter, listen to the bees buzz, the birds sing and the river flow.

What do you do?
- Pay on entry or book your on-line ticket (not really necessary)
- Take the scenic drive to Lavender Magic, approximately 75 minutes from Upper Hutt or Palmerston North, take the Mt Holdsworth turnoff from State Highway 2 just south of Masterton.
- Follow the purple signs that lead you to 61 Blakes Rd, Mt Holdsworth, Wairarapa
- When you are ready we will set you up with flower cutters
- We will let you know the cutting areas (which flowers we are cutting as they change throughout the season)
- You will pick a bunch of lavender or two or more!
- You will wander around the colourful, seasonal flowers and pick those if available. Like us on facebook and instagram for up to date details on what is available.
- You can create a bouquet, if available we will help.
- Visit the small lavender shop
- You can test the wonderful natural skincare products we will have for sale in our shop.

Other tips
Wear - Good footwear to explore the flower farm.
Wear - Sunglasses and slip, slop, slap if a sunny day as we get full sun.
Bring - A coffee, a treat or a picnic. BYO food is allowed. Or grab a coffee and something to eat from OUR PLACE CAFE who set up when available, check socials for details.
Bring - A camera to capture some of the magic and create memories.
A toilet is on site.

We accept cash and we have eftpos
Buying tickets online is not necessary, door sales are available.
$5 Entry 13 years and older, children 12 years and under are FREE!
$5 per bunch of lavender
Other flowers are available, priced per flower or per bunch
Ready made bouquets are available.
Bouquets can be pre-ordered to surprise someone special.


****NOTE - the garden is forever changing and different flowers are available for picking throughout the season. Lavender Magic facebook and instagram pages are good resources to show you what is available.

Photo credit - Light by Nika

events.id: Whānau Monoprinting - Creative arts holiday programme-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whānau Monoprinting - Creative arts holiday programme
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Of all the print making methods, mono printing is the most spontaneous, responsive and versatile, being the medium for everything from abstract expressionism to hyper photographic realism. Simple and direct with the minimum of equipment and media, mono printing is approachable for any age or ability level, yet the creative potential is unlimited.

This is a workshop whereby tweens/teens (minimum age 11) are encouraged to learn collectively with one of their favourite adults. Art can be created as a joint or individual project. The mission is just to have fun creating together in the fabulous Inverlochy print studio.

Each booking admits one adult and one young artist. Materials are supplied.

Duration: Two day workshop over Friday & Saturday, 16-17 January. 10 am - 2 pm daily.

events.id: Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Insecure Delusion Presents A Tribute To Tool
Missed the real deal? Live vicariously with Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool!

After a SOLD OUT Wellington show in early 2025 Insecure Delusion are back in the capital at the famous San Fran to give Tool fans a fix with their tribute to the greats - whether you missed out on the real deal or just want to get out amongst Tool fans again for a night of the best rock songs around - Insecure Delusion are ready to deliver this January 2026!

Rocking out from 9:00pm on Friday the 16th of January, enjoy the tunes that gave Tool a cult-like status amongst devoted fans. Playing fan favourites like The Pot, Stinkfist, Forty Six & 2 and others, it’s the perfect way to get your Tool fix whether you saw them in Auckland or didn't get the chance! It might seem crazy to run a tribute to the greats a couple of months after the legends themselves are here but these lads are a bit mad and they bring that energy to every show!

Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool take the stage with energy and passion for the genres and the musicianship that Tool is known for. An event not to be missed if you're a Tool fiend.

And just to make the night extra special, our friends from Down With The System will be opening with a killer set from the legends that are SOAD!

Earlybirds are available now but only for a limited ticket run! At only $25 per ticket (+ bf), your bank account will be thanking you. 🤘

"I’ve had the chance to see this band twice in Napier. They’re absolutely in keeping with Tool, powerful vocals, a fantastic drummer, and an all-round tight, talented group of guys. Great energy, great music, and genuinely good people." Rion R

"I was completely blown away by the tightness and musicality of these guys. All showcased amazing versatility on their chosen instruments. Would highly recommend to anyone who appreciates quality music. Thanks for an entertaining evening. Smashed it out of the park! " Micheal D


Please note: San Fran has a Supervised Licence meaning under 18s are welcome as long as they are supervised by a responsible adult (usually mum or dad).

events.id: Chillax 2026-Stansborough Farm,Kaiwhata Road, Te Wharau, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Chillax 2026
events.venue: Stansborough Farm,Kaiwhata Road, Te Wharau, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Chillax 2026
January 16–19th. Unplug. Unwind. Unleash.

About this Event




Get ready to CHILLAX - JAN 16-19th 2026!
Unplug. Unwind. Unleash.
This January, escape the chaos and step into a world where nature, music, and good vibes rule. CHILLAX is your long weekend paradise — a four-day off-the-grid camping festival set in stunning natural surrounds.
What to Expect:
Live Music from sunrise sessions to late-night jams
Cool off with a river swim
Farm Walks to reconnect with the land
Star Gazing under skies unspoiled by city lights
And the ultimate highlight: The Tropical Lotus Bell Tent Party - a vibrant explosion of colour, rhythm, and wild tropical energy!

No WiFi. No deadlines. Just freedom, fresh air, and a whole lot of fun.
Leave your phone. Bring your soul.
CHILLAX – The name says it all.

Our Chillax Festival gets better each year with the support of our wider Chilled whānau, it grows, matures, blossoms and develops into something new and exciting. We can't wait to see where this journey takes us next.
Without all your support, we wouldn't be able to add little extras each year - so THANK YOU ❤

Our Mission:
At the Chillax Festival, we provide a platform for new up and coming artists to present themselves and grow confidence in front of a friendly non-judgmental group of Chilled Kiwis! To bring happiness and enjoyment, surrounded by the beautiful nature our country has to offer, while focusing on sustainable, safe, chilled events.
Stansborough is a beautiful hidden farm, encompassing 2300 acres of hills, valleys, swimming holes and bush. At the Chillax Festival you can forget the rest of the world exists and leave all your worries behind.
Come for the day or stay the entire weekend it is up to you.
____________________________________________________________________________________________________



Enjoy live music over the long weekend from our 2026 Muso line up!
Our 2026 line up and onsite food options, will be confirmed 3 months prior to the event.
All ticket holders will be notified and kept up to date with all new information.
Here is a snaek peak of what we can confirm!...
Our 2026 Newest Guest Artist is "Raia"
Based in Palmerston North, Raia is a young, confident artist with an amazingly pure voice. By far our youngest performer yet, she has a voice and stage presence that far exceeds her age. Raia performs covers and original songs - both contemporary and old school - layering smooth vocals and charming arrangements across everything she does. Raia is excited to bring her artistry and love of music to this years Chillax Festival.
Our guest band for 2025 'The Archer Project' loved it as much as we loved them - so they are definately coming back!
Of course we will also have some of our other favourites returing! ____________________________________________________________________________________________________


ITINERARY


FRIDAY -

If you are extra keen to make the most of the whole weekend, why not join us on Friday. Arrive from midday and once you are set up you can enjoy the scenery, explore the lake and bush valleys, swim in the river, walk the hills and tracks or climb to the top and see the sea. Wind up the evening with some good company chilling in the barn.



SATURDAY - Event day #1


If you're not already enjoying our company, arrive anytime, pitch your tent, or simply park your car, familiarise yourself with the surroundings.

Live music throughout the day from a range of artists and mixed bands - some regular favourites and some new amazing talent! Maybe even some surprises for the kids.


We have another food truck attending this year, so bring cash if you want a break from the BBQ! Our wonderful friends from Sajitarian IceCreams will be selling their amazing Ice Creams, so bring cash and don't miss out!


This year the main tent will be open for everyone to enjoy throughout the weekend. I great place to relax, sit quietly and get out of the sun.

Saturday evening you can enjoy our CHILLAX tent party - 2026 is 'TROPICAL THEME' so don't forget your Hawaiian shirts and Tropical skirts!


After dark make sure you get in some amazing star gazing in our beautiful dark sky zone!



SUNDAY - Event day #2

Another chillaxed day with plenty of live music from bands.


Appreciate the beautiful rural setting, take a gentle stroll or a hike to the top of the hill to see the sea or simply chill out by the river in the sun with friends. Play a game and listen to music - the choice is yours. How about an evening Comedy Fest in the tent?!


MONDAY - Wellington Anniversary

Appreciate the beautiful rural setting, take a gentle stroll or a hike to the top of the hill to see the sea or simply chill out by the river in the sun with friends. Pack up when you are ready and then we look forward to seeing you all next year!

____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Parking will be provided by the camp site. Once you are set up you can enjoy the scenery, explore the lake and bush valleys, swim in the river, walk the hills and tracks or climb to the top to see the sea.
Fridges in the cottage will be available, so you can put your (clearly named) food in them to store. You may want to bring a chilli bin and ice for beverages.
For lunch and dinner on Saturday, the BBQs will be back for everyone to use. We are also trying to lock in a food truck to add a bit of variety for everyone, so bring your cash so you dont miss out!


WHAT YOUR TICKET INCLUDES
A line up of Live Entertainment over the long weekend by a variety of live singers, musicians and music under the stars.
Use of toilets (Tidy Eco toilet units with solar lights)
Use of BBQs and shared fridges and cash food truck options!
An amazing chilled weekend or day out and the additional option of off-the-grid camping on a beautiful private secret site in the Wairarapa!
Live music, great company, laughter and good memories!
____________________________________________________________________________________________________
Tickets to each consecutive event, will be offered first to those who attended the event previous, so be one of the first so you don’t miss out.
'Ms Magnifique Events' are invitation only and limited numbers are limited so don't miss out. This enables us to keep these events special, exclusive, desirable and personal.
If due to weather the festival must be cancelled, there will be a postponement date or the choice for a refund (minus a small admin fee). All funds are held by Eventbrite until the event date incase of cancellation and refunds.


WHAT TO BRING
Enough food for your group for the duration of your stay or money for onsite food options. There are NO shops close (only a very handy and exceptional cafe 10 mins drive away - but you will need to check opening hours!) You need to make sure you do not run out of food, drinks and WATER. We will have some spring water available which is ok for drinking, but most people prefer to bring bottled water.

BYO drinks and water
Eating and cooking utensils (plates, bowls, cups, cutlery etc)
Cash - for onsite food options
Tent, sleeping bag, pillow and bedroll (if you want one) - If you have a camper van or pop up you are also welcome to bring them.
Togs and towel for river swimming - 3 great swimming holes to choose from
Insect repellant, sun block and antihistamine
Happiness, laughter and awesome dance moves
Please bring bottled water if possible (we don’t suggest drinking the river water)
Torches (there is no power at the camp site so once it’s dark it is super dark! Unpolluted night skies with loads of stars and satellites)
Oh and don't forget, again......BYO water!


IMPORTANT INFO
Notes:
NO POWER at camp site.
NO CELL COVERAGE OR INTERNET (unless you climb to the top of the hill/mountain or visit the local cafe)
NO PETS (as there will be farm stock around)
ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING (we don’t want to start a bush fire, and you would unfortunately be liable)
POP UPS OR CAMPER VANS are ok, but please note there is no power or waste dumping available.

Closest 'Homewood Storeroom Cafe' 10 minutes drive down gravel road (we suggest you check opening hours) - a great cafe!
Closest basic shop - Riversdale (30 minutes on gravel road )
Closest supermarket - Carterton
Last petrol station: Carterton (we suggest you fill up there)
2 hours drive from Wellington (last 20mins on gravel road)
Exact address on google search ’Stansborough farm cottage’ Kaiwhata valley road, last 20 minutes is gravel. We will put ribbons up along the way for you to watch out for, so you know you're heading the right way.
There is an emergency phone at the farm house.
Make sure to grab a map of the property (will be provided on arrival) which highlights points of interest on the property.


Responsibilities:
Parents are solely responsible for their children at all times. Adults are responsible for themselves at all times, especially if drinking alcohol! Be aware the property and site of the event, is a working farm and there are hazards all around (rivers, lakes, cliffs, valleys and animals) so be careful and responsible.
The nearest medical facility is 50 minutes drive away.
When guests leave, we ask that you please take all your own rubbish with you and leave behind only flattened grass and the site as you found it.
If you are purchasing a Festival Day Pass only you will need a designated driver if any alcohol is consumed. The road to the venue is tricky and gravel in part. We DO NOT recommend anyone drives that has consumed any alcohol or is tired.

Click here to see videos and images from Chillax 2025:
https://photos.app.goo.gl/M25bpTPRvS3mfP45A

events.long_description:
Valentine’s Special Macaron Class

Love is in the air… and in the oven.
This Valentine’s season, step into the dreamy world of French patisserie with our Valentine’s Special Macaron Class — designed for lovers, besties, singles who love dessert, and anyone who believes sugar is a love language.
In this hands-on class, our pastry chefs will guide you through the art of making perfectly smooth, heart-shaped Valentine’s macarons from scratch. You’ll learn all the secrets — from macaronage and piping to baking, filling, and decorating — so you leave confident, inspired, and slightly obsessed.

What’s included

Step-by-step macaron making with our chefs

Valentine-themed flavours & decorations

All ingredients, tools, and packaging provided

Take-home macarons (if you don’t eat them first)

A cosy, romantic Le Ciel experience


Class Dates
January: 16th, 17th, 23rd & 24th
February: 6th, 7th, 21st & 22nd

Perfect as a date night, Galentine’s plan, or a thoughtful Valentine’s gift.
Spots are limited, and these sessions will fill quickly — because nothing says “I love you” quite like handmade macarons.

Book now and make this Valentine’s extra sweet.

events.id: A Century Celebration!-18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: A Century Celebration!
events.venue: 18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
A Century Celebration!
In 1926, at a meeting at the Accounts Chambers in Johnston Street, Wellington, Mrs JW Bell (and her husband) offered to lease three sections of her land for the purposes of establishing a tennis and bowling club in Titahi Bay.

Well Mrs Bell, thanks to your kind offer, we are still here 100 years later and don’t we have some stories and memories to share of those years gone by!

Over the course of Wellington Anniversary weekend (16-18 January 2026), we invite current and former members of the Titahi Bay Tennis Club to come and join us in celebrating this incredible milestone!

In coming months, we will update this post with more information about events planned for the weekend. In the meantime, please put this in your diary, share with friends, family, or perhaps use it as an opportunity to reach out to a former interclub team mate you haven’t seen or heard from in a while and tell them you’ll see them there!

We hope you can join us for what should be a great occasion!



(article : https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/EP19270114.2.141)

Also check out other Sports events in Porirua, Workshops in Porirua, Meetups in Porirua.

events.long_description:
Spend an evening under one of the world’s finest dark skies and learn how to photograph the Milky Way, constellations and deep-sky objects. This immersive masterclass is designed for curious explorers, hobby photographers and anyone who has ever looked up and wished they could capture what they saw.

Your instructor is an experienced astro-educator, and you’ll be taken step by step through the art and science of night-sky photography with DSLR or mirrorless cameras. You’ll learn how to focus at infinity, choose the best camera settings, build compositions under the Milky Way, and work with RAW files, noise control and exposure strategy. You’ll photograph live star fields and leave with images you can genuinely be proud of.

No astronomy expertise or prior astrophotography experience is required — just your curiosity. Bring a camera and tripod if you have them, but if not, you can still attend, learn from telescope-linked imaging feeds, and gain the skills and confidence to shoot the cosmos on your own.

Held at Star Safari, right in the Wairarapa dark-sky heartlands, this experience takes place under the same southern skies recognised by Lonely Planet as one of the world’s top stargazing destinations. If you’ve ever wanted to try astrophotography, this is the moment, and this is the place.

What you’ll gain:
- Confidence to shoot the night sky
- Proven camera settings and workflow
- Real photos of the Milky Way and southern star fields
- Knowledge you can use anywhere the southern sky is visible
- A rare, premium learning experience under a world-class sky

Perfect for couples, travellers, creatives, astronomy lovers, and anyone who wants a deeper connection to the night.

Spaces are limited to keep the experience personal.

events.id: LIQUID PRAYER - Somatic Dance-293 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: LIQUID PRAYER - Somatic Dance
events.venue: 293 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
LIQUID PRAYER
(more than) a somatic dance journey...
Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of ritual, connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.
🌑 Friday 16 January
🕕 7–9.30pm
📍 Thistle Hall, Wellington
🎟️ $35–$55
✨ Sober · Non-judgemental · All welcome · No experience needed
No door sales - tickets must be purchased online prior to the event.
As we land in the new year, we gather in reverence of what it means to be human...each of us; the entire ocean in a drop. When we connect to the rivers that flow within, we are reminded of our divinity: we are nature and we can find liberation in our sense of belonging as a part of the whole.
This is a space to FLOW FREELY, FEEL FULLY and anchor in any new year intentions as we transition from the year of the snake to the year of the fire horse.
We’ll begin our ritual with ceremonial cacao and a grounding meditation, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. Barefoot and phone-free, you’re invited to drop deep into free-form movement, awakening the divine currents that flow through you.
Come as you are.
Move with what you feel.
Leave feeling empowered, connected, and alive.
Somatic dance is a guided movement practice that helps you tune into your body’s wisdom and move from the inside out. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you're being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.
Your Hosts...
Jenna Joan | Embodiment Facilitator
Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.
Sonic Sutra | Somatic Dance DJ
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide dancers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

events.id: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute-11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute
events.venue: 11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For over two decades, Tony Lewis has been turning heads and wowing audiences worldwide with his incredible portrayal of Britain’s greatest entertainer — Robbie Williams. Since debuting in Legends in 2002, Tony has performed across the globe, leaving crowds asking, “Is that really…?”
Based in Manchester, England, Tony first met Robbie in 2005, earning his idol’s approval when Robbie said, “I think it’s great, I’m really flattered! It’s bloody hard work being me!”
Three years later, Tony reached the finals of BBC One’s The One and Only, performing to over 7 million viewers each week. His uncanny resemblance and spot-on performance have led to countless TV appearances, promotional campaigns, and even official work for Robbie’s album Rudebox.
Tony has also appeared alongside stars like Simon Cowell, Olly Murs, Stephen Fry, and Ant & Dec — even helping prank Robbie himself on Saturday Night Takeaway!
His show captures all the greatest hits, from the early classics and swing favourites to modern anthems and a touch of Take That. With the looks, the moves, the voice, and the attitude — Tony Lewis truly is Robbie Williams!

events.id: Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Missed the real deal? Live vicariously with Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool!
After a SOLD OUT Wellington show in early 2025 Insecure Delusion are back in the capital at the famous San Fran to give Tool fans a fix with their tribute to the greats - whether you missed out on the real deal or just want to get out amongst Tool fans again for a night of the best rock songs around - Insecure Delusion are ready to deliver this January 2026!

Rocking out from 9:00pm on Friday the 16th of January, enjoy the tunes that gave Tool a cult-like status amongst devoted fans. Playing fan favourites like The Pot, Stinkfist, Forty Six & 2 and others, it’s the perfect way to get your Tool fix whether you saw them in Auckland or didn't get the chance! It might seem crazy to run a tribute to the greats a couple of months after the legends themselves are here but these lads are a bit mad and they bring that energy to every show!

Insecure Delusion: A Tribute To Tool take the stage with energy and passion for the genres and the musicianship that Tool is known for. An event not to be missed if you're a Tool fiend.
Earlybirds are available now but only for a limited ticket run! At only $25 per ticket (+ bf), your bank account will be thanking you.

events.id: General Kala-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: General Kala
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Founded in 2013, Wellington-based General Kala's first live performance was two years later, by which time they had a 90-minute set of original, synthesiser-driven music. The original lineup of Cusiel (vocal and synth), Spence (synths and vocal) and Mathiassen (drums) is still in place, with six EPs released this year (plus another six by 2026) through Pulse Science Recordings.

Taking their lead from classic analog-synth acts of the late 1970s and early '80s, as well as progressive and rock luminaries of both decades, Kala infuses visceral, soaring, melodic dance composition with vintage synthesis and syncopated rhythm (courtesy of Mathiassen, also drummer for Shapeshifter and Kora).

Now based in Auckland, the band will bring their singular sound back to Wellington - performing at the Rogue and Vagabond January the 16th.

Music from 9:30pm, FREE ENTRY

events.id: Summer singing retreat-Our Lady's Home of Compassion,Home of Compassion, 2 Rhine St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Summer singing retreat
events.venue: Our Lady's Home of Compassion,Home of Compassion, 2 Rhine St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Summer singing retreat
Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.

Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.

Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.

We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfilment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).

Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have led workshops and performed together for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!

Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.

If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire at

REGISTRATION: Get tickets on Humanitix, or if you want to avoid the extra fees, register here

SCHEDULE

Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be held at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch. The beach is close by, so bring your swimming gear for a dip at lunchtime.

Sunday, 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room (large meeting room filled with natural light) at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learnt at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.

The Island Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.

The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.
We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day.
Sunday, 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room (large meeting room filled with natural light) at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay.
We will finish the day singing the songs we learnt at a FREE community concert in the Chapel.

events.id: Braai and get together at Battle Hill - 17 January 2026-Battle Hill Farm Forest Park,Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Braai and get together at Battle Hill - 17 January 2026
events.venue: Battle Hill Farm Forest Park,Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Braai and get together at Battle Hill - 17 January 2026
How about just a casual get together and braai? The last one we had at Battle Hill was so nice and we met so many new people. Noting that this is weather dependent.

Where:
We have secured "The Dell" area for semi-exclusive use at Battle Hill. (It will be Wellington Anniversary weekend so may be a bit busy.) This means a large section of grass with trees, toilets and the river close by for the kids to play in and see the eels and we can braai in webers, etc. The bigger kids that want to go and swim in the hole can take a walk there. Unfortunately, there are no concrete slabs that we can make fires on so you will need to bring a braai with.

What to bring?
Well, this is not a catered place so you will need to bring the following:
Gazebo
Chairs and/or blankets
Braai and charcoal/wood i.e. weber, etc 😉
There are gas braais as well but you will need to share it with the rest of the people / campers.)
Meat, drinks, salad and water/ drinks (to drink and to K*ll your fire with)
Balls, bats, etc for the kids to play (If someone is keen on arranging games for the day, we would appreciate it!)

There is no cost to us getting semi exclusive use of the area. However, if you want to extend the night and camp, you will need to pay for that.

Please note that this is a working farm area and unfortunately no dogs are allowed AT ALL.

Also note that the gates are locked at 8pm so if you are not camping, please keep this in mind so you can get out in time.

This is an open invitation so no need to RSVP to me but it would be nice to have an indication on how many people will attend by confirming on the event "Going" or "Interested".

I hope to see LOTS of you there!

events.name: Mirimiri Community Clinic Day MASTERTON
events.venue: UCOL Wairarapa,Library-Ucol Wairarapa Campus, Masterton 5810, New Zealand, Masterton
events.long_description:
Mirimiri Community Clinic Day MASTERTON
Mirimiri and Romiromi is traditional Māori bodywork and healing. Treatment is holistic and includes body alignment, deep tissue work and release of stress and tension by applying pressure to specific points on the body.

We are thrilled to announce our first COMMUNITY CLINIC DAY in Masterton in the New Year, SATURDAY Jan 17th! ✨ This will be introducing our regular Wednesday clinics in Masterton at Whakaoriori Marae from 28th January onwards - in partnership with Tū Ora Compass Health and UCOL Masterton.

Book your introductory session online: https://ManawaOra.as.me/UCOL

If you have never experienced Mirimiri or Romiromi before, this is your opportunity! Treatment is beneficial for conditions of pain, misalignment, sports or work injuries and relief from emotional distress, stress & tension; while also supporting the body to realign and rebalance energetically.

Sessions: 20mins. COST: $20

events.id: International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop-Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop
events.venue: Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop
This workshop is a speed-run of everything I learnt at The Heat improv festival in Vancouver, Canada this year. From Estonian mime to Zimbabwe low-fi, Philippines Telenovela to Canadian quickdraw, and our own iconic laconic Kiwi style of improv, I’ll share gems for you to take away and add to your craft.

This workshop is a fundraiser for Second Breakfast to return to Canada in 2026! Help us support our mate Ryan and PopRox founding member Jonny Paul in their international improv adventures, all while getting some awesome new improv intel from one of the nation's finest.

ABOUT THE TEACHER

Ryan (he/him) is an improviser from Te Papaioea, Aotearoa. He’s spent the last decade teaching improv across Aotearoa, including 4 years at NZIF. He’s a two-time New Zealand National Theatresports Champion 2016 & 2017, and is one-third of the trio Second Breakfast who represented Aotearoa in The Heat, an international improv showcase in Vancouver Canada in 2025 (and 2026!)

At the end of the day, he just wants to make people laugh and feel good.

STAND BY LIST

As this workshop is a fundraiser, we will not be operating a Stand-by List. However, tickets are pay what you can from just $30 which we reckon is an absolute bargain!

events.long_description:
Saturday Sounds | Tui
Tui-Eilish Tahere-Katene is 19 years old & has just begun her early childhood teaching journey at Te Kōhanga Reo o Turoa in Otaki. Tui is aptly named after the beautiful singing bird ‘Me he korokoro Tūī’ She has just completed the recording of her new waiata based on Parihaka called ‘Warriors of Peace’.

Tui sings both locally throughout Wellington & Kapiti & nationally for sports events & corporate gigs. Tui’s big events for 2025 included: Gardens Magic, Waitangi Festival, Matariki Festival, Ōtaki Kite Festival, Wgtn Gold Awards, NZ International Teachers Conference, Bay of Plenty Rugby Stadium singing, Courtenay Precinct, Governor General’s Matariki Banquet & lead performer in Kapiti College Parihaka Production. This year Tui will be performing at Waitangi Treaty Grounds!

__
Check out the rest of the 2025/6 season here: https://www.mostlymusic.nz/saturday-sounds

Saturday Sounds is a partnership between Mostly Music and The Bond Store. We have worked collaboratively to create an environment where musicians are welcomed and celebrated, and where audiences are encouraged to sit and listen to the music while enjoying excellent hospitality.

For more info about Mostly Music, check out mostlymusic.nz
For more info about The Bond Store check out thebondstore.co.nz

events.id: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt-Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
events.venue: Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
This summer, three of Aotearoa’s most beloved bands hit the road for Ready To Roll, a brand-new touring show celebrating New Zealand music and sun-soaked good times. Featuring the legendary Th’ Dudes, iconic Mockers, and multi-platinum favourites Stellar*, the tour will bring timeless hits and unforgettable live energy to some of the country’s most picturesque summer locations.

Ready To Roll pays homage to the iconic TV music chart show that ran from the 1970s through to the 1990s. As New Zealand’s homegrown version of the Top 40 countdown, Ready To Roll became appointment viewing for generations of music fans, a showcase for both international chart-toppers and breakthrough Kiwi acts. It helped launch and cement countless careers while becoming a cultural touchstone in Aotearoa. Reviving the name for this tour nods to its legacy of celebrating great music and good times, a perfect fit for a summer series featuring three of the country’s most enduring and much-loved groups.

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun, safe, relevant, and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in, your PADI qualification will be recognised.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend, we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive, so we can go at your pace, no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend, you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed, you will be ready for the sea dives.

Once you are a certified diver, you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification on-line. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course, and our regular Dive Days.

We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call, email or stop by our Dive Store.

Kind regards,
Tony Howell
PADI Course Director
Tel: 04 233-8238 Email: nzsa@scubadiving.co.nz Web: www.scubadiving.co.nz
9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua 5026


PADI Open Water Diver course at a glance:
•Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
•Practical: One weekend pool training, one weekend with four sea dives
•Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
•Start Time: Please be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am daily.

Location:
We are located at 9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Check our website for location.

Prerequisites:
•Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
•Be able to swim 300m (no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
•Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts, a visit to your doctor is required.
•Elearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
•Complete the RDP Tables Quiz and Exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring:
•Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
•If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
•A pen, swimming costume, towel and a snack for the breaks.
•Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
•The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost:
•Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
•Includes: PADI eLearning Course, Dive Gear Rental, Pool Sessions, and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased
•10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
•$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When:
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.
Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course:
•Course bookings can be made in-store, via email, online or over the phone
•The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
•Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
•Elearning courses, once redeemed, cannot be transferred.
•Before we can send you the eLearning link, we require your full name, date of birth, a valid personal email address and phone number.
•Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

events.long_description:
Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn
Join us for an evening of heartfelt folk music, starting with Ōtaki-born singer-songwriter Ari Leason, whose soulful blend of indie folk and intimate storytelling shines through her debut album Hello Darling. Honest, vulnerable, and deeply authentic, Ari brings songs shaped by activism, travel, and a coming-of-age journey that resonates long after the last note.
Headlining the night, Butter Wouldn't Melt recently released their album Where the roots grow deep, which hit Number 3 on the Aotearoa Music Charts. This 5-piece folk band is made up of Andrea Reid (guitar and vocals) Nick Burfield (guitar and vocals), Marz Connelly (bass and vocals), Mikey Muggeridge (mandolin and vocals), and Cara Brasted (fiddle and vocals). Through powerful harmonies and upbeat instrumentals, they tie together folk, Americana, country, bluegrass styles to bring their own twist to New Zealand storytelling. As timeless as it is deeply personal, you won't want to miss this performance!

Doors: 6:30pm
Music: 7pm

All Ages
Entry Cover charge*
Unwaged $15
Waged $20
Support the Artists $30
*Guide only - booking fees may apply

"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours. The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at ”
events.description:
Butter Wouldn't Melt & Ari Leason at Vogelmorn Join us for an evening of heartfelt folk music, starting with Ōtaki-born singer-songwriter Ari Leason, whose soulful blend of indie folk and intimate storytelling shines through her debut album Hello Darling.
Honest, vulnerable, and deeply authentic, Ari brings songs shaped by activism, travel, and a coming-of-age journey that resonates long after the last note.
Headlining the night, Butter Wouldn't Melt recently released their album Where the roots grow deep, which hit Number 3 on the Aotearoa Music Charts.
This 5-piece folk band is made up of Andrea Reid (guitar and vocals) Nick Burfield (guitar and vocals), Marz Connelly (bass and vocals), Mikey Muggeridge (mandolin and vocals), and Cara Brasted (fiddle and vocals).
Through powerful harmonies and upbeat instrumentals, they tie together folk, Americana, country, bluegrass styles to bring their own twist to New Zealand storytelling.

events.id: Crop Up Greytown-Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Crop Up Greytown
events.venue: Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St, Greytown
events.long_description:
Fresh local produce, seafood, flowers, eggs, meat and plants from Greytown and the South Wairarapa. From 9am Saturday mornings at Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St.

Crop Up is Greytown's very own ultra-fresh, ultra-sustainable and ultra-tasty Saturday morning pop-up place to get your fresh food. It's all about crops, coffee and community.

Crop Up brings a blend of small farm suppliers, growers and local backyarders, offering their produce. As well as locally grown fruit and vegetables, there’s coffee, breakfast from The Baker, plus special guest pop-ups offering fresh-caught fish and other tempting products.

Our picnic tables are ready, and umbrellas are up for you and your friends to relax under. Catch up at Crop Up. It’s that kind of friendly place.

Crop Up is zero-waste and plastic-free. Crop Up is at Truckstop Greytown, 102 Main St.

The annual Greytown Sidewalk Sale returns on Saturday 17 January, where Greytown’s boutiques put tables and racks outside their stores, with incredible finds and great bargains.

It’s the joy of the find, fuelled by great coffee and delicious local food, chatting with friendly owner-run businesses and discovering pieces you didn’t know you needed until you saw them.

events.id: Summer Singing Retreat-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Summer Singing Retreat
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfillment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!
Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.
If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire islandbay@compassion.org.nz
SCHEDULE
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.
The Iskand Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.
Bring a water bottle, swimming togs if you want to swim in Island Bay during lunch time, and a picnic mat for eating outside.

Sing for healing.
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay.
We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel.

events.id: Lavender & Flower Farm PYO-Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Lavender & Flower Farm PYO
events.venue: Lavender Magic, 61 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Your weekend escape starts at Lavender Magic surrounded by the calming scent of Lavender. As the evening cools, wander through rows of fragrant blooms and gather fresh flowers — the perfect gift for friends and family.

Nestled in a charming country garden, Lavender Magic offers breathtaking views of the Tararua Ranges, creating a stunning backdrop for relaxation and discovery. Whether you’re picking flowers, strolling among the lavender, or simply soaking in the peaceful atmosphere, this is the place to unwind and reconnect with nature.

Come experience the magic. Lavender Magic — where tranquility blossoms and the stars are brighter.

Lavender Magic is a Lavender farm and a Cut Flower Farm. It has about 5000 lavender plants and grows a range of cut flowers. In season you will find pockets roses, lilies, sunflowers, zinnias and dahlias. You can pick lavender and cut flowers!

Since 2007 Lavender Magic has won many awards for the quality of their lavender oil, which can be purchased on site along with balms, creams and sprays in the small farm shop.

We will provide you with everything you need. Cutting nips, rubber band and bucket. We will let you know which flowers are in season and available to cut.

Plan your visit: Lavender Magic is a great place to take time out, relax and recover.
Wear - Good footwear to explore the lavender field and surrounding gardens.
Wear - Sunglasses and slip, slop, slap on if a sunny day as we get full sun.
Bring - BYO food and drink is allowed. Or grab a coffee and something to eat from OUR PLACE CAFE who set up when available, check socials for details.
Bring - A rug if you want to sit in the lavender, but not on the ground. Some seating may be available on quiet days.
Bring - A journal or magazine, to ensure you take time out to reflect and relax
Bring - A friend and whanau to share your experience
Bring - A Team of friends, a pack of cards or games and just hang out for awhile
Bring - Your pet, if you are a responsible owner and promise you will pick up its mess and will not let it annoy others.
Bring - A camera to capture some of the magic and create memories.
A toilet is on site.

Lavender Magic is a scenic drive, about 75 minutes from Upper Hutt and Palmerston North.

Cut flower bouquets are available or can be ordered in advance to surprise someone special.

If you want something a little more private, we do hire out our property for photography and special events, contact Pauline on lavendermagic@outlook.com

How to get there:
Drive past the pizza place to get to Lavender Magic - Pizza at the Water Mill Bakery is open (Friday Only 5pm-9pm). Other things to do in the Mt Holdsworth area - Fernado Oscar Calligo may have Choripan the Argentinian Food Cart open (Check socials for dets) Paul Melser Pottery (Weekends Only), Jackie Pearson's Fine Art Gallery (Check for details), Rivenrock Mountain Biking Park (Check for details) and DOC walks (24/7) as Holdsworth is the main entrance to the eastern side of the Tararua Forest Park.

Mt Holdsworth, Carterton, Wairarapa is a great place to visit.

events.id: Marlin's Dreaming - Wellington-San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Marlin's Dreaming - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marlin's Dreaming - Wellington
A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.

Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits.

Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.

Renowned for their tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.

“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.

“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”

As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.

events.id: Marquetry - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Marquetry - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Marquetry is the art of ‘drawing’ with wood veneers, cutting intricate jigsaws of imagery and inlaying in or onto timbers.

In two hours have a go exploring the different veneers, get to know the chisels and knives, and create your own take home block (or coaster) having learnt the fundamentals to take it further.

Students must be 12 and above. Must be able to use small hand tools safely.

events.id: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day-Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day
events.venue: Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton
events.long_description:
Our on-farm Craft Open Days are aimed primarily at knitters, spinners, crocheters and other fibre crafters.

Nestled in the small rural community of Tinui is Rewa Rewa Station. Operating as a hill country Sheep & Beef breeding farm with a strong focus on NZ Wool & Fibre. Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters, which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets. Our Studio Shop is also open during Craft Days or by appointment outside of these days.

Our Craft Days allow you to work on your own project, seek advice, learn a new fibre skill or maybe just spend time with fellow fibre crafters while potentially ticking off a project or two in the process.

Please bring your knitting, crocheting, spinning, hand sewing, or any project you are working on and enjoy a drive in the country!

Coffee, tea and snacks provided, but bring your lunch and stay awhile.

Everyone is welcome, the more the merrier!

Note: Craft Days are primarily held on the 3rd Saturday of every mont,h but occasionally we do have to juggle the dates.

events.id: Stacking Rings - Summer-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Stacking Rings - Summer
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Create your very own ring stack from copper, brass and sterling silver in this fast, fun and highly rewarding workshop!

Guided by our experienced and supportive tutors, you’ll be introduced to the fundamental skills of jewellery-making while creating a small collection of rings to take home and treasure.

During this 3-hour class, you’ll learn how to measure your finger, cut metal to size, and add textures and patterns using hammers and punches. From there, you’ll be shown how to solder your rings together with a jeweller’s torch before finishing them with filing, sanding and polishing techniques. Along the way, our tutors will share tips and tricks, patiently guiding you so you feel confident every step of the way.

By the end of the session, you’ll have crafted two sterling silver rings and two copper or brass rings, and if time allows, you can make even more!

Each ring you make is completely your own, whether you keep them sleek and simple or experiment with texture and pattern. You’ll leave not only with a stylish, wearable ring stack, but also with the joy of having made something truly unique with your own hands.

This class is perfect for beginners, groups of friends, or visitors wanting a memorable creative experience. Many students find jewellery making a wonderfully mindful activity - slowing down, working with their hands and enjoying the calming rhythm of making.

Your class fee includes copper and brass for practice, sterling silver for two rings, plus all consumables such as solder, sandpaper and polishing materials. Extra silver and other metals are available for purchase in the studio if you’d like to expand your collection.

Children aged 12 and up are welcome, though anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.name: Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - The Wellington Anniversary Saturday
events.venue: Ata Rangi Winery, 14 Puruatanga Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Spend your Wellington Anniversary Saturday under the trees at Ata Rangi. Enjoy sunshine-soaked, feel-good music by The Relatives while savouring the middle eastern flavours prepared by our laidback locals, Nara. This is a long weekend vibes under the trees. Come dance, sip and settle into summer at our place.

What to expect: A welcoming afternoon for locals, Wellingtonians and travellers alike:
- Ata Rangi wines poured throughout the day
- Plenty of space to relax under the trees
- Good food, great music and a chance to dance
- A celebration of our place and the season

Ticket includes entry, live music and a glass of Ata Rangi bubbles on arrival. Pay on consumption for all other food and beverages.

This is part of a series of four Ata Rangi Summer Sessions, taking place on 17 Jan, 24 Jan, 7 Feb and 21 Feb. See the full series at www.atarangi.com/ata-rangi-events

events.name: Italian Food & Natural Wines
events.venue: Cambridge Road Vineyard, 32 Cambridge Road, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Enjoy delicious fresh pasta, gnocchi, and other Italian favourites every Saturday at our cellar door. Each week features a different menu, including a vegetarian option.

Attilio earned his reputation through simple, fresh, and honest cooking, crafted with passion and the finest ingredients. He was the head chef at Moy Hall when they first opened, ran a gnocchi food truck at Schubert, and led the kitchen at Palliser. You’ve probably already tried his famous gnocchi, and if you haven’t, now you know where to find it.

See you all soon!

Cambridge Road team.

events.id: International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop-61/69 Abel Smith Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: International Lessons from Canada | A PopRox Improv Workshop
events.venue: 61/69 Abel Smith Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This workshop is a speed-run of everything I learnt at The Heat improv festival in Vancouver, Canada this year. From Estonian mime to Zimbabwe low-fi, Philippines Telenovela to Canadian quickdraw, and our own iconic laconic Kiwi style of improv, I’ll share gems for you to take away and add to your craft.

This workshop is a fundraiser for Second Breakfast to return to Canada in 2026! Help us support our mate Ryan and PopRox founding member Jonny Paul in their international improv adventures, all while getting some awesome new improv intel from one of the nation's finest.
ABOUT THE TEACHER
Ryan (he/him) is an improviser from Te Papaioea, Aotearoa. He’s spent the last decade teaching improv across Aotearoa, including 4 years at NZIF.  He’s a two-time New Zealand National Theatresports Champion 2016 & 2017, and is one-third of the trio Second Breakfast who represented Aotearoa in The Heat, an international improv showcase in Vancouver Canada in 2025 (and 2026!)

At the end of the day, he just wants to make people laugh and feel good. 
STAND BY LIST
As this workshop is a fundraiser, we will not be operating a Stand-by List. However, tickets are pay what you can from just $30 which we reckon is an absolute bargain!

From Estonian mime to Zimbabwe low-fi, Philippines Telenovela to Canadian quickdraw, and our own iconic laconic Kiwi style of improv, I’ll share gems for you to take away and add to your craft.
This workshop is a fundraiser for Second Breakfast to return to Canada in 2026!
Ryan (he/him) is an improviser from Te Papaioea, Aotearoa.
He’s a two-time New Zealand National Theatresports Champion 2016 & 2017, and is one-third of the trio Second Breakfast who represented Aotearoa in The Heat, an international improv showcase in Vancouver Canada in 2025 (and 2026!)

events.id: Saturday Mahjong (Jan 2026)-17 Tinakori Road, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Saturday Mahjong (Jan 2026)
events.venue: 17 Tinakori Road, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Calling all Mahjong (麻將) players...
Whether you're a complete beginner or have some skills under your belt, come along to enjoy some friendly games at our Saturday afternoon session. You can drop in and leave anytime.
We offer a variety of Mahjong styles to suit your preference, including Cantonese, Sichuan, and Taiwanese.
Lessons are available for Mahjong from 1.30-2.30pm.
While we primarily play Mahjong, Chinese Chess (象棋) and Go/Weiqi (圍棋) are available for play. Go/Weiqi tutorial and players to be arranged in advance.
Fee: $10 per person
Afternoon tea: Tea, coffee and light afternoon tea provided.
Game sets: Please bring along your Mahjong, Chinese Chess and Go sets.
Payment options: Internet Banking or Cash
Venue info:
Accessibility: There is an outdoor ramp access into the building for less mobile people. 
Parking: Limited off-street parking is available beneath the building.

events.id: Artists and Their Love of Plants - Part 2 Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Artists and Their Love of Plants - Part 2 Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
All over the world, and over centuries, artists have painted, etched and carved trees and other plants, and used them in other art forms. Many of these plants can be found in the Wellington Botanic Gardens.

On this 60-minute walk, starting at the Rose Garden fountain and ending at the founders’ entrance on Glenmore Street, we will look at those plants and pictures of the artworks related to them. Artists will include Claude Monet, Li Shan, Vincent van Gogh, and New Zealander Rita Angus.

Meet at the Rose Garden Fountain
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

Join Coveted Jewellery's exclusive workshop in Wellington.
Workshop dates are limited throughout 2026. 
Design your own sterling silver ring. In just a couple of hours, you’ll go from inspiration to creation, designing and carving your very own wax ring or pendant model. Our experienced jewellers will be there to guide you through every step, whether you're a first-timer or a seasoned artist. Once your wax design is complete, we’ll take care of casting and finishing it in sterling silver, and courier to your doorstep within 2-4 weeks. 
Quotes to upgrade to gold or add a stone are available on the day.
Workshop Details:
Dates: One-off session dates usually scheduled monthly.
Time: Saturdays, 2.30-5 pm
Location: Wellington Studio, situated on level 3, 22 Garrett St, Te Aro
Cost: $280 (Includes all materials, tools, and delivery)

This workshop is a fantastic way to create a personal piece of jewellery that you can wear and cherish forever. With only 8-10 spots available per session.

We can't wait to see what you create. 
The Coveted Team x

events.id: Queensgate Night Market-Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Queensgate Night Market
events.venue: Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

events.id: Marlin's Dreaming-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Marlin's Dreaming
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.

Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits.

Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, its starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.

Renowned for its tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.

“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.

“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”

As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.

ABOUT MARLIN'S DREAMING

Marlin’s Dreaming is an indie pop band from Dunedin, New Zealand. Combining angular guitars with dream-pop sensibilities, the band pushes the storied history of the Dunedin Sound - made famous by Flying Nun - into new and uncharted territory.

Formed in 2017 by longtime friends Semisi Ma’ia’i (vocals & guitar), Oscar Johns (bass), Hamish Morgan (drums) and De Stevens (guitar), the band found unexpected success with their debut album Lizard Tears (2017), which garnered international acclaim, including from COMPLEX, who called it an “exciting, intoxicating debut.”

Subsequent releases like Talk On/Commic (2018) and Quotidian (2020) showcased their evolution into sharper, more angular guitars and angst-driven melodies, earning praise from CLASH, NME and BrooklynVegan.

Marlin's Dreaming’s latest release, HIRL (2024), arrived to critical acclaim from Atwood Magazine, Rolling Stone and Americana UK, and saw the band play a string of sold-out shows across New Zealand and Australia at the end of the year.

They have toured with Parquet Courts, The Chills, Kirin J Callinan and Dope Lemon, and are currently hunkering down, writing new material.

Having played sold-out tours across Australia and New Zealand, Marlin's Dreaming continues to push musical boundaries, heightening guitar pop to a fine art.
