A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.
Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits.
Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.
“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington.
“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.” As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.

Enchanting Lavender Picking & Stargazing with 'Under the Stars'

Discover the Magic of Martinborough Nights!

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Bring your telescope, torch, blankets, and an evening picnic to immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

Watch the sun set over the lavender fields, pick your own bunch of lavender, and explore our charming lavender shop. Indulge in delightful lavender treats that will tantalize your taste buds.

Limited tickets available – only 200 per night!

Entry: $25 per Adult (includes stargazing and a bunch of lavender). Kids enter free!

Please note: No pets and no smoking allowed.

In case of unfavorable stargazing conditions, we will contact you on the day to offer a refund or reschedule.

events.id: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember-Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vietnamese Art Exhibition: Những Miền Đất Nhớ | Lands We Remember
events.venue: Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand. Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse. The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.
Created during the artist’s stay in New Zealand, these paintings offer an intimate, lived perspective - capturing moments of connection, unfamiliarity, and shared humanity through a deeply Vietnamese artistic lens. This exhibition is both a cultural bridge and a personal story told through art.
This is Viet Hub NZ’s first Vietnamese community art exhibition, created with care, whānau values, and a strong commitment to accessibility and cross-cultural understanding. Whether you love art, culture, storytelling, or simply discovering new perspectives, Những Miền Đất Nhớ invites you to pause, reflect, and connect.
events.description:
Những Miền Đất Nhớ (Lands We Remember) is a Vietnamese contemporary art exhibition by respected artist Đặng Mậu Tựu, proudly presented as part of Viet Hub NZ’s Lunar New Year (Tết) Festival 2026.
This exhibition shares the journey of an artist from another country and culture who immersed himself in life in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Through approximately 30 original artworks, he reflects on how two worlds - Vietnam and Aotearoa - meet, overlap, and quietly converse.
The works explore cultural memory, identity, belonging, and the emotional experience of living between homelands.
Created during the artist’s stay in New Zealand, these paintings offer an intimate, lived perspective - capturing moments of connection, unfamiliarity, and shared humanity through a deeply Vietnamese artistic lens.

events.id: WHAC Presents: Honest 10 on 18 January 2026-Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay, New Zealand 6022,64 Freyberg St, Lyall Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: WHAC Presents: Honest 10 on 18 January 2026
events.venue: Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay, New Zealand 6022,64 Freyberg St, Lyall Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
WHAC Presents: Honest 10 on 18 January 2026

Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 18 January (Wellington Anniversary Weekend) for the first edition of the Honest 10 for 2026, taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
Check out other dates for the start of 2026 (as well as photos and results) on the WHAC website https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/

EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)
[Note: If there are gales force winds, it is likely we will cancel due to safety reasons. Check back on this FB page at 7am on the morning of the race if the wind is howling as well will post any cancellation by that time. If nothing is here, then the event is going ahead :) ]

Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.

Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!

How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 17 January. Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
Use "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
OR
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).

Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/

Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay

When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.

***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to BEFORE 5pm Saturday 17 January. 🙂 You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N

BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"

Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 17 January 2026.

events.id: Wainuiomata Old Forest Walk - January-Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wainuiomata Old Forest Walk - January
events.venue: Wainuiomata Recreation Area,10 Whitcher Grove, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wainuiomata Old Forest Walk - January
Explore ancient forests on a guided walk in Wainuiomata Regional Park

Step into a world few get to see. This exclusive guided walk takes you deep into a 1,000-year-old forest in Wainuiomata Regional Park—an area normally closed to the public. Wander beneath towering native rātā and rimu trees and discover a sanctuary for North Island brown kiwi and other native birds.

Led by one of our experienced park rangers, you’ll hear stories about the park’s natural heritage, conservation efforts, and the history that makes this place so special.

Registrations are extremely limited. Each walk is capped at just 20 participants, with a maximum of two registrations per person. If you’ve joined this event before, please consider letting someone else experience this unique opportunity.

Event Details:

Distance: Approx. 10 km, including river crossings

Fitness level: Moderate

Age: Not suitable for children under 14

What to bring: Lunch, snacks, water bottle, and appropriate clothing

To book: Due to the overwhelming popularity of these limited capacity events, we have now decided that the fairest way to allocate bookings is via a ballot system. A ballot will open for registrations via the link below at 10am on Monday 15 December and close at 10am on Wednesday 17 December. Names will then be drawn at random all applicants notified of the outcome by 4pm on Thursday 18 December.

Ballot opens 10am on 15 December:


Your adventure starts in regional parks.

Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events like this for 25 years, helping people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy peaceful escapes close to home.

Wainuiomata Regional Park is not only a place of beauty—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington works here to protect freshwater, restore native habitats, preserve historic sites, and build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.id: Bring a Puppet to Life! 1 day Workshop in Pōneke-Vogelmorn Hall,13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Bring a Puppet to Life! 1 day Workshop in Pōneke
events.venue: Vogelmorn Hall,13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Bring a Puppet to Life! 1 day Workshop in Pōneke
A hands-on 1 day workshop in Pōneke Wellington facilitated by Bridget Sanders of Birdlife Productions, offering a beautiful opportunity to build your own Practice Puppet (in the style of a table-top Sandglass training puppet) and explore techniques to breathe life into it.
Perfect for anyone curious about puppetry, theatre practitioners wanting to expand their toolbox, and lovers of handmade craft.
No prior experience needed — just enthusiasm and a generous puppetry heart!

Cost: $85 waged / $60 student or unwaged
All materials provided. Drinks and snacks included.
Please bring your own lunch and advise accessibility needs in advance.
Tickets: https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2026/puppetry-workshop-bring-puppet-to-life/wellington/tickets

Bridget Sanders is Producer & Creative Director at Birdlife Productions: https://www.birdlifeproductions.co.nz/

She is a performer and touring artist across NZ and Europe, specialising in puppetry, storytelling, and live music.
Bridget believes puppetry ignites imagination and offers powerful alternatives to screen culture.
Founder of the Wellington Puppetry Festival (2024)
Training includes: Mask & Clown (John Bolton Theatre School, Melbourne), Puppetry (Sandglass Puppet Theatre, USA),
Puppet making (Judith Hope, UK)

Start your Sunday with creativity, connection, and the taste of possibility. Join us for Wineful Dreams at Forrest Wines, a mindful vision board workshop designed to help you visualise the year ahead.

events.id: Wainuiomata Old Forest Walk - January-10 Whitcher Grove, Wainuiomata-Facebook
events.name: Wainuiomata Old Forest Walk - January
events.venue: 10 Whitcher Grove, Wainuiomata
events.long_description:
Explore ancient forests on a guided walk in Wainuiomata Regional Park
Step into a world few get to see. This exclusive guided walk takes you deep into a 1,000-year-old forest in Wainuiomata Regional Park—an area normally closed to the public. Wander beneath towering native rātā and rimu trees and discover a sanctuary for North Island brown kiwi and other native birds.
Led by one of our experienced park rangers, you’ll hear stories about the park’s natural heritage, conservation efforts, and the history that makes this place so special.
Registrations are extremely limited. Each walk is capped at just 20 participants, with a maximum of two registrations per person. If you’ve joined this event before, please consider letting someone else experience this unique opportunity.
Event Details:
Distance: Approx. 10 km, including river crossings
Fitness level: Moderate
Age: Not suitable for children under 14
What to bring: Lunch, snacks, water bottle, and appropriate clothing
To book: Due to the overwhelming popularity of these limited capacity events, we have now decided that the fairest way to allocate bookings is via a ballot system. A ballot will open for registrations via the link below at 10am on Monday 15 December and close at 10am on Wednesday 17 December. Names will then be drawn at random all applicants notified of the outcome by 4pm on Thursday 18 December.
Ballot opens 10am on 15 December: https://forms.office.com/r/VjcbzptXi3

Your adventure starts in regional parks.
Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events like this for 25 years, helping people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy peaceful escapes close to home.
Wainuiomata Regional Park is not only a place of beauty—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington works here to protect freshwater, restore native habitats, preserve historic sites, and build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in making this park a special place for everyone.

events.id: Discover Te Muna - Go Behind the Scenes-Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Discover Te Muna - Go Behind the Scenes
events.venue: Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Join us for a full-day immersive experience in the viticulture, winemaking and wines of Te Muna Valley. Walk the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste exceptional wines right where they are made.

Tickets are limited to twenty people to ensure that this is an intimate experience, taking you to places that are not normally open to the public.

Your tour begins with pickup from Martinborough Square, leading to a special start at Big Sky Wines. Kath and Jeremy will take you through a hands-on experience of their vineyard and winery. From there, visit the stunning Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove. Margaret and Mike will entertain you with stories of their journey and explain how they grow their olives and grapes. You will then indulge in a long, relaxed lunch accompanied with a glass of wine. Some of the region's winemakers will join us to share their stories and answer your questions. The adventure continues with an insiders' look at the state of the art winery at Escarpment. Rowan will walk you through the process of how grapes are transformed into their wines. This will be followed by an exploration of the beautiful Craggy Range vineyard with Anton. The day will conclude with the opportunity to revisit your favourite wines of the day overlooking Te Muna from Craggy Range's gorgeous private venue.
events.description:
Join us for a full-day immersive experience in the viticulture, winemaking and wines of Te Muna Valley.
Tickets are limited to twenty people to ensure that this is an intimate experience, taking you to places that are not normally open to the public.
Margaret and Mike will entertain you with stories of their journey and explain how they grow their olives and grapes.
Rowan will walk you through the process of how grapes are transformed into their wines.
The day will conclude with the opportunity to revisit your favourite wines of the day overlooking Te Muna from Craggy Range's gorgeous private venue.

events.id: Ovus - Cascade Release Show - ft Kokoa Nashi & LadyReign-Valhalla,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Ovus - Cascade Release Show - ft Kokoa Nashi & LadyReign
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ovus - Cascade Release Show - ft Kokoa Nashi & LadyReign
Ovus present their latest EP CASCADE, live on 18th Jan 2026 at Valhalla Tavern (Wellington Anniversary Weekend).

With support from the mega talented KOKOA NASHI and local powerhouse LADYREIGN.


------------------------------------------------------------
Doors 7:30 // First Band 8pm

OVUS
KOKOA NASHI
LADYREIGN

Tickets $25 +b.f. via Cosmic Ticketing (Live soon). Limited door sales.
--------------------------------------------------------------


Ovus are Wellington's premier instrumental progressive metal act. A massive sound that crashes soaring guitar melodies into mind boggling rhythms with a finesse that keeps a catchy through-line in every song. Their live show is high energy, immersive and packed full of riffs.

New Zealand's 2025 Battle of the Bands National Championship winners Kokoa Nashi bring a vibe like no other. Blending hip hop with progressive rock and metal sensibilities, you've never heard anything like it, and you'll have a blast experiencing it!

LadyReign is a six-piece alternative-metal band fronted by two powerful female vocalists. Fresh off the release of their newest single Crowd, LadyReign fuzes soulful melodies with the crushing heaviness of modern metal to create a sound that is both haunting and refreshing.

events.id: Otaki Market - January-Otaki Market, 58 Main Highway, Ōtaki, Kapiti Coast, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Otaki Market - January
events.venue: Otaki Market, 58 Main Highway, Ōtaki, Kapiti Coast, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market.
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---
PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

- Art & Craft
- Native trees, flowers and plants
- Candles, soaps and wax melts
- Antiques and collectables
- Produce, including yummy honey!
- Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
- Tools for the home and garden
- Toys and books for tamariki

---
STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.venue: Waikanae Beach Community Hall, 22a Rauparaha St, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Celebrate the arrival of 2026 with your family and friends by visiting this great friendly community market where you will discover handmade treasures and local creativity by highly talented stallholders where every piece tells a story.

For the kids
Bring the kids along so they can meet jane with her quality handmade crochet toys, along with helen and her huge range of awesome handmade children's dress ups and dolls clothes etc.

Discover unique and quality items:-
Do your shopping at the market where you'll find a huge variety of high-quality, reasonably priced gift ideas along with locally produced honey, bees wax, oils and sauces etc.

Meet up with your friends and family:-
Why not enjoy a family day out on the beautiful Kapiti Coast, meet up with a friend or 2, pick up some handmade treasures and gifts then spend the rest of the day at other events and attractions including a visit to our lovely beaches and cafes.

Don't miss it....Support local!!

events.name: Unglued
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Unglued
One of the most in-demand names in UK drum’n’bass is touching down in Aotearoa.

From early breakout cuts like Ay! and Bootstrap Bill to his viral rework of If We Ever, Unglued has carved a reputation for high-impact production and fast-moving, peak-time DJ sets built for the rave — no filler, just pressure. Now signed exclusively to Hospital Records, he’s showing no signs of slowing down.

Coming in hot off the Soundsplash stage, this is a rare chance to catch one of the scene’s most reliable floor-destroyers up close.

events.id: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest-19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest
events.venue: 19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HELLO BEACH LOVERS
The Waitārere Forest Long Lunch
- Sunday 18 January 2026
- book your tickets online
Get ready for one of the highlights of our Waitārere summer calendar - the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch is returning on Sunday, 18 January 2026, and it’s looking to be our biggest and best yet!
 Held beneath the towering pines of the Waitārere Forest, this annual event is all about community,   connection, and celebration. The Long Lunch has become a much-loved tradition for residents and visitors alike - a day to relax, share good food, and enjoy the easy-going Waitārere lifestyle that makes our beach so special.
We’re proud to announce that "Gareth Heard and the team from Unique Realty" are now our major sponsors for Long Lunch. Their generous support is helping us make this year’s event extra special, including an exciting $500 cash giveaway to one lucky ticket holder! You must be present on the day to claim the prize, so make sure you don’t miss out on what promises to be an unforgettable afternoon.
Early Bird Tickets: $15* per person (01 Dec - 11 Jan)
Standard Tickets: $20* per person (12 Jan - 17 Jan)
Gate Sales Tickets: $25* per person (18 Jan)
*Fee (per Ticket/Order) 3% + 30c
All tables and chairs are provided - bring your own plates, cutlery, glasses, drinks, and a plate of food to share. From homemade favourites to gourmet treats, the shared tables are always overflowing with creativity, flavour, and generosity.
And don’t forget - the Long Lunch is also a major fundraiser for our community. There will be raffles, auctions, and prizes throughout the day, so bring plenty of cash and help us raise funds for local projects that make Waitārere Beach an even better place to live.
This year’s fundraising focus:
The Upgrade of the Community House Preschoolers' playground on Rua Ave.
It’s more than just a meal - it’s a celebration of our people and our place. Whether you’re a full-time local or here on holiday, you’ll be part of something special: great food, great company, and great memories under the forest canopy.
So gather your friends, pack your picnic gear, and join us for the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch. Let’s make this a summer to remember - full of laughter, flavour, and community spirit.
See you under the pines
on Sunday, 18 January 2026!

You must be present on the day to claim the prize, so make sure you don’t miss out on what promises to be an unforgettable afternoon.

events.id: Fareham Journey Free Cohousing Information-Fareham Gallery, 80 Underhill Road,, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Fareham Journey Free Cohousing Information
events.venue: Fareham Gallery, 80 Underhill Road,, Featherston
events.long_description:
Fareham Journey is building a sustainable cohousing community in Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston, and we are looking for people who share our kaupapa to create this with us. The Fareham property has extensive grounds which include a historic home, established organic gardens, an orchard, native bush, swimming pool, and fields. It even has an arts community on site.

We run free cohousing information and tour events on the third Sunday of every month, from noon until 2pm at Fareham, 80 Underhill Road, Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston in the South Wairarapa.

Learn about the Fareham Journey's vision to create a sustainable and supportive community and how you can get involved. We invite you to bring a plate of vegetarian food to join us for a shared meal in the historic homestead, Fareham House, followed by the walk to see where we could build it.

Please RSVP to attend at https://farehamjourney.nz/rsvp/

events.id: New Moon, New Year, New Energy: Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath Workshop-Lotus Yoga Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: New Moon, New Year, New Energy: Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath Workshop
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Step into the first New Moon of 2026 with clarity, grounding, and an open channel for possibility, setting the seeds of intention for 2026. A nourishing way to begin the year in alignment.

Join Mel for a restorative and empowering Kundalini Yoga class, utilising the Opportunity & Green Energy Kriya—a sequence that awakens fresh potential, clears stagnant energy, and aligns you with abundance and opportunity.

After yoga, sink into deep rest with a 1 hour healing Gong Bath — where you lie down and let the soothing vibrations and sounds of the gong support inner renewal, nervous system reset, and integration of your intentions.

During the break between yoga and the gong bath, there will be time for guided journalling and a herbal tea break - creating space to plant the seeds of your intentions for 2026 or for the month ahead. This reflective moment helps you anchor your vision and consciously direct your energy for the new cycle.

Kundalini Yoga: 1.30pm – 3.00pm
Break: Herbal tea, healthy snack, guided journalling & oracle cards
Gong Bath: 3.30pm – 4.30pm

events.id: OVUS - CASCADE RELEASE SHOW WITH KOKOA NASHI AND LADYREIGN-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: OVUS - CASCADE RELEASE SHOW WITH KOKOA NASHI AND LADYREIGN
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ovus present their latest EP CASCADE, live on 18th Jan 2026 at Valhalla Tavern (Wellington Anniversary Weekend).
With support from the mega talented KOKOA NASHI and local powerhouse LADYREIGN.
------------------------------------------------------------
Doors 7:30 // First Band 8pm
OVUS
KOKOA NASHI
LADYREIGN
Tickets $25 +b.f. via Cosmic Ticketing (Live soon). Limited door sales.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Ovus are Wellington's premier instrumental progressive metal act. A massive sound that crashes soaring guitar melodies into mind boggling rhythms with a finesse that keeps a catchy through-line in every song. Their live show is high energy, immersive and packed full of riffs.
New Zealand's 2025 Battle of the Bands National Championship winners Kokoa Nashi bring a vibe like no other. Blending hip hop with progressive rock and metal sensibilities, you've never heard anything like it, and you'll have a blast experiencing it!
LadyReign is a six-piece alternative-metal band fronted by two powerful female vocalists. Fresh off the release of their newest single Crowd, LadyReign fuzes soulful melodies with the crushing heaviness of modern metal to create a sound that is both haunting and refreshing.

events.id: Unglued (UK)-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Unglued (UK)
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
One of the most in-demand names in UK drum’n’bass is touching down in Aotearoa.

From early breakout cuts like Ay! and Bootstrap Bill to his viral rework of If We Ever, Unglued has carved a reputation for high-impact production and fast-moving, peak-time DJ sets built for the rave — no filler, just pressure. Now signed exclusively to Hospital Records, he’s showing no signs of slowing down.

Coming in hot off the Soundsplash stage, this is a rare chance to catch one of the scene’s most reliable floor-destroyers up close.

events.venue: Willowbank Rd, Tawa, Wellington
events.long_description:
You’re warmly invited to join us for the Abundant Life Church Picnic on Wellington Anniversary Day, Monday 19 January, and we’d love for you to come along!
We’ll be gathering from 11:00am at Willowbank Reserve, Tawa for a relaxed, shared picnic. Feel free to bring along a BBQ if you’d like, as well as anything you need for an awesome day out.
There’ll be plenty of fun for all ages, including:
Water gun fights
Gumboot throwing
Games, laughter, and good company
It’s a great opportunity to relax, connect, and enjoy time together as a church community. All are welcome, so please invite your friends and family to come along and join us.
Just bring whatever you need for a great day, food, drinks, chairs, sun protection, and a sense of fun!
We’d love to see you there.

events.id: Wellington Anniversary Day Tour-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Anniversary Day Tour
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrate the founding of Wellington on our Anniversary holiday, and explore the stories of some of our early settlers - the rich, the famous, and the ordinary folk who arrived in Wellington in 1840 and the years immediately after, and set about developing new lives, laying down the foundations of our city.

This tour traverses the lower part of the cemetery, includes some of the earliest burials, and is easy walking. Tour duration 1.5 hours, starting and ending at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street. Cost $10 per person, children under 12 free, and good dogs on leads always welcome.

events.id: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.

events.id: Stewart Copeland Australia + New Zealand Tour - Jan 2026 | Opera House, Wellington-Opera House,111–113 Manners Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Stewart Copeland Australia + New Zealand Tour - Jan 2026 | Opera House, Wellington
events.venue: Opera House,111–113 Manners Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Stewart Copeland Australia + New Zealand Tour - Jan 2026 | Opera House, Wellington
We are thrilled to announce the legendary Stewart Copeland will be returning to Australia and New Zealand in January 2026.

A driving force in music for more than four decades, Stewart’s innovative drumming propelled him to fame with The Police alongside Sting and Andy Summers, creating some of the most iconic records in music history.

A seven-time Grammy winner and Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee, his career spans rock, symphony, opera, documentaries and even video games, including the acclaimed Spyro the Dragon. All the while, Stewart continues to push boundaries with humor, creativity, and a sense of adventure.

Join us for an unforgettable night of conversation as he shares maybe a little too much about The Police, Hollywood and other adventures.

All shows will be hosted by acclaimed radio presenter Sarah Tout and include an opportunity for fan submitted questions to be answered each night.

𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐬:
📍Perth: Sun 11 Jan - Regal Theatre, Perth
📍Melbourne: Wed 14 Jan - Forum II, Melbourne
📍Sydney: Fri 16 Jan - State Theatre, Sydney
📍Brisbane: Sat 17 Jan - The Tivoli, Brisbane
📍Wellington: Tue 20 Jan - Opera House, Wellington
📍Auckland: Wed 21 Jan - Bruce Mason Centre, Auckland

events.id: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Upper Hutt-Upper Hutt Libraries, 844 Fergusson Drive, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Early Childhood Centre Emergency Planning Workshop - Upper Hutt
events.venue: Upper Hutt Libraries, 844 Fergusson Drive, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Would you and your staff be confident in an emergency? Do you have a plan, and more importantly have you practiced it recently?

We are holding a free workshop for Early Childhood Education Centres in Upper Hutt to come together to discuss your emergency plans.

This workshop is an opportunity for ECEs to share challenges and solutions and get advice from our Emergency Management Advisors.

It aims to help ECEs plan for significant events such as earthquake, tsunami, armed intruders and to share ideas and network around emergency planning.

This is an opportunity for Centre Managers, Directors, Health & Safety Representatives or Leads to:

- Share solutions, practical advice and learnings from recent events.
- Discuss your current plans with emergency management professionals.
- Learn more about our local hazards and important planning information including lessons learnt from the Christchurch Earthquake, Christchurch Mosque Attack and Cyclone Gabrielle.

Hope to see you there as we build safer and more resilient ECEs and communities together.

Places are limited to a maximum of 30 people attending each session. This workshop is endorsed by the Ministry of Education.

For more information, please email info@wremo.nz

We aim to make our community events inclusive to all people. If you are attending the event and have specific accessibility requirements, you can send us an email at info@wremo.nz with the event name and we will get in touch to see how we can meet your needs as best we can.

events.id: Wellington Marine Life VR Experience-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Marine Life VR Experience
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dive beneath the surface and explore Wellington’s Blue Belt - no snorkel required!

Using virtual reality headsets, take a few minutes these school holidays to see the underwater world through the eyes of a scuba diver: swim through the deep reefs of Kapiti Island, be surrounded by schools of fish at Whitireia Park, glide through the lush marine forests of Taputeranga Marine Reserve, and explore a shipwreck! Expect close encounters with octopus, vibrant sea life and even a cute shark with the team from Explore Your Coast!

This free, drop-in event is suitable for the whole family and will be held in the Zealandia Visitor Centre Foyer. Regular admission fees to the sanctuary apply, and overflow carparking is available at Birdwood Street during the busy school holiday period.

To learn more about our local underwater forests, visit Explore Your Coast at https://exploreyourcoast.co.nz/

events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Sunset at the Beach
events.venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: Stewart Copeland - Have I Said Too Much-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stewart Copeland - Have I Said Too Much
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Legendary rock drummer, Stewart Copeland, is returning to Australia & New Zealand for the first time in 18 years. He will bring his ‘Have I Said Too Much? The Police, Hollywood, And Other Adventures’ show to our shores, following dozens of sold out shows across the UK.

Stewart says, “Demand for this intimate new show has surpassed my expectations, and I can’t wait to return to Australia & New Zealand next year and share the stories of my life with even more fans.”

As one of the greatest rock drummers of all time, he drove the all-conquering success of The Police during the 1970s and 1980s, before being inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. A multi-Grammy winner, who followed his work with The Police by composing music for soundtracks for Hollywood movies and operas, Stewart is hitting the road for his most intimate tour to date.

Having played drums for Curved Air from 1975 to 1976, Stewart was the founding member of The Police, recruiting lead singer Sting and guitarist Andy Summers.
His remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world domination between 1977 and 1986, and then again from 2007 to 2008 when the band reunited.

His Hollywood soundtracks include Francis Ford Coppola’s Rumblefish and Oliver Stone’s Wall Street and Talk Radio. He has written books, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts.

This special evening with Stewart Copeland will provide a fascinating insight into his incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. All shows will be hosted by acclaimed Perth radio broadcaster, Sarah Tout.

Meet and Greet packages will be available and fans will also be able to submit questions for Stewart to answer on stage.

events.id: Nordic Voice Artist Anna Fält Returns to Aotearoa-34 Mulgrave Street, Thorndon, New Zealand 6011,Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Nordic Voice Artist Anna Fält Returns to Aotearoa
events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Thorndon, New Zealand 6011,Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Nordic Voice Artist Anna Fält Returns to Aotearoa

Anna Fält is a versatile voice artist, composer and singing teacher with a deep passion for Nordic folk singing. She has toured widely across the Nordic region and beyond with her distinctive solo vocal concerts. Drawing on singing traditions from her two home countries, Finland and Sweden, she blends bright Scandinavian clarity with darker East European colours, performing in churches, museums, festivals, clubs and concert halls.

Her concerts celebrate the power of the human voice: a one woman band creating sound worlds you may have never heard before. Tradition meets vocal art, experimentation and storytelling in a personal and intimate way. Audiences everywhere connect to the honesty of an unaccompanied voice, no matter the language.

Alongside her solo work, Fält collaborates in performing arts and multidisciplinary projects, and is an active teacher and lecturer. She holds three music degrees and has studied folk music in five countries, but her central focus remains developing the art of solo a cappella performance. She has collaborated with several Aotearoa artists over the years, including film composer Karl Sölve Steven and taonga puoro player Rob Thorne.

Fält now returns to Aotearoa for her third tour, bringing her powerful voice and Nordic stories back to local audiences.

Koha entry.

events.id: School Holiday Movies-Embassy of Japan, Level 18, 100 Willis Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: School Holiday Movies
events.venue: Embassy of Japan, Level 18, 100 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come and enjoy our free School Holiday Movie Screenings, co-organised with the Japan Foundation, Sydney!

We will be showing two exciting films, ”Porco Rosso” and ” Shin Ultraman”.

Porco Rosso:10am 21 January and 2pm 28 January 2026
Synopsis
World War I has ended, and peace reigns again. Aviators from around the world circle above the Adriatic Sea, keen to recapture the romanticism of flight lost during the war. Many have turned to air piracy, in amongst which a hero emerges: a man with a pig's head, known as Porco Rosso (once an Italian air force pilot called Marco Pagot).

As a mercenary law-enforcer of the skies and oceans, Porco Rosso protects cruise ships from the air pirates above them. When his actions are challenged by Curtis, an American who flies with the pirates, Porco Rosso is forced to defend his honour against this newcomer, which leads him to Fio, a feisty young engineer who rebuilds Porco's plane for the big dogfight.
Director: MIYAZAKI Hayao / Classification: PG / Year: 1992 / Genre: Anime
Language: Japanese with English subtitles
Copyright:© 1992 Studio Ghibli – NN

Shin Ultraman: 2pm 21 January and 10am 28 January 2026
Synopsis
When Japan's SSSP kaiju defence task force finds itself in the midst of a particularly challenging kaiju encounter, a giant silver robot descends from the sky to rescue the country. Dubbed Ultraman, this robot’s identity and purpose are a mystery. As further alien forces arrive on Earth, the task force, led by Kimio Tamura (Hidetoshi Nishijima, Drive My Car), attempts to identify their true intentions.
Director: HIGUCHI Shinji/ Classification:PG / Year: 2022/ Genre: Action and Adventure
Language: Japanese with English subtitles
Copyright:Copyright © 2022 TSUBURAYA PRODUCTIONS CO., LTD. / TOHO CO., LTD. / khara, Inc.

A short Japan Video Topics DVD will be shown from 5:15pm before the start of the film at 5:30pm. Free admission is based on a first-come, first-served basis, with a full theatre capacity of 40 people. No food is permitted in the theatre

When his actions are challenged by Curtis, an American who flies with the pirates, Porco Rosso is forced to defend his honour against this newcomer, which leads him to Fio, a feisty young engineer who rebuilds Porco's plane for the big dogfight.
Director: MIYAZAKI Hayao / Classification: PG / Year: 1992 / Genre: Anime Language: Japanese with English subtitles Copyright:© 1992 Studio Ghibli – NN Shin Ultraman: 2pm 21 January and 10am 28 January 2026 Synopsis When Japan's SSSP kaiju defence task force finds itself in the midst of a particularly challenging kaiju encounter, a giant silver robot descends from the sky to rescue the country.

events.id: String Bean Puppets: Flutter-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: String Bean Puppets: Flutter
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
These school holidays, treat the tamariki to a gorgeous puppet show developed here at Zealandia by String Bean Puppets. Experience the magic of puppetry and te taiao in this empowering and delightful show for young audiences.

A bat who is afraid of the dark encounters a glow worm who thinks she is a star. Themes of courage, friendship, and conservation are interwoven with a heartwarming story that introduces audiences to the unique and endangered short-tailed bat.

This show will be in the Pāteke Room on Level 2 of the Visitor Centre, suitable for all ages.

When entering the sanctuary general admission fees apply, free entry for Zealandia members.

Overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.

events.id: Nordic Voice Artist Anna Fält Returns to Aotearoa-Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nordic Voice Artist Anna Fält Returns to Aotearoa
events.venue: Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington
events.long_description:
Anna Fält is a versatile voice artist, composer and singing teacher with a deep passion for Nordic folk singing. She has toured widely across the Nordic region and beyond with her distinctive solo vocal concerts. Drawing on singing traditions from her two home countries, Finland and Sweden, she blends bright Scandinavian clarity with darker Eastern European colours, performing in churches, museums, festivals, clubs and concert halls.

Her concerts celebrate the power of the human voice: a one-woman band creating sound worlds you may have never heard before. Tradition meets vocal art, experimentation and storytelling in a personal and intimate way. Audiences everywhere connect to the honesty of an unaccompanied voice, no matter the language.

Alongside her solo work, Fält collaborates in performing arts and multidisciplinary projects and is an active teacher and lecturer. She holds three music degrees and has studied folk music in five countries, but her central focus remains developing the art of solo a cappella performance. She has collaborated with several Aotearoa artists over the years, including film composer Karl Sölve Steven and taonga puoro player Rob Thorne.

Fält now returns to Aotearoa for her third tour, bringing her powerful voice and Nordic stories back to local audiences.

Koha entry.

events.id: Welly On Wheels: Waterfront to Karori and back-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels: Waterfront to Karori and back
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington City Council and Pedal Ready are teaming up to run a guided bike tour along the cycle route between Karori, the Botanical Gardens and the waterfront! Get to know the route and street changes, build cycling confidence and skills, and learn about interesting features such as murals and fix it stands along the way!

This ride starts and ends at Switched On Bikes on the waterfront near Waitangi Park. The route leads along the scenic waterfront, past the Botanical Gardens, with the "Gardens magic" in full swing, up to Karori and Karori Park, and into South Karori to the starting point of Mākara Peak mountain bike trails. We will then retrace our tracks back to Karori Park and use the separated cycle lane to travel through Karori, and back down past the Botanical Gardens and on to the waterfront. The ride will finish at Switched-on-Bikes.

For alternative arrangements for the end of this bike tour, please see details below!

An electric bike is strongly recommended to participate due to the hilly nature of this ride. Thanks to Switched on Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent an electric bike for just $10 if you don't have access to one. Please book your rental e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

Allow 2 hours.
Please arrive 30 minutes early (by 5pm) if you are renting a bike.

These rides are suitable for people who:
- know how to ride a bike but aren't yet cycling in the city; or
- are cycling in the city but would like to gain confidence; or
- want to learn how to use new cycling infrastructure.

Open to riders aged 18+ (or 13+ if accompanied by an adult). Families are also welcome to bring younger children on cargo bikes or bike seats provided themselves. Please enquire directly with Switched on Bikes if you'd like to borrow a bike seat for the tour.

Alternative arrangements for the end of this bike tour:
- If you're feeling extra enthusiastic and want to extend your bike hire, you're welcome to hold onto the bike overnight and return it before 10am to Switched on Bikes at no extra charge!
- There's also the option to hold onto the bike all day the following day for a discounted cost of $39.
Please discuss your intentions with us on the day.

If this tour is not quite for you and you would like to learn to ride a bike away from the road instead, please check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website https://www.pedalready.org.nz/. Any pātai (questions) about these tours please get in contact: info@pedalready.org.nz
PRIVACY STATEMENT: The information you shared in signing up for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Within 14 days after the tour, your name and emergency contact details will be deleted. Other information provided may be stored anonymously to support our project evaluation. Your email address will be stored for up to 4 months following the tour. Within that time, we may contact you with follow-up information about biking in Pōneke, as well as feedback opportunities about the ride and the impact it has had on your travel around Pōneke. You have the right to ask for a copy of any personal information we hold about you and to ask for it to be corrected if you believe it is incorrect. If you would like to ask for a copy of your information or to have it corrected, please contact us at tours@wcc.govt.nz.

events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Bike Night - Pack Up & Strap Up!
Join us for our first Bike Night for 2026! Summer is in full swing and that means road trips. That also means ferrying your bike if your planning to spend some quality time, wearing down your tyres, on the south island.

We'll be taking you through the must have items you should always take with you on a road trip, aside from the tooth brush and change of under garments.

We'll also go through how to properly strap your bike on the ferry. Remember, if the person next to you seems to be struggling, you better make sure they strap their bike correctly too!

BBQ heats up at 5:30pm, $2 gold coins help us pay for these weekly events. Drinks are available to purchase at the coffee counter.

events.id: Beoga-171 Cuba Street, New Zealand 6011,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Beoga
events.venue: 171 Cuba Street, New Zealand 6011,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Beoga
Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.

Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.

After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.

With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June.
The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.

events.id: Jewellery making - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery making - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Craft your own rings or pendant in this introduction to metal-smith jewellery making! In this quick paced one session workshop you’ll learn some metalworking fundamentals to turn raw silver, copper and brass into shining wearable rings or pendant. Use hammers and stamps to add textures and simple lettering to customise your creation!

Minimum age is 13 years

Techniques:
- Use sizers and jeweller’s callipers to measure ring size
- Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces
- Use hammers and stamps to texture and form metal
- Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal
- Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery

events.id: Telescope Mastery-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Telescope Mastery
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces.

events.id: Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Reiki Circle to Align Your Pathways
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
A soothing Reiki Circle designed to provide gentle biofield support. This session invites relaxation, balance, and heart coherence using a hands-off, consent-based approach. You’ll feel the nurturing energy flowing as you connect with yourself and others in a warm, welcoming space.

Plus - your ticket includes an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert!

This workshop is perfect for anyone experiencing:
•⁠ ⁠Stress and overwhelm
•⁠ ⁠Wired-and-tired fatigue
•⁠ ⁠Overthinking and mental clutter
•⁠ ⁠Sleep disruption
•⁠ ⁠Heaviness in the chest
•⁠ ⁠Creative blocks

Whether you're a beginner or familiar with Reiki, you are warmly welcomed.

What to expect
•⁠ ⁠Arrival Ritual and Consent: Settle into the space and establish your intention.
•⁠ ⁠Guided Breath Arrival: Begin with a gentle breathing exercise to ground yourself.
•⁠ ⁠Group Reiki Session: Experience a soothing hands-off Reiki session accompanied by a soft soundscape.
•⁠ ⁠Quiet Reflection: Take time to integrate your experience in a peaceful environment.
•⁠ ⁠Grounding Tea: Enjoy a cup of tea to nourish and ground you after the session.

What to bring
•⁠ ⁠Warm layers and socks
•⁠ ⁠Water bottle
•⁠ ⁠Small towel
•⁠ ⁠Optional eye mask or light scarf
•⁠ ⁠Journal and pen
•⁠ ⁠If you tend to feel cold, consider bringing a blanket

Pre-class prep
•⁠ ⁠Eat a light meal 2 hours before the class.
•⁠ ⁠Hydrate well throughout the day.
•⁠ ⁠Avoid alcohol and recreational substances for 24 hours prior, ideally 3 days before
•⁠ ⁠Limit caffeine intake 4 hours before class.
•⁠ ⁠Arrive 10 minutes early for intake.
•⁠ ⁠If you have health conditions, check with your provider before attending.
•⁠ ⁠Feel free to email Lynn at hi@lynofuro.co.nz with any questions or concerns.

Contraindications and safety
Reiki is gentle and typically safe, but it's essential to note that it does not replace medical or mental health care. If you have acute psychiatric distress, unmanaged seizures, or are recovering from surgery, please consult your provider first. Inform Lynn if you are wearing a pacemaker or under medications.

Aftercare
After the session, we encourage you to drink plenty of water, nourish yourself with healthy lighter food, engage in simple movement or a short walk, and journal your insights. Emotional waves may continue for 24 to 48 hours, so please reach out if you need support.

Meet Lynn, your facilitator:
Lynn is an integrative somatic coach and Reiki practitioner dedicated to supporting individuals in navigating corporate burnout, chronic pain, and stress. Her approach is gentle and accessible, making spiritual practices approachable and friendly to the nervous system.

Questions before you join? Email hi@lynofuro.co.nz, and Lynn will support you.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sound Healing Experience
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Step into an evening of restorative soundscapes, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply calming and rejuvenating experience. Your ticket also includes a delicious plant-based dinner and dessert to complete the evening.

Ancient instruments—from Gongs to Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls and Native American flutes—come together in a rich tapestry of sound, inviting you to slow down, breathe, and reconnect with yourself.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it vibrating through your body, encouraging profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—simply arrive as you are and let the music carry you into a space of calm and presence.

What to Bring
Yoga mats, blankets, and cushions are provided, but you are welcome to bring your own mat or extra comforts for a truly personal experience.

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:

SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

events.id: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.
After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.
With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: Kush Jones [USA] with Benny Salvador, Lake Boon, Current Bias-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Kush Jones [USA] with Benny Salvador, Lake Boon, Current Bias
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
For the first time since 2022, Kush Jones is making his way back to Te Whanganui-a-tara to play at Meow on January 22nd.

A native of the Bronx, New York - Kush Jones as a producer and international DJ cuts across Chicago footwork, Jersey club, jungle, UK grime and raw, forward-thinking club mutations. Revered for high-impact sets and restless energy behind the decks, Kush blurs scenes and tempos with masterful precision.

First breaking through the footwork scene with his 2016 debut EP Sleep on TAR Records, Kush followed up with Momentum via Juke Bounce Werk, before appearing on Trax Couture’s landmark The Whole World Series compilation. Beyond official releases, his catalogue runs deep with self-released projects and unreleased club weapons, constantly evolving and always unpredictable.

Kush Jones will be joined at Meow by an array of Pōneke's favourite selectors Benny Salvador, Lake Boon and Current Bias.
Secure your tickets today!

events.id: Live Music - Ryan Edwards-Get Fixed Bicycle Cafe & Panhead Bar,16 Parumoana St, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Live Music - Ryan Edwards
events.venue: Get Fixed Bicycle Cafe & Panhead Bar,16 Parumoana St, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Live Music - Ryan Edwards
Ryan Edwards is a singer, guitarist and performer of the highest quality. Kiwi born and raised, he took his music overseas where he played on stages and in cafes and bars in England, France, Ireland and The United States.

Whether he’s playing his own original songs or giving his own feel to some of the best songs ever written - his warm vocals, his knack for knowing the right song to sing at any moment and his tremendous repertoire makes him a favourite with audiences of all ages.

"I was lucky to grow up in a time when music was something special. The radio stations played the latest music, but they also dipped back into the 60's and 70's, and I just soaked it all up. Many of the songs I sing are unlearned - they're just 'in there' somehow - from just listening."

events.id: Whānau Chine Colle - Creative arts holiday programme for teens & adult-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whānau Chine Colle - Creative arts holiday programme for teens & adult
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Welcome to mixed media collage the printmakers way. Chine Colle is a printing process in which a thin sheet of paper is printed on and at the same time, mounted on a sturdier sheet, creating a subtle delicate backdrop to the printed image. Expanded on, this can include contrasting papers, graphic images, select colour shapes and fabric.

This is a workshop whereby teens (minimum age 13) are encouraged to learn collectively with one of their favourite adults. Art can be created as a joint or individual project. The mission is just to have fun creating together in the fabulous Inverlochy print studio.

In this one day workshop people will:

- Practice traditional and individual chine colle techniques
- Explore the use of delicate papers more responsive to ink and hand printing
- Test and practice mixed media chine colle with images, papers and fabric
- How effective chine colle is as a method of adding colour to prints
- Making and using a damp pack
- Recipes for traditional glues

events.id: s Wellington Theatre Tours-The Opera House Wellington, Wellington, NZ-Ticket Master
events.name: s Wellington Theatre Tours
events.venue: The Opera House Wellington, Wellington, NZ
events.long_description:
General Admission OnlyAll Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

Join us for a behind-the-scenes tour of Wellington's iconic St James Theatre and The Opera House. Discover hidden stories, architectural splendour, and rich theatrical history as you step behind the velvet curtain and explore two of the city's most beloved performance spaces. Led by expert guides, this tour takes you on a journey through over a century of theatre magic. Tread the boards in the footsteps of legendary performers. Uncover the secrets of stagecraft and marvel at the breathtaking details of these heritage-listed buildings. From opulent foyers and ornate auditoriums to backstage corridors brimming with history, you'll see the theatres as you've never seen them before.

events.id: Wellington Government House Garden tour-Government House Visitor Centre, Hospital Road Entrance, Newtown Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Government House Garden tour
events.venue: Government House Visitor Centre, Hospital Road Entrance, Newtown Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Explore Government House gardens with the BARK garden team (90 minute tour)

Government House was opened in Newtown in 1910, and its extensive gardens have been in continuous development since then. As part of the Spring Festival, the Government House garden team is offering guided walks through our gardens. Tours will go ahead regardless of weather. Tours will not enter the main house.

Bookings are essential for the free tour. Places are limited: https://gg.govt.nz/government-house/government-house-wellington/government-house-tours/upcoming

Some parts of our grounds are not mobility friendly. Please contact the Visitor Centre direct if you have any questions regarding accessibility.

Groups wanting to organise a garden tour or house tour can email our Visitor Centre team direct: bookings@govthouse.govt.nz

If you have any questions or need more information, please email us at bookings@govthouse.govt.nz, or call us at 04-382-0837. You will receive a reminder email 24 hours before your tour.

events.id: Om Unit (UK) & Roza Terenzi (AUS) | Wellington | San Fran-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Om Unit (UK) & Roza Terenzi (AUS) | Wellington | San Fran
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Om Unit (UK) & Roza Terenzi (AUS) | Wellington | San Fran
It's a christmas miracle!

GHOST MEDIA & TERMINAL45 PRESENT: OM UNIT (UK) & ROZA TERENZI (AUS)
+ SUPPORT FROM CURRENT BIA5 & KINDEKEL II
23 JANUARY @ SAN FRAN

We're firing into 2026 in style! Ghost Media and Terminal 45 are teaming up to present two serious heavyweights of alternative dance music - OM UNIT (UK) and Roza Terenzi (AUS)

Both of these artists are stalwarts in their own right, and we're seriously excited to present them side by side for the first time, in Pōneke, for a night of undeniable groove, bass, and energy.

OM UNIT (Jim Coles) is a highly respected electronic music producer and DJ from the UK, known for pioneering genre-bending sounds, fusing jungle, dubstep, footwork, techno, ambient, and hip-hop into a unique style, as well as running the Cosmic Bridge Records label, and pushing boundaries with innovative sound design and releases like his influential "Threads" album and "Acid Dub Studies" project.

ROZA TERENZI (Katie Campbell) is an acclaimed Australian DJ, producer, and label head known for her eclectic, genre-bending electronic sound that blends techno, breakbeat, electro, trance, and jungle with bush doof energy. Her music offers futuristic, playful rave vibes, and is featured on labels like Planet Euphorique and Dekmantel, alongside her own imprint, Step Ball Chain. Since bringing her sound to Berlin she has cemented her status in the global underground scene.

With these two iconic figures in command of the tools, you can expect nothing but pure quality throughout, as we prepare to undergo a true sonic journey across flavours of acid, house, techno, jungle and whatever else the selectors decide to pull out of the bag.

To begin the journey, we have local hero CURRENT BIAS, peddling their distinctive brand of atmospheric and deconstructed club music to warm things up. Closing things out we have KINDEKEL II, another talented Pōneke selector with a knack for delivering pulsing, driving techno and rhythmic soundscapes.

Tickets are available for $40, with a few $30 early birds in the mix.
Get yours now and prepare for an absolutely stellar night of sonic vibrations!

events.name: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Friends
events.venue: Carterton Events Centre, 50 Holloway Street, Carterton
events.long_description:
We invite you to a magical morning: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Friends, celebrating the timeless music of Rodgers & Hammerstein, the legendary duo behind some of Broadway’s most beloved musicals plus songs from some of their contemporaries. This unforgettable concert will feature a dazzling lineup of artists led by Westend star Russell Dixon, performing iconic songs from The Sound of Music, Oklahoma!, South Pacific, Carousel, The King and I, and more.

Experience the sweeping romance of Some Enchanted Evening and People Will Say We’re In Love, the joyful spirit of Oh, What a Beautiful Mornin’ and Oklahoma and the heartfelt power of Climb Every Mountain, all brought to life by these stellar voices. Our concert promises to be a glorious tribute to the golden age of musical theatre.

Featuring:
Russell Dixon
Kate Lineham
Kalauni Pouvalu
Emma Sloman
Ravil Atlas
Grant Winterburn

NZ Tour 14 January 2026 – 17 February 2026
Concerts Start 11am
General Admission Seating
Doors Open 10am – Complimentary morning tea included.

Phone: 0508 266 237
Email: bookings@operatunity.co.nz

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.
Also a private cooking classes available.
3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.
4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi.
Also fresh paneer making.

events.id: Fiver's Top Surgery Fundraiser Queer Poetry Evening-13 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Fiver's Top Surgery Fundraiser Queer Poetry Evening
events.venue: 13 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora! Come along for a night of poetry, fresh baking, zines, and wine to help Fiver afford a vital part of his transition. Featuring A Fine Line and Symposia editor Cadence Chung, the published Kermit Winona and July Kerr, new name Hades King, and Fiver Dearnley himself reading some of their queer works. This will be followed by an open mic where anyone is welcome to share some poetry of any flavour.
Raffle tickets will be available on the night for a pot including prizes from Reclamation Piercing and Yum Jar, as well as other items.
Tickets are $5 unwaged, $10 waged, and can also be purchased at the door via cash or bank transfer. The venue has a lot of stairs and is not accessible unfortunately.
