OM UNIT (Jim Coles) is a highly respected electronic music producer and DJ from the UK, known for pioneering genre-bending sounds, fusing jungle, dubstep, footwork, techno, ambient, and hip-hop into a unique style, as well as running the Cosmic Bridge Records label, and pushing boundaries with innovative sound design and releases like his influential "Threads" album and "Acid Dub Studies" project.
Her music offers futuristic, playful rave vibes, featured on labels like Planet Euphorique and Dekmantel, alongside her own imprint, Step Ball Chain, and since bringing her sound to Berlin she has cemented her status in the global underground scene.
With these two iconic figures in command of the tools, you can expect nothing but pure quality throughout, as we prepare to undergo a true sonic journey across flavours of acid, house, techno, jungle and whatever else the selectors decide to pull out of the bag.
To begin the journey, we have local hero CURRENT BIAS, peddling their distinctive brand of atmospheric and deconstructed club music.
Closing things out we have KINDEKEL II, another talented Pōneke selector with a knack for delivering pulsing, driving techno and rhythmic soundscapes.

events.id: Wilson Blackley 'Remain' Tour With Oscar Ladell-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Wilson Blackley 'Remain' Tour With Oscar Ladell
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Wilson Blackley returns to Aotearoa alongside Oscar LaDell and King Leo this summer to celebrate the release of his new song 'Remain' (Co-written by Troy Kingi).

Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne. Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’. ‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.

Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear. At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley returns to Aotearoa alongside Oscar LaDell and King Leo this summer to celebrate the release of his new song 'Remain'
events.description:
Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne.
Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age.
He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument.
‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.
After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell.

events.id: Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit-2351 state highway 3, Sanson, New Zealand 4479,2351 SH 3, Sanson 4479, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit
events.venue: 2351 state highway 3, Sanson, New Zealand 4479,2351 SH 3, Sanson 4479, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Rider Biochemics with Fran from Firmly Fit
Pilates is unique in its total body approach to movement. It gives you balance, strength and flexibility, emphasizing the deep postural muscles of the abdomen and back.
All these skills and principles lay a foundation for good riding – Posture, Postural Support, and Body Awareness and Body Control are tools a rider needs in the saddle.
Through carefully designed movements, the correct abdominal and back muscles engage to align the spine maintaining good posture while the horse is moving.
This allows the rider to stay in self-carriage, balanced over the middle of the horse. Suppleness of shoulders, and minimal gripping with legs is then possible.
Many Pilates exercises also develop balance in the muscles of the hip joints to promote maximal range of motion. Many riders have had falls and injuries that contribute towards imbalance which can be fixed with Pilates.
With the rider being balanced and pain free the horse can perform better making the riding relationship harmonious.
Booking is essential
$85.00 per session
$15.00 Arena fee
Payments are due16th January 2026 5pm
Once booked & paid you own it, if you have to cancel please do so before the 16th so we can find someone else, if you have already paid you will receive a refund on filling your spot.
Any cancellations from 16th Jan to time of session there will be no refund given.

events.id: Porirua Montessori Primary + Intermediate School Open Day. Kids and Children Porirua.-39 Cleat Street, Porirua Pa, New Zealand 5024,39 Cleat St, Whitby, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In

events.long_description:
Porirua Montessori Primary + Intermediate School Open Day. Kids and Children Porirua.
Come and visit us at our open day Saturday Jan 24th. We are a small school with a true family and community ethos. We believe that children deserve an individual education that prepares them for life. We value life skills, emotional intelligence and academic skills.
====

At Porirua Montessori Primary School we believe in a different kind of learning – one where every child is truly seen, valued and empowered.
👣 Instead of embedding children into age-only class groups, we use mixed‐age classrooms so younger tamariki learn from older peers and older children grow in leadership and empathy.


🎯 We focus on independence and choice. Our students plan parts of their day, select work that meets their interests and pace, and deepen concentration in long, uninterrupted work sessions.


🌍 Our curriculum is grounded in “Education for Life” – we integrate academic learning with care for each child, community, culture and the environment. Respect, responsibility and compassion are woven through everything.


📚 We go beyond the expected. With small class sizes and a learning environment designed especially for students aged 5-13, we tailor programmes to each child’s strengths and needs rather than expecting every child to move at the same pace.


If you’re looking for something beyond the usual primary school experience – a place where your child can grow not just academically but as a confident, capable, connected human – get in touch with us today to learn more about 2026

RSVP -
enrolments. https://poriruamontessori.squarespace.com/

events.id: 🩷 Dance for Kanan: 24-Hour Dance-A-Thon Fundraiser 🩷-302 Kapiti Rd, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: 🩷 Dance for Kanan: 24-Hour Dance-A-Thon Fundraiser 🩷
events.venue: 302 Kapiti Rd, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
🩷 Dance for Kanan: 24-Hour Dance-A-Thon Fundraiser 🩷
***NEW DATE***
Join us for an unforgettable 24 hours of movement, music, and magic as we come together to raise funds for our beloved Kanan’s unfunded breast cancer treatment.

Last month, Kanan received the shock of her life when she was diagnosed with HER2 positive breast cancer, an aggressive sub-type of breast cancer that can spread and grow rapidly. Unfortunately, the targeted treatment isn't funded, and Kanan is looking at costs of approx $35,000-$40,000.

This is more than just a dance event — it’s a celebration of her community, strength, and the power of showing up.

We’ve rallied an insanely talented team of 20+ dance professionals, each donating their time and energy to teach a class. From hip hop to heels, contemporary to line-dancing — there’s something for everyone.

Thanks to the generosity of Hannah from Sweet Studios, we’ll be dancing non-stop on the Kapiti Coast, and we want YOU to be part of it!

💃 4 Ways to Join the Movement:

🕚 Mini Movers (5 hours, Year 1-4)
Take on the mini challenge by getting sponsored while you learn some new styles of dance and how to present yourself on a stage!

🕛 Half-Day Hero (12 Hours, Year 5 - Year 8)
Get sponsored for every hour you dance — rally your supporters and groove for a cause. Can be done individually or split between a group!

🕘 Full-Day Fighter (24 Hours, Year 9+)
Take on the full 24-hour challenge and let your sponsors pledge per hour. Every step helps Kanan get closer to healing. Recommended todo this as a group!

🩰 Drop-In Diva ($25/class)
Choose any class that speaks to your soul and join us for just $25. No strings, just good vibes.

Register here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfEhUtS2rawbqzFrAQUDKtrjTZAG2e4iXZuwDMZCzWWS3B3Gw/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=103696675397207234907

Let’s dance with purpose. Let’s dance for Kanan. 💕

Follow this page for the full class schedule, teacher lineup, and donation links, all coming soon!

Tag your dance crew, share the love, and let’s make this a night (and day!) to remember.

If you would like to make a donation that is not in relation to this event we have a givealittle page to go towards medical treatment!

https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/help-kanan-beat-breast-cancer?fbclid=PAZnRzaANRYQNleHRuA2FlbQIxMQABp5fzszelgEfNjzqdy_kw4dT_eE7zFgotopBZphiGHLWVgZrVrrgbEwAmhgSI_aem_JNj2Mm1s5SZkz5LknQkBxA

events.long_description:
Hiwinui Sunflower Field Open Day
We’re thrilled to welcome you back for our 2026 Sunflower Season 🌻
A breathtaking summer experience just 10 minutes from Palmerston North and Feilding. Hiwinui Sunflower Field is a rare and unforgettable destination open for a limited time only.


🌻 ENTRY (CASH ONLY)
🚫 NO EFTPOS facilities on site
• Adults (13 years +): $10
• Children under 13 years: FREE

🌻 PICK YOUR OWN SUNFLOWERS
• Bring your own secateurs or hire for $15 (includes 4 stems)
• $3 per stem
• $1 from every bloom donated to Arohanui Hospice 💛

🌿 EXTRA ACTIVITIES
• Wander our walking and flower track – a brand new field design for 2026
• Stunning photo opportunities & new photo props
• Plenty for the kids including:
– Giant Swing
– Scavenger Hunt
– Lawn Games
• Meet the farm animals: Dior the pony and Poppy & Rambo the pet sheep
• Fonterra Barrel Train Rides – (Gold coin donation)
• Face Painting – (Extra charge $5 per person)
• Extended picnic area with our Hamptons marquee for shade and shelter
• Food Trucks (opening weekend & Food Truck Fridays)
• Real Fruit Ice Cream (opening weekend & Food Truck Fridays)

🕒 OPENING HOURS
📅 Saturday 24 & Sunday 25 January
⏰ 10:00am – 4:00pm

🌻 PRIVATE FIELD HIRE
The sunflower field is available for private hire from 5:30pm – 8:30pm.
Limited spaces available — bookings must be made directly.

📍 LOCATION & PARKING
465 Ashhurst Road, Palmerston North
• Located off the main road — please indicate well in advance
• Follow signage to the main car park
• 🚫 Do not enter via the main entrance of Hiwinui Country Estate
(This is EXIT ONLY)

⚠️ HEALTH & SAFETY
As we are a working farm, please note:
• Leave animals at home (except service dogs)
• Wear suitable footwear — tracks may be uneven
• There are bees and pollen in the field — bring medication if required
• Basic first aid is available at the site office

🌻 We can’t wait to welcome you for another unforgettable sunflower season at Hiwinui

Personal Spiritual Healing
Spiritual Healing is a healing modality where the practitioner acts as a clear channel for the healing energy to come through. Spiritual Healing is an effective method to bring about a deep, relaxing, enjoyable state which promotes self-healing. In some cases it will deal with the emotional release that is required at the time.
Spiritual Healing enables you to feel an inner peace. The loving touch of comfort and reassurance to regain the power within you, is always present.
The healing can be a moving and a heart felt experience.
Energy is transmitted to you during the healing, all you have to do is open your heart to receive the healing energy.
It strengthens your whole wellbeing.
No appointment is necessary on Saturday, just come on in.
A Spiritual Healing session usually takes 20-30 minutes.

events.id: Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection-Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
🌸 Silent Retreat – A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection

Hosted by Lisa Conroy from Living the Sweet Life & Tracey Crandall from CharlieRae/TraceyLidene Art

📍 Lotus Yoga & Retreat Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu (a short stroll from the train station)
🗓️ Saturday, 24th January 2026
🕐10.00am - 3.00pm
💰 $125 — all materials provided
🥗 Light refreshments available throughout the day (BYO lunch)
✨ Event Link: https://facebook.com/events/s/silent-retreat-a-day-of-calm-c/1831388837742351/?

Shhh… can you hear it? That gentle whisper calling you back to yourself? 💫
Join us for a day designed to quiet the noise and awaken your inner calm through creativity, meditation, and mindful stillness.

You’ll be gently guided through soulful experiences — from sound bowls and meditation to creative journaling, intuitive art, and sacred self-care. This retreat is your space to exhale, reflect, and simply be. Surrounded by nature, a pond and birdsong.

✨ What’s Included:
🌿 Begin your day with a guided meditation and soothing sound healing
🌿 Infuse your crystal of intention — your quiet companion for the day (and it goes home with you)
🌿 Wander between creative stations at your own pace:

* Write a letter to yourself 💌
* Connect with nature through leaf rubbings & botanical sketches 🌸
* Create an intention or dream page from magazines 🌈
* Try teabag art, intuitive breath drawings, and mandala inserts 🎨
* Pull a symbol stone and reflect on what it means to you 🪶

Your beautiful journal (included) will grow with colour, words, and meaning as the day unfolds.

🌸 Pampering & Peace
Because we all need a little nurturing...
🩷 Foot soak stations (ahh, yes please!)
🩷 Self-pampering including warm stones to hold and melt away tension

Prompts to guide your day:
💫 Inspirational gentle prompts
💫 A space to leave little love notes of encouragement to be shared at the end

A gentle, soul-soothing day to rest, create, and reconnect — surrounded by stillness, soft energy, and kind hearts.
✨ Spaces are limited for this intimate experience.

Contact for further information or to book your place.

🪷Tracey Crandall -
🌸Lisa Conroy -


With Creativity, Sparkle & Soul,
Tracey & Lisa
CharlieRae & Living the Sweet Life

👯‍♀️ Meet your co-creators:
Tracey Crandall and Lisa Conroy are two creative souls who live for colour, connection, and sparking joy. Together, they blend art, play, and nurturing rituals into experiences that lift you up, light you up, and leave you glowing inside and out.

One Marathon to Rule Them All…

Step into Middle-earth and settle in for an epic journey unlike any other. From the rolling hills of the Shire to the fiery heart of Mount Doom, Reading Cinemas invites you to experience Tolkien’s legendary saga as it was meant to be seen — on the big screen, extended editions, and in one unforgettable marathon adventure. events.venue: Te Papa Museum,Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Whānau Day: Te au kakara i te moana
UTUKORE | FREE 🌊 Rā o te Whānau: Te au kakara i te moana | Whānau Day: The sweet aroma of the ocean breeze

Ka ako mō te Raumati mā ngā mahi utukore pai mō te whānau, arā, ngā awheawhe me ngā whakaari.

Learn about raumati (summer) with free family-friendly activities, workshops, and performances.

Activities:
◼️ Seaweed identification with Mountains to Sea
◼️ Tokelau drumming and dance workshop with Kupega Affect
◼️ Create moana-inspired crayon pāreu (sarong) designs with Pacific Climate Warriors
◼️ Live reading of I Love My Island by Moemoana Asfa'ato'a Schwinke, narrated by Inangaro Vakaafi
◼️ Native plant workshops with Te Rito Gardens
◼️ Face painting
◼️ Paint watercolours
◼️ Learn about Te Papa's Collections from our art and botany cutators

Read the full programme here: https://www.tepapa.govt.nz/visit/events/whanau-day-the-sweet-aroma-of-the-ocean-breeze

events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. Waitangi Park hosts Gindulgence in January. A group of 18 distillers will showcase a fabulous selection of more than 90 gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world. The ticket price includes samples from distillers, so you’ll be able to explore an exceptional range. Delight the senses with botanical flavour combinations. 
This year, it’s not just gin that features in the outdoor fair. You’ll find rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other specialist spirits. Shop for a summer tipple or listen to presentations from some passionate distillers. Alternatively, just sit back on the grass and soak up the atmosphere, accompanied by live acoustic music and great local food.

events.id: Ecstatic Dance Wellington-Vogelmorn Hall,13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Ecstatic Dance Wellington
events.venue: Vogelmorn Hall,13 Vennell St, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. 💫

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to be hosting Ecstatic Dance Wellington! 🎉

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With 25 years behind the decks—including 9 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and teaches Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn Hall, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

🎟 Tickets
$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington-e5sre8te

$30 cash on the door

**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.

☀️ Extra Info
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to co-creating with the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

❤️ What to Bring

Water bottle

Loose, comfy clothes

Warm layers for afterwards

A pillow and Blanket if you wish

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

Without phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/

✨ Come dance with us at Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

🎉 💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants.
With 25 years behind the decks—including 9 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection.

events.id: Galette Des Rois Workshop-Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand,Level 2, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Galette Des Rois Workshop
events.venue: Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand,Level 2, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Galette Des Rois Workshop
Learn to authentically create Galette Des Rois. Taught by a Le Cordon Bleu Master Chef.

About this Event

During this workshop, our Le Cordon Bleu Master Pâtisserie Chef will demonstrate and guide you through the preparation and baking of authentic Galette Des Rois (Kings Cake) a traditional French dessert enjoyed in Januray.
What is a Le Cordon Bleu Workshop? A Le Cordon Bleu workshop involves hands on kitchen activity. Be personally guided by world class chefs within our industrial kitchen classrooms. Learn techniques to elevate your cooking during an intensive day course, light lunch included.
Date: 24th January 2026
Time: 9am – 4pm (light lunch is included)
Location: Level 2, 52 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Allergies: Ingredients in this class contain the following allergens: Wheat, egg, treenuts, soy, and dairy. Please note, our pâtisserie kitchen stores varieties of nuts and traces will be present in the environment (but only almond will be directly used in this workshop).
You Will Create:
Inverted Puff Pastry
Almond Cream
Two Galettes des Rois to bring home
Course Details: During the workshop, you will learn the following skills:
The roles of the ingredients
Making inverted puff pastry
Lamination skills
Cutting and decorating skills
Course Includes: All ingredients and equipment supplied, a light lunch is included. Everything you make is yours to take home.
Contact Details: +64 4 472 9800 |

events.venue: 11 Logan Street, New Zealand 5018,11 Logan St, Upper Hutt Central, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Shenanigans - Irish Band
Shenanigans are one of New Zealand’s most accomplished and sought-after bands in Irish Traditional Music today. This young and exciting group creates a sound that is full of energy & innovation, whilst all the time remaining true to their traditional roots

As well as reconstructing traditional Irish / Celtic tunes that have been around for generations, Shenanigans also enjoys taking well- known contemporary classics and ‘irishing’ them up. This combination makes for a very entertaining experience. Audiences are encouraged to get involved in the performance with plenty of crowd participation.

events.id: Neurodiversity Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Neurodiversity Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Neurodiversity seems to be a hot topic of discussion lately. Famous singers such as Lewis Capaldi and Sia and actors such as Ryan Gosling and Channing Tatum have discussed their neurodiverse conditions. Lockdowns and social media have driven many adults to have startling realisations about their own neurodiverse conditions. It seems suddenly – all at once – the world has become aware that 15-20% of people have different types of brains. (Free for NZ citizens/residents, all others pay $99).

Description
This one-day workshop introduces you to the topic of neurodiversity and considers some of the key conditions that people live with. We look at:

-ADHD – Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
-Autism
-The “Dys family” – dyslexia, dysgraphia, dyscalculia, dyspraxia (Developmental Coordination Disorder)
-OCD – Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
-Tourette’s Syndrome

TikTok creator and public speaker on neurodiversity, Nigel Sutton, will introduce the subject and help you discover the definitions and impacts of each of the key kinds of neurodiversity. Working together with other participants, you will consider many key commonalities that those living with various neurodivergent conditions experience. We will expose the realities of being neurodivergent in a “neurotypical world”, and this will allow you to develop empathy and practical strategies to support neurodivergent people to be their best.

New Zealand’s leading dyslexia expert, Mike Styles, will provide an interactive and participatory session to assist you in understanding and supporting a family member or friend who has dyslexia or a similar learning difference.

You will be able to ask anything you want with our neurodivergent hot seat session.

Find out from those offering “lived experience” what it is really like to have a different kind of brain. This one-day workshop is: ”Neurodiversity in a Nutshell” – whether you know a little or a lot, whether you are a relative, employer, partner, friend, or just interested to know more about neurodiversity – this workshop is for you!

[You must be a NZ citizen or resident to register in this course for free, and you must provide photo ID when you attend. If you are unable to attend the course, we cannot guarantee that you will be able to enrol again for free for a funded course in the future.


Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by emai,l so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.venue: 118 Tory Street, New Zealand 6011,Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged
The Velvet Glove Play the Songs of The Velvet Underground, Unplugged

In the early 70s Cripple was one of the first bands to fall under the influence of The Velvet Underground, a signature ingredient of the Dunedin sound. Lou Reed’s remarkable songwriting - songs like “Sweet Jane” and “I’m Waiting for the Man - found a natural home at the heart of Cripple’s set.

The Velvet Glove reunites three members of that band - John Dodd (Midge Marsden, The Chaps, Skin and Bone), Chris Nichol (The Dunstan Rangers, The Zimmermans) and Lindsay Gregory (The Dunstan Rangers, Heaven Bent). They’re joined by Martin Durrant (Sneaky Feelings, The Zimmermans) and Bill Nichol (Baby) for a one-off performance at The Undercurrent.

Be sure you’re there when The Velvet Glove breathes fresh life into two sets of classic songs from The Velvet Underground catalogue.

The Undercurrent, Saturday January 24.
Doors at 7.00pm
Band at 7.30pm
$20 at Under the Radar (link coming soon!) and the Door.

Snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

We’ll see you there ☆

events.id: Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria ( Au) & Local Legends-Valhalla,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria ( Au) & Local Legends
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria ( Au) & Local Legends
Wellington, join us for a night of Psychedelic & Melodic Techno featuring 2 international artists Kozy ( Canada), Aztoria ( Australia) supported by Aadhi, Blair & Uday. This event will be hosted at the legendary venue, Valhalla on the 24th of January, 8pm onwards.

Kozy will be playing a 2.5 Hour Extended Set, Aztoria will be playing a 1.5hr set & local legends will be playing an hour each.

International DJ Bio's:

KOZY ( CA)

KOZY aka Jeff Koz is a Montreal-based DJ & Entrepreneur specialising in dark & groovy underground techno music.
KOZY's dedication to music is evident in his tight mixes, solid track selection and inclination towards groovy synths and heavy, disruptive bass.

In 2019, he founded AlpaKa MuziK, a Montreal-based record label pushing world-class underground progressive, minimal and psychedelic techno beats. With releases from some of the biggest names in the game, AlpaKa MuziK has been paving the way for this fast emerging genre with relentless quality music and has become one of the most prominent labels in the psychedelic techno sub-genre.

With over 125 releases and over 650 tracks under their belt, AlpaKa has quickly become a powerhouse label in the underground techno community.

Since early 2022, in a little over 2 years, KOZY has gone on 9 international tours, including 5 euro tours, Australia, South Africa Mauritius, India, Mexico and has played over 150 gigs in 24 months in over 30 countries and counting.

Some prominent festivals he has performed at include, Esoteric in Australia, Hadra in France, Texas Eclipse, Boom Festival and many others, bringing to many of them the AlpaKa MuziK takeovers that showcase the cutting edge psychedelic techno sound through countless live sets around the world.

He recently finished his 4-month long 2025 summer euro tour where he performed at Boom Festival in Portugal and many more AlpaKa Showcases all around Europe and beyond. His 2025-2026 world tour is in motion, with Japan and a large Southern Hemisphere schedule in the works. With an unstoppable arsenal of unreleased, cutting edge bangers, he'll leave you wanting more after every set.

AZTORIA ( AU)

Aztoria is the psytech project of Ashley Zadel, also known as Flow Theory.

For more than 16 years, his melodic bush techno sound has evolved through auditory storytelling on stages across the globe, from Cape Town to London, Israel to Brazil, Portugal, New Zealand and Australia.

Rooted in progressive soundscapes with an organic flavour, Aztoria blends melodic deep house grooves with minimal techno to craft psychedelic atmospheres that ignite the imagination.

Aztoria burst onto the scene with his debut EP Reborn (Dense Nebula Records), hitting #4 on Beatport’s Techno charts. His 2024 single Birds of Paradise (Soliq Records) soared to #33, while his Inner Groove remix landed at #23 in Progressive House (Techgnosis Records). With fresh releases on Techgnosis, Recovery Collective and Puzzles Records and more in the works, Aztoria is carving his path in the underground with relentless energy and innovation.

Whether in the depths of a forest or the heart of a concrete jungle, Aztoria’s tunes will captivate and elevate you with his storytelling magic.

events.id: Twisted Rings for Summer-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Twisted Rings for Summer
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver! Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then learn how to form it into a ring that fits you. Learn to use the jeweller's torch to solder, then clean up and polish the ring to a beautiful finish.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, sterling silver bar to create your twist ring and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.name: Whānau Day
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for a FREE day of family activities exploring the connection between the whenua (land) and the moana (sea).

Discover raumati (summer) through workshops, performances, and hands-on activities. Learn about seaweed varieties, native plants, and how we can protect our natural environment for future generations.

Activties:
* Identify diverse seaweed species with Mountains to Sea
* Drum and dance to Tokelau rhythms with the Kupega Affect
* Create Moana-inspired crayon pāreu designs with the Pacific Climate Warriors
* Enjoy a live reading of I Love My Island by Moemoana Asfa'ato'a Schwenke, narrated by Inangaro Vakaafi
* Grow native plants and take a cutting home with Te Rito Gardens
* Get your face painted with sea and land creatures by Daizy Designs
* Paint watercolours inspired by botanist and seaweed expert Nancy Adams
* Explore Te Papa's Collections with our art and botany curators

events.id: Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell-46a Victoria St Alicetown,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell
events.venue: 46a Victoria St Alicetown,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell.

Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne.

Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’

‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.

Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear.

At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley will return with his new song ‘Wired’ that bridges the sonics from his first EP with what's to come.

Also appearing Oscar LaDell hot off a US tour.

Doors open 8pm for an 8.30pm start.

events.id: Forest Giants, Fragrant Herbs and Birdsong - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Forest Giants, Fragrant Herbs and Birdsong - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this 75-minute walk we will get up close to some delightful pygmy pines before, on a gentle slope, passing under and being awed by their towering cousins en route to a wonderful view of Wellington City. In the Herb Garden we will see and hear a little about the aromatic, culinary and medicinal properties of familiar and not-so-familiar herbs, before descending, possibly accompanied by some birdsong, through a tract of native forest down to Lady Norwood Rose Garden.

Meet at the Founders’ Entrance, Glenmore Street.
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.long_description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by adults.

events.id: Wonderful Wahine-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wonderful Wahine
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hear entertaining stories of the remarkable women who helped shape Wellington's history. Learn about their lives as wives, daughters, mothers, and heroines.

This tour features entertaining stories of women – settlers and Māori – who lived in Wellington and helped shape its history. They are wives, daughters, mothers, housewives and heroines: an artist, a nurse, a teacher and a song-writer, as well as boarding house operators, shopkeepers and inspiring leaders.

This tour starts at 2.00pm at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street, and finishes 1.5 hours later back at the Museum.

Children aged 12 and under are free; well-behaved dogs, on leads, are welcome.

events.id: Anna Fält - Vocal music from Sweden and Finland-The Bakehouse Collective, 4 Wakefield Street, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Anna Fält - Vocal music from Sweden and Finland
events.venue: The Bakehouse Collective, 4 Wakefield Street, Featherston
events.long_description:
Anna Fält is a versatile singer-songwriter who is passionate about Nordic folk singing. She ́s been touring around Scandinavia, as well as outside Europe, for years with her unique concept of solo vocal concerts. Specializing in different singing traditions from her two home countries Finland and Sweden, she combines the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones, performing in churches, museums, festivals, folk music venues, clubs and concert halls.

These concerts are tributes to the human voice, a one woman band, singing like you've never heard it before! Tradition meets vocal arts, avantgarde and story telling in an innovative and personal, intimate way.

Besides her solo concerts, Anna works with performing arts and multidisciplinary art projects, with folk music research and teaching various folk song workshops. She has 3 music degrees and she ́s been studying folk music in 5 different countries. Her main work is, however, being a solo artist and developing the solo a cappella singing.

Saturday 24th January
The Bakehouse Collective, Featherston
Doors 7pm. Performance 7:30pm.
Tickets: $25.00
Email: commonground.wai@gmail.com

events.long_description:
💫 Move. Release. Connect. 💫
🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟
With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington
Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to be hosting Ecstatic Dance Wellington! 🎉
💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.
Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.
🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and teaches Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!
🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!
🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn Hall, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)
🎟 Tickets
$25 online
$30 cash on the door
**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.
☀️ Extra Info
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.
We are very much looking forward to co-creating with the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.
❤️ What to Bring
Water bottle
Loose, comfy clothes
Warm layers for afterwards
A pillow and Blanket if you wish
A friend!
🌟 Guidelines
Drug & alcohol free event
Silence on the dance floor
Without phones/cameras on the dance floor
Respect the space & each other 😊
🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/
✨ Come dance with us at Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

events.id: The Glass Menagerie-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Glass Menagerie
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed American playwright, Tennessee Williams penned emotional powerhouse hits like A STREETCAR NAMED DESIRE, BABY DOLL, CAT ON A HOT TIN ROOF and SUDDENLY LAST SUMMER but it was his tender and autobiographical ” memory ” play, THE GLASS MENAGERIE, that catapulted him from obscurity to international fame.

THE GLASS MENAGERIE follows a family trapped by dreams and delusions in 1930s St Louis. Times are tough. Amidst the turmoil of a changing world, solo mother, Amanda Wingfield, a faded Southern belle, is hellbent on finding a better future for her emotionally fragile daughter, Laura, while her restless son, Tom, is caught between his duty to his family and his desire for freedom.

Deftly blending humour and pathos and suffused with the eloquent poetic language that became Tennessee Williams’ trademark, The GLASS MENAGERIE is an achingly beautiful study of four people struggling to conform to the expectation of others.

Featuring Circa stalwart Simon Leary, as Tom and Hera Dunleavy (Blithe Spirit) as Amanda, with Jackson Burling as ‘The Gentleman Caller’ and exciting newcomer Ashley Harnett as Laura, this is a rare opportunity to experience the urgent relevance of Tennesee Williams’ haunting and uncompromising masterwork.

Reviews:
” Will lodge in your mind and soul for years to come” The Observer
” Spellbinding theatre at its very best” New York Times

By Tennessee Williams
Director Colin McColl
Design Tony Rabbit
Design Nic Smillie
Design John Gibson
Company St. Louis Blues

Sat 24 Jan – Sat 21 Feb
Preview Night Friday 23 Jan
Tues – Sat 7pm, Sun 4.00pm
Special midweek matinees 1pm Thurs 12 Feb a& 1pm Thurs 19 Feb
CIRCA ONE
$25 – $60

events.id: Wilson Blackley Plays The Shed (The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell)-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wilson Blackley Plays The Shed (The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell)
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wilson Blackley The Remain Tour with Oscar LaDell.
Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne.
Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’
‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.
Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear.
At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley will return with his new song ‘Wired’ that bridges the sonics from his first EP with what's to come.
Also appearing Oscar LaDell hot off a US tour.
Doors open 8pm for an 8.30pm start.

events.id: Draw the Moon: A Lunar Sketching Workshop at Star Safari-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Draw the Moon: A Lunar Sketching Workshop at Star Safari
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
See the Moon like an astronomer — and draw it like an artist.
Join us at the Star Safari Observatory for a unique 90-minute experience where astronomy meets art. In this hands-on workshop, you’ll learn how to sketch the Moon directly at the eyepiece of our telescopes while observing its craters, mountains, shadows, and changing light in real time.

Using quality sketching materials (provided on the night), you’ll be guided step-by-step through:
- recognising key lunar features
- capturing contrast, relief and texture
- translating live telescope views accurately to paper
- fast sketching techniques for an object that’s constantly moving

You’ll have dedicated telescope time with our team, adjusting the optics for you and helping you get the sharpest possible view. This experience is designed to be accessible for beginners, while still rewarding for those with some astronomy or art experience.

Set beneath Wairarapa’s internationally acclaimed dark skies, this workshop offers a quiet, focused creative moment under the Moon. Whether you come for art, astronomy, or simply the pleasure of observing slowly and noticing deeply, you’ll leave with a sketch that is uniquely yours — shaped by the night and the light you saw.

Who is this for?
Adults and older children with an interest in drawing, the night sky, or simply trying something new.

Included:
✔ High-quality sketching pencils and paper
✔ Expert lunar observing guidance
✔ Dedicated telescope time
✔ Use of Star Safari’s professional viewing equipment

What to bring:
Warm clothing, curiosity, and any of your favourite drawing tools if you’d like to use them.

Take home more than a drawing — take home a moment of looking closely.

events.id: Bri Louise Album Release Event-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Bri Louise Album Release Event
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Yippee! The time has finally come to celebrate the release of the Bri Louise Album.
Rogue & Vagabond on 24th of January.

Elly Mae and her band will be opening up before the Bri Louise Band takes the stage. The night will also feature some very special friends of ours, including Keira Batten-Copgan, Felix Hilton, Leji, Gala Baumfield, Meihana McGee, the Bri Louise Choir, and the Bri Louise Jazz Orchestra.

Heres a few words about the two bands if you arnt acquainted with them:

Bri Louise blends sultry queerness with smooth love and undeniable groove. Rooted in gospel and neo-soul, their sound expands into a rich fusion of jazz, hip-hop, and R&B. Poetic lyricism is supported by a tight live band that features colourful keys, phatty bass, flashy beats, vibrant guitar, and fruity woodwinds. We will be joined by many guests but our core features Bri Louise (vocals/keys), Molly Wyatt (flute/vocals), Becky Devine (bass), Theo Thompson (guitar), Eloise Edmonds (saxophone), and Jonathan Stolk (drums).

Elly Mae crafts songs that encapsulate the bittersweet ache of growth, the quiet unraveling of time, and the soft glow of nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, indie, shoegaze, and anything in between. From lullabies that make you feel weightless to being wrapped in a blanket of sound, Elly Mae’s folk/country melodic guitar style is accompanied by experimental, spatial bass from Arran Cargill-Brown and textured pocket drumming from Sasha Francis-Murray.

Come celebrate this very special night and the release of this cool project with us.
Tickets available via UTR. Poster artwork by Keelin Bell.

events.id: Improv Workouts- Undisputed Champions w. PopRox Improv-Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Improv Workouts- Undisputed Champions w. PopRox Improv
events.venue: Toi Poneke Arts Centre,61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Improv Workouts- Undisputed Champions w. PopRox Improv
Work your improv muscles with monthly "workouts" hosted by PopRox. Each month's workout will have a specific focus, with an emphasis on reps over theory. Our "Undisputed Champions" sessions are aimed at highly skilled improvisers with strong performance experience.

If you're not sure which workout is best for you, take our wee quiz linked below or get in touch. We're happy to offer some guidance.
https://opinionstage.com/page/d55e4c73-8faf-4d9c-9910-320b2dd00d6e

OPEN SESSION DATES:
Sunday 25 Jan
Sunday 22 Feb
Sunday 22 March
Sunday 26 April
Sunday 24 May
Sunday 28 June
Sunday 26 July
Sunday 23 August
Note: No September session due to NZIF
Sunday 25 October
Sunday 22 November

SEASON PASS:
Book a season pass to get access to all 10 Undisputed Champion sessions for the whole year at a reduced rate. Please note these are paid out straight away so refunds are not available for season passes. We'll reduce the pricing of these as the year goes on, so feel free to try out a session with a standard pass first.

STAND-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2026. We'll giveaway any spots remaining on the Friday before each Workout, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 2 days before the relevant workshop.

events.id: Artisan Craft Market-Te Wharewaka o Poneke, Taranaki St Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Artisan Craft Market
events.venue: Te Wharewaka o Poneke, Taranaki St Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.

events.id: Stained Glass Suncatcher Day-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stained Glass Suncatcher Day
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.
More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.

Come along to the Reikorangi Country Fair!

Kick back, sing along, and let Cam & Sam light up your Sunday

events.id: Rita Angus, Artist, and the Bolton Street Cemetery-Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rita Angus, Artist, and the Bolton Street Cemetery
events.venue: Bolton Street Cemetery, Bolton Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
RITA ANGUS, ARTIST, AND THE BOLTON STREET CEMETERY
Join this guided tour on the 55th anniversary of Rita Angus's death to find out about her special connection to the Bolton Street Cemetery via her sketches and paintings. The well-known artist, who lived nearby in Thorndon, paid close attention to the upheaval around the construction of the urban motorway, and this tour follows the trail of the headstones she sketched and used in her paintings.

The tour starts at the Seddon Memorial, is 1.5 hours duration and ends at the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum, lower Bolton Street. Cost $10 per person, children aged 12 and under free; good dogs, on leads, are always welcome.

events.id: ❤️Lower Hutt: 21 Day- Free On-line Kundalini Energy Awakening Meditation-Virtual,Link Shared On signup, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: ❤️Lower Hutt: 21 Day- Free On-line Kundalini Energy Awakening Meditation
events.venue: Virtual,Link Shared On signup, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
❤️Lower Hutt: 21 Day- Free On-line Kundalini Energy Awakening Meditation
✨Seeking new horizons and self-discovery? Try Kundalini energy awakening in 21 Days with- Free Online Guided Meditation- live & recorded

About this Event

Why 21 days of meditation for Kundalini Awakening?
Seeking new horizons and self-discovery? Use the New Year 2026- as an opportunity to challenge ourselves to rise higher with one journey we always missed- 'Journey Inside'. Be a part of the 21-day Kundalini Awakening community on Live & Recorded from 25th January (Sunday) 2026, to 14th February (Saturday) 2026 @ 2:45 PM every day. Link shared after signup.YouTube will have daily recordings in case you are unable to join live meeting at the scheduled time. We will schedule additional workshops on Sundays to enable you to join a live meeting. We cleanse our inner subtle system using the powerful yet gentle techniques of Sahaja Yoga Meditation. This is a spiritual meditation in which we awaken the inner energy called Kundalini that gently brings positive change within us-- making us more balanced, peaceful, and joyful. As you participate in daily classes, you will notice physical, emotional and spiritual healing. With pure desire, you may also feel Kundalini energy movement and its working on your fingertips and other physical manifestations. It will enable you to raise your consciousness to a higher dimension. Sahaja Yoga Meditation is volunteer-run, always free, and practiced in more than 100 countries.
No prior meditation or Kundalini awakening experience is needed.
Are you seeking awakening from the heart?
**********************************************************************************
Who is organizing this course?
A team of Sahaja Yoga meditation volunteers has been practicing and teaching 'Sahaja Yoga' meditation for decades. Sahaja Yoga meditation was invented by 'Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi' in 1970, who, in a very Motherly fashion, helped people to take to true meditation easily. The goal of this meditation is to reconnect us to Divinity and experience the universal consciousness within us. It is practiced in more than 100 countries and is always free. The course page is listed below. You need not register on it again.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/

All recordings will be on this playlist
21 Days Mediation Course - January 2026 - YouTube

Please save these.
**********************************************************************************
How to join?

Link displayed and emailed after signup. Check your email for the link and more communications.
Same link from 25th January to 14th February, 2026
Have you joined any kind of Online meditation before?

**********************************************************************************
What if I miss a day here and there?
Don't worry if you miss any class; we will help you make up with one-to-one sessions after class. Also, on the website, daily recordings will be available on website below.
https://us.sahajayoga.org/21days2026/,
Do join our WhatsApp group for resources such as recordings and notifications. WhatsApp group link shared during registration. You can either click on the link to join or share your WhatsApp contact number for us to add you to the WhatsApp community, which will be very handy during the 21 days of course.
Will that be enough to help you out with the missed class?
**********************************************************************************
What happens in these 21 Days?
Week 1 Theme: Awaken the Kundalini energy & Know Thyself, and feel energy movement
Week 2 Theme: Spiritual Ascent & Chakras Energy Centres Cleansing
Week 3 Theme: Nirchivarita (thoughtlessness) through meditation. Feel the silence of the universe within you.
Do you believe you can awaken Kundalini and achieve your self-discovery?
**********************************************************************************
Will I be contacted before the course starts?
You will be added to the WhatsApp group -'21 Days of Meditation' in case you have shared your WhatsApp contact during registration. You may get sporadic reminders via email with some useful meditation tips to keep your attention engaged towards the 21-day meditation challenge.
You mind getting reminder?
*********************************************************************************
Is it really free?
Sahaja Yoga meditation is always free. This course is completely free. The only charge is your dedication and sincerity of purpose for your growth. The only question is-
Do we have sincerity of purpose?
**********************************************************************************
What if I have a question?
Please feel free to email or WhatsApp the following if you have any more questions or encounter difficulties joining the Zoom session. We will try to keep you informed about more meditation events.
Sahaja Yoga is a social meditation, and we love to talk about life, its ups and downs, the purpose of life, health & alternatives, and anything you would like to discuss that could enrich your life.
WhatsApp either of the below when you like to talk or chat, and they will respond with suggested day/time.
(Dallas)
+15132038961
(Miami)
+15618666331
Stay safe, and keep meditating!

Have we shared sufficient information for you to decide to join the free course?
**********************************************************************************
Kundalini Awakening
I bow to All the Seekers of Truth. This is a special time in the History of Creation that so many seekers have been born on this Earth. They have realized that there is something beyond than the mundane life they have to seek. This is not the seeking of one life. It is the seeking of ages which is being prophesied, has to be fulfilled now. There have been prophesies and prophesies about this great time. In India about 14,000 years back, Brigu Muni has written a book called Nadi Grant in which He has described you all saying that a day that will come when all these greater seekers, great seekers will be born on this Earth and that their Kundalini which is the Power of their True Desire will be awakened spontaneously and they’ll find out what they are.

But also there has been prophesies about many fake people coming on this Earth and they will try to delude and take people away from the truth.

There have been also great prophesies all over the world but especially in England about hundred years back a great poet called William Blake was born and He has written so clearly, so clearly about Sahaja Yoga that it is surprising how He has even exactly mentioned the house where I’ll be staying. Also that he has said that the men of God, meaning the seekers, the men of God will become prophets and they will have the power to make others prophets. This is the sign we should take when we are seeking the truth.
- Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi (Founder - Sahaja Yoga Meditation)
Bring in your friends and families too to this course :)

Agenda


🕑: 02:45 PM - 03:00 PM
♂️ Introduction & Recap
Info: If you missed the initial session, you are provided a one-on-one session in a breakout room to get you up to speed


🕑: 03:00 PM - 03:30 PM
♂️ Guided Meditation
Info: ❄️⛅Water, light, fire, sky, ground and other elements will be used to enhance the power of meditation and internal cleansing


🕑: 03:30 PM - 03:45 PM
♂️ One-to-one session (Optional)
Info: On-demand revision, healing, spiritual talks, technique practice, and more...

events.long_description:
The Summer Songwriting Retreat is designed for songwriters looking to develop their
songs and their songwriting skills. It will help you map the journey of a song from first
ideas to release.
From getting your songs to connect with an audience to how to best present your
work, you'll get involved in practical writing sessions plus receive plenty of indepth
experienced tuition in a friendly, supportive environment.
You’ll have the opportunity for feedback and to ask questions, while sharing the air
with like-minded people, who are as keen and curious as you are to find out more
about songwriting.
Get you and your songs well and truly cooking in this beautiful setting free from daily
distractions. It really works plus the food is outstanding!
Summer Songwriting Retreat 2026 is presented by singer-songwriter Charlotte Yates.

events.id: Labyrinth-The Roxy Cinema, 5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington-Roxy Cinema
events.name: Labyrinth
events.venue: The Roxy Cinema, 5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington
events.long_description:
Details
Directed by Jim Henson
Starring Jennifer Connelly, David Bowie
40th Anniversary

--- Sarah is forced by her father and her stepmother to babysit her baby stepbrother, Toby, while they are out. He does not stop crying and she wishes that he would be taken away. Out of the blue, he stops crying and when she looks for him in his crib, she learns that her wish was granted, and the Goblin King Jareth has taken him to his castle in the Goblin City in the middle of a labyrinth. Sarah repents and asks Jareth to give him back, but Jareth tells her that she has to rescue him before midnight. Soon she teams up with some allies. Will they rescue Toby in time? ---

Presented in 4K

events.id: Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 26th January 2026-199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 26th January 2026
events.venue: 199 Jackson Street, Petone, New Zealand 5012,199 Jackson St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Dungeons & Dragons: Curse of Strahd Campaign - 26th January 2026
Outside the tavern, a fog lies across the town. The damp, cobbled pavement glistens as the lights of street lanterns dance across the slick stones. The night chills the bones and shivers the soul of anyone outside.

Yet inside these tavern walls the food is hearty, and the ale is warm and frothy. A fire blazes in the hearth, and the tavern is alive with the voices and laughter.

Suddenly, the tavern door swings open, and you all notice it at the same time. Framed by the lamp-lit fog, a form strides through the doorway. His brightly coloured clothes are draped in loose folds about him, and his hat hangs askew, hiding his eyes in shadows. Without hesitation, he walks up to your table and pulls from his tunic a sealed letter, addressed to all of you in beautiful flowing script. He drops the letter on the table and turns and leaves the tavern, vanishing into the fog.

‘Curse of Strahd’ is a D&D5E gothic horror campaign. It has everything you and your party needs to have a grand experience. It will take you to the mysterious village of Barovia, a realm surrounded by deadly fog and ruled by a wizard, the vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich, the master of Castle Ravenloft. ‘Curse of Strahd’ is a rich narrative story you are part of as it’s unfolding. It’s not just about fighting monsters and hunting for treasure in dungeons; there is a compelling story arc and a richly realized antagonist.

events.name: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Friends
events.venue: Hutt City Church, 22 Marsden St, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
We invite you to a magical morning: Rodgers and Hammerstein & Friends, celebrating the timeless music of Rodgers & Hammerstein, the legendary duo behind some of Broadway’s most beloved musicals plus songs from some of their contemporaries. This unforgettable concert will feature a dazzling lineup of artists led by Westend star Russell Dixon, performing iconic songs from The Sound of Music, Oklahoma!, South Pacific, Carousel, The King and I, and more.

Experience the sweeping romance of Some Enchanted Evening and People Will Say We’re In Love, the joyful spirit of Oh, What a Beautiful Mornin’ and Oklahoma and the heartfelt power of Climb Every Mountain, all brought to life by these stellar voices. Our concert promises to be a glorious tribute to the golden age of musical theatre.

Featuring:
Russell Dixon
Kate Lineham
Kalauni Pouvalu
Emma Sloman
Ravil Atlas
Grant Winterburn

NZ Tour 14 January 2026 – 17 February 2026
Concerts Start 11am
General Admission Seating
Doors Open 10am – Complimentary morning tea included.

Phone: 0508 266 237
Email: bookings@operatunity.co.nz

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Cathedral Cove-The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Cathedral Cove
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: Designing exceptional volunteer engagement-level 2/50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Designing exceptional volunteer engagement
events.venue: level 2/50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join international volunteer engagement expert Tobi Johnson in an interactive workshop to design a complete volunteer journey. 
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement. She is known for her modern thought leadership, highly practical evidence-based strategies, and innovative, “big hat” thinking around engaging, supporting, and acknowledging the work of volunteers. 
This workshop, to be held in Wellington on Tuesday 27 January, will guide participants through the complete volunteer journey using the Best Practice Guidelines as a framework for exploration. 
Through graphic facilitation, collaborative exercises, and practical brainstorming, you will develop creative and actionable strategies to design a volunteer experience based on the spirit of community. 
If you are a nonprofit that relies on volunteers – with lots of passion but limited resources – this workshop is specifically tailored for you. As community champions, this is an opportunity to explore, visualize, and co-create practical ways to strengthen volunteer engagement, grounded in the shared values that make volunteering in Aotearoa unique. 
About your facilitator Tobi Johnson:
Tobi Johnson is an internationally sought-after expert, consultant, and expert trainer in volunteer engagement. She is known for her modern thought leadership, highly practical evidence-based strategies, and innovative, “big hat” thinking around engaging, supporting, and acknowledging the work of volunteers. 
She is the President of Tobi Johnson & Associates, a consulting firm whose mission is to help nonprofit organizations make connections with remarkable volunteers. In 2015, she founded VolunteerPro, an online training and networking community for leaders of volunteers.  She is host of the Volunteer Nation Podcast and co-host of the Time + Talent Podcast with Jennifer Bennett of VolunteerMatch. In addition, she wrote Chapter 1 of Volunteer Engagement 2.0: Ideas and Insights for Transforming Volunteer Programs in a Changing World. She is also currently at work on a book for volunteers who lead to be published in 2026. 
Tobi has over 30 years boots-on-the-ground experience in nonprofit management, program development and start up, team leadership, training design and delivery and change management across a wide range of cause impact areas from arts and culture, youth development, employment and training, senior services, healthcare advocacy, homelessness, and more. 
Where: Wellington, in person. Level 2, 50 The Terrace (the VNZ offices), Wellington.
When: Tuesday 27 January - 9am to 5pm.
Tickets and pricing:
We have priced tickets based on organisation type, and offer a 25% discount to Volunteering NZ member organisations.
Community Organisations $199 +gst
Government or Business tickets $219 +gst
Limited low cost and complimentary tickets are available for those who need additional support to access tickets. These are aimed at organisations with an annual income between $0 to $140k.
Please contact us directly if you:
Are a Volunteering NZ Member and have not received the discount code of 25%, or
Want to enquire about scholarship or low cost tickets.
Email us on office@volunteeringnz.org.nz or phone us on 04 470 6006. Volunteering NZ member list here.

events.id: TED-Style Talks (27 Jan) — Star Trek themed event-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: TED-Style Talks (27 Jan) — Star Trek themed event
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presenting a special themed edition of TED-Style Talks... ✨🤩 
These are the voyages of three Starfleet officers addressing us after their mission to seek out new life and new civilisations. Join us on stardate 12601.27 to "boldly go where no one has gone before" 
Speakers (tentative)
Dr. Lauren Vinnell | To explore strange new worlds — and our own
Dr. Moiz Penkar | Immanuel Kant, individual free will, and the United Federation of Planets
Dr. Sara Harrison | Good intentions, bad outcomes: What Star Trek teaches us about intervening in complex systems
Each talk will be 10 mins, followed by 10 mins of questions. It's usually beneficial to bring a pen/notepad to take notes 📝🤓 Romulans and Cardassians are more than welcome.
Plan
5:15pm - Doors open
5:20pm - Registration and mingle
5:45pm - Intro and welcome
5:50pm - Talks begin
7:15pm - Conclusion
Tea will be available at the venue. Drinks can also be purchased from the cash bar. Feel free to bring some snacks to share for the post-event networking.
How to find us: Take the "high rise (turbo) lifts" in Majestic Centre to level 28. We'll also put up signs at the lift. Building entrance is from Willis Street (till 6pm) and from Boulcott Street (till 7pm). You may also energise to the top floor of Majestic Centre.
We take pictures to document the events. If you don't want to be photographed, simply let us know on arrival.
(Click "follow" on Humanitix to be notified of future events.)
We're alone. In an uncharted part of the galaxy. We've already made some friends here. And some enemies. We have no idea of the dangers we're going to face. But one thing is clear. We shall meet on the 27th. Make it so!

It's usually beneficial to bring a pen/notepad to take notes 📝🤓 Romulans and Cardassians are more than welcome.

events.venue: 31 Whitehouse Road, Titahi Bay, New Zealand 5022,31 Whitehouse Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Inaugural Dungeons and Flagons at the Western Tavern
Citizens!

We are super-excited to open up the western cities to These fine folks from ForeverGMNZ, finally get some RPGs going around here! Turn up a bit early to get a bit of courage and story in you and these guys will provide everything you need for an adventure!

Make sure you book below so we can keep track of everything and make sure we have enough DMs. If we get enough interest we will be doing this monthly... (and we will sort out an all-ages series starting in March)

From the event:

Every great Dungeons and Dragons adventure begins in a tavern.

Whether you’re a seasoned adventurer or you’ve never rolled a die in your life, this two-hour, beginner-friendly D&D experience is for you!

Turn up solo or with friends and be guided through a fast-paced adventure by a professional Dungeon Master. Choose your hero — a silver-tongued bard, a fire-flinging wizard, a sword-swinging fighter, a sneaky rogue, or something else entirely, with all characters, dice, and rules provided.

Expect laughs, ridiculous moments, and just enough danger to make the beer taste sweeter. Because while you’re swinging swords and slinging spells, the bar will be open with Beer Engine’s excellent selection of craft brews on tap.

No prep. No pressure. Just great beer and a story you’ll still be talking about afterwards.

This is an age 18+ event.

events.id: 90's QUIZ NIGHT at The Bond Store!-21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu Beach, New Zealand 5032,21 Birmingham St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: 90's QUIZ NIGHT at The Bond Store!
events.venue: 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu Beach, New Zealand 5032,21 Birmingham St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
90's QUIZ NIGHT at The Bond Store!
We are throwing it back to the 90s - when phones had cords, jeans were baggy and google wasn't there to save you.

Grab your crew of 4 and join us for a night of trivia, laughs and questionable memories.

Bragging rights and a $100 bar tab on the line - so bring your a-game and maybe your tamagotchi for luck!

$20 per team of 4

At our 90’s Quiz Night, we’re here for one thing: a bloody good time. Think classic Bond Store chaos — big laughs, and questionable knowledge. Chris Barber as the quiz master!

This isn’t the Olympics of trivia, so don’t be a dick about the rules, don’t take it too seriously, and absolutely bring your best banter. We’re all about good vibes and good company.

Let’s play nice, drink well, and have an epic night together. Cheers!

events.long_description:
It’s been 25 years since the release of Teenage Dirtbag, and somehow Wheatus’ iconic debut single is bigger than ever. To mark the milestone, the band are heading back to Australia and New Zealand for 11 massive shows January 2026, performing their debut album each night. Fans can also expect requests from across their three-decade career, a cherished tradition at Wheatus headline shows for almost 20 years. It’s a joy to behold. See for yourself. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.
