events.name: Wellington - Empower Her Networking - Community-Led Marketing
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington - Empower Her Networking - Community-Led Marketing
Empower Her, female networking group that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences

About this Event

WELLINGTON - The Arborist Rooftop Bar
Monthly Topic: Community-Led Marketing
Hosted by:
The new era of business isn’t built on algorithms -it’s built on connection.
Join us for Community-Led Marketing: The Future of Growth in 2026 and Beyond, where we’ll explore how the smartest brands and entrepreneurs are ditching outdated marketing tactics and building loyal, engaged communities that do the marketing for them.
In this empowering session, we’ll unpack how to future-proof your business by focusing on what truly scales -relationships, collaboration, and authentic human connection. Discover how to turn your audience into advocates, your collaborations into catalysts, and your community into your greatest asset for growth in 2026.
Want to get your ticket for FREE?
Are you a woman in business looking for a supportive community to help you connect, grow, and learn?
As an Inner Circle member, you can attend as many of our networking hubs as you like for FREE! This includes our hubs across Auckland, NZ, Australia and the UK. Enjoy unlimited access to our netwokring events and take full advantage of the community and networking opportunities.
Join the Inner Circle to unlock even more benefits:
Monthly Masterclasses: Learn from industry experts on topics that will elevate your business and mindset.
Accountability Calls: Stay on track with our supportive community and achieve your goals.
Personal Branding Opportunities: Create your own masterclasses and shine as an expert.
Exclusive Discounts: Enjoy special rates on Empower Her events and live workshops.
Vibrant Community: Share your journey, get support, and celebrate your successes with empowering women.
now and become part of a wonderful community of women in business who are ready to build their dream life and business.
Empower Her is a global female networking group, that offers a welcoming and safe environment for women of all business backgrounds and experiences.
Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.
Join our free community
The Inner Circle
Follow us on Instagram
Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed.Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website.

events.id: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra-The Rogue & Vagabond,18 Garrett St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond,18 Garrett St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra
"You could drop the needle on any spot and find satisfying, thoroughly involving music." - London Jazz News

After releasing their recent album to a sold-out crowd at the Wellington Jazz Festival, the Elegant Calamity Orchestra makes its return to the Rogue and Vagabond! Led by flamboyant saxophonist Oscar Lavën, the Elegant Calamity Orchestra drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, french cinema, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock and roll saxophone.
Prepare to be swept into a surreal, cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous performance not to be missed.

9pm Downbeat. General Admission: $20
Online Tickets:
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/tour/32260/Oscar-Lavns-Elegant-Calamity-Orchestra.utr

The Ensemble:
Oscar Lavën: tenor saxophone
Bridget Kelly: clarinet
Calvin Scott: oboe
Daniel Yeabsley: alto and bass saxophones
Patrick Hayes: bass clarinet
Michael Taylor: trumpet
Michael Costeloe: trumpet
Kaito Walley: trombone
Tristan Carter: violin
Ana Henderson: violin
Nicholas Denton-Protsack: cello
Rafael Ferrer-Noel: percussion
Mikey Trujillo: percussion
John Rae: drums
Ayrton Foote: piano
Patrick Bleakley: double bass

events.id: Great Big Waterfront Clean-Up-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Great Big Waterfront Clean-Up
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Help keep our harbour beautiful. 

Roll up your sleeves and join us for the Great Big Waterfront Clean-Up 2026. Help clean up our waterfront and keep trash out of our harbour.

Register your whānau, friends and workmates below to join the cause!

What to bring:
Sturdy footwear
Reusable drink bottle
Sun-smart gear
Raincoat (just in case!)*

What we will provide:
Gloves and rubbish sacks
Health & safety briefing
First aid support
Sunscreen & hand sanitiser
Rubbish removal

After your hard mahi, enjoy a refreshing Almighty drink as a thank you!

As one of the oldest buildings on the waterfront, Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is an important reminder of our past. We pride ourselves on being involved in activities that enhance the well-being of our land and people.

Plastic and debris threaten sealife and nesting habitats. By pitching in, you’re helping protect the harbour and its wildlife, including kororā little blue penguins, who nest along the waterfront.

He waka eke noa – We are in this together. Register now: https://bit.ly/4rEw39M

Thursday 29 January | 12PM – 2:30PM | Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum

Supported by our friends from Almighty.

*Note: In the event of bad weather, the Clean-Up will be cancelled. Cancellation notifications will be announced the day before the event (Tuesday 21 January) on our social media channels and via email to registered volunteers

events.id: Reels for Meals: The Choral-52 Beach Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Reels for Meals: The Choral
events.venue: 52 Beach Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
January's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is The Choral.
The Choral is a 2025 British historical drama film co-produced and directed by Nicholas Hytner and written by Alan Bennett. Set in 1916, during World War I, in the fictional town of Ramsden, Yorkshire, the film follows the members of the local choral society which recruits a group of teenage boys and girls for a performance of Edward Elgar's The Dream of Gerontius, a work chosen because it was not written by a German.
Starring Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong, Robert Emms, and Simon Russell Beale.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.

events.id: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Men's Circle: Authentic Relating
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
A supportive space for men to come together, connect, and explore life’s challenges in community. This circle welcomes men at all stages — whether you’re navigating change, looking for connection, or simply want a place to be heard.

Engage in open, honest conversations and experience the kind of connection that’s rare but meaningful. There’s no expectation to speak — your presence alone is valued. The circle follows a respectful, non-judgmental format, prioritizing safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.

Optional Plant-Based Dinner
After the circle, stay for a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a simple way to extend the sense of community and connection. This gathering is offered on a non-profit basis.

Meet Andre and Sri Jiva, your hosts

Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.

events.long_description:
This month's Yoga Nidra practice is designed to cultivate openness, joy, and creative flow. In this session, you’ll be guided into a state of profound rest while exploring the theme of light and expansion—inviting a sense of spaciousness in both body and mind.

Through gentle verbal guidance, you’ll be encouraged to embrace openness, fostering connection, inspiration, and a joyful presence. The experience is complemented by soothing sounds, comforting visuals, and a serene environment that support your journey into inner calm and renewed energy.

This practice is accessible to all levels—no previous experience required. Allow yourself to rest, recharge, and expand into a lighter, more creative state of being.

Plus - there’s an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

events.id: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip-Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip
events.venue: Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

Also check out other Trips & Adventurous Activities in Wellington.

events.id: Summer Camp | BADTAB and Bri Louise-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Summer Camp | BADTAB and Bri Louise
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson. 

Come along for our third night of festivities featuring psychedelic sensations BADTAB and the unbeatable Bri Louise.

BADTAB are carving out their own kaleidoscopic corner of the music world. Weaving together synthesisers and swirling guitar strums with rock and jazz inspired drum beats, BADTAB creates a unique and refreshing sound. The band made their mark in 2024 with a prolific run of releases. September saw the drop of The Pōneke Sessions, collaborative EP with Cellz. Then came December’s Echo Chambers Of…, their full-length debut album that introduced the world to BADTAB’s expansive soundscape. Since the release of their debut album, they have been deep in the works on their sophomore album which is anticipated for a 2026 summer release.

Bri Louise blends sultry queer with smooth love and undeniable groove. Their sound has roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, evolving into a rich fusion of Jazz, Hip-Hop, and R&B. Bri’s music features a talented live band that supports their poetic lyrics with colourful keys, phatty bass, flashy beats, vibrant guitar and fruity woodwinds.


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.id: Fight Club-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Fight Club
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Four comedians face off in one of the most brutal and radical fighting styles: Structured Debate. Welcome to Fight Club!

A gladiator-style comedy showdown where hot takes replace punches and the audience is judge, jury, and executioner.
Four comics battle across three rounds of ruthless, ridiculous debate. Two rounds in the first half, a desperate losers’ bout for the coveted booby prize, then a final face-off between the victors. The ultimate winner earns a spot in the Grand Final in November and a shot at the Fight Club belt.

They’ll argue life’s most important questions, like “Which comic would be the best date to your ex’s wedding?” and “Who could talk their way out of a speeding ticket?” No facts, no data, no mercy. Expect sharp jokes, fake confidence, real egos, audience voting, and maximum tomfoolery.

This isn’t just comedy debate, it’s trial by charisma.

events.id: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
You could drop the needle on any spot and find satisfying, thoroughly involving music. - London Jazz News

After releasing their recent album to a sold-out crowd at the Wellington Jazz Festival, the Elegant Calamity Orchestra makes its return to the Rogue and Vagabond! Led by flamboyant saxophonist Oscar Lavën, the Elegant Calamity Orchestra drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, french cinema, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock and roll saxophone.
Prepare to be swept into a surreal, cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous performance not to be missed.

9pm Downbeat.

The Ensemble:
Oscar Lavën: tenor saxophone
Bridget Kelly: clarinet
Calvin Scott: oboe
Daniel Yeabsley: alto and bass saxophones
Patrick Hayes: bass clarinet
Michael Taylor: trumpet
Michael Costeloe: trumpet
Kaito Walley: trombone
Tristan Carter: violin
Ana Henderson: violin
Nicholas Denton-Protsack: cello
Rafael Ferrer-Noel: percussion
Mikey Trujillo: percussion
John Rae: drums
Ayrton Foote: piano
Patrick Bleakley: double bass


About Oscar Lavën:
Oscar Lavën is an acclaimed saxophonist, multi-instrumentalist and composer based in Wellington, New Zealand. He has performed/recorded internationally with many artists/ensembles including Dave Weckl, Steve Gadd, Dennis Chambers, Lalah Hathaway, Gregg Bissonette, James Carter, Perter Erskine, Robben Ford, John Beasley's Grammy award winning MONK'estra, New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Rodger Fox Big Band, Tony Lindsay, Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra, Royal New Zealand Air Force Jazz Orchestra, Rhombus, The Wellington City Shake Em On Downers, and more. His albums 'Questions in Red' and 'Elegant Calamity' received international acclaim with another soon to be released. A lover of jazz and blues, Lavën is also a busy classical performer on bassoon in orchestras, chamber groups and as a soloist, and also teaches in the jazz programme at the New Zealand School of Music at Victoria University.
Oscar Lavën plays Selmer Paris saxophones and clarinets, and is a Thick Records NZ recording artist.

events.id: Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend Celebrations!-Worser Bay Boating Club, Karaka Bay Rd, NZ,MERIDIAN ENERGY, 250 Marine Pde, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend Celebrations!
events.venue: Worser Bay Boating Club, Karaka Bay Rd, NZ,MERIDIAN ENERGY, 250 Marine Pde, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend Celebrations!
https://www.wbbc.org.nz/events/worser-bay-centenary-weekend
Worser Bay Boating Club Centenary Weekend
Celebrating 100 years of sailing at Worser Bay.

Date & Location; 30 Jan 2026, 5:30 pm – 01 Feb 2026, 4:30 pm
WBBC, Karaka Bay Road, Seatoun, Wellington 6022, NZ

About the Event;
Toast 100 years of sailing at Worser Bay at The Worser Way book launch

Friday 30 January 5.30pm to 8.30pm

We kick off the weekend's events with the launch of "The Worser Way" history book. The proof copy has arrived in the country and it is stunning. There are 343 pages, 24 chapters, and 100s of photos tracking the history of sailing in Worser Bay from early Māori settlement through to the current day. If you haven't done so already place your order for a book then get a ticket to the launch where you will be able to pick up your copy.


Centenary club day and BBQ dinner

All day Saturday 31 January with BBQ dinner and drinks from 4.30pm onwards.

Saturday is going to be a big day at the club. The morning will kick off from 9.00am with 'Optisquad' and 'Blue Fleet sessions with our latest crop of new young sailors learning the ropes in the bay. From 11.30am we will have the usual weekend supply of pies and sandwiches available from the kitchen for lunch. Racing gets underway from 1.00pm with two races back to back for for all classes. Then from 4.30pm onwards the bar will be open and a buffet style BBQ dinner will be available for everyone from 6.30pm. Come down for part or all of the day and experience what club life is like after 100 years.


Centenary celebration lunch

Sunday 1 February from 11.30am onwards

“An opportunity to share tales from days when the wind was stronger and the bay worser”

To cap off the weekend, we are hosting a centenary celebration lunch at the club. Bring your partners, your memories, and settle in for an enjoyable buffet lunch. This will be an opportunity to reconnect, reminisce and share tales from years gone by. We’ll have a couple of speakers and we’ll mix up seating between courses so you get a chance to chat with a range of people. Everyone welcome - current members and old salts alike!

https://www.wbbc.org.nz/events/worser-bay-centenary-weekend
Register here!

events.id: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself-5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself
events.venue: 5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The day is designed to stretch and grow you! In the whakatauākī of Tā Apirana Ngata (Ngāti Porou), E tipu, e rea, he exhorts us to 'grow and flourish'. Grow and flourish! More than survive, get by, do ok. Flourish! This day will explore ways to fully engage with the beautiful moemoeā this whakatauākī speaks to.
E Tipu, E Rea
E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tō ao
Ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā
Hei ora mō te tinana
Ko tō ngākau ki ngā taonga a ō tīpuna Māori
Hei tikitiki mō tō māhunga
Ko tō wairua ki tō atua, nāna nei ngā mea katoa
Grow and branch forth for the days destined to you
Your hands to the tools of the Pākehā for the welfare of your body
Your heart to the treasures of your ancestors as adornments for your brow
Your spirit to God, who made all things
— Sir Apirana Ngata

You may like to think about how the day can help you align your professional work-based objectives (often expressed as KPI’s) with your personal vision, mission and goals.
The aims of the Course are to:
1. To host a mana ake wānanga exploring your unique future;
2. To bring together a group of people interested in creating rangatiratanga in their lives;
3. To draw from mātauranga Māori to support participants to create a 12-month personal strategic plan (drawing on moemoeā, pūrakau and pūtake);
4. To facilitate learning using Māori learning and teaching styles;
5. To connect people to the power of lifelong learning; and,
6. To add to the network of dedicated, Treaty based nation builders who have the goal of 'Becoming a CEO' on their radar for themselves or someone they know, whether that be at the personal, whānau, hapῡ, iwi or organisational level.
Our programme is interactive and delivered through a range of teaching / learning techniques which also include: facilitation; small group discussion; critical analysis; reflection; and, reporting back.

Snap is one of Aotearoa's most prolific comedians, who has amassed a stack of awards and a bunch of critical acclaim, before gradually becoming known for his number of cats and likelihood of dying alone.
Join Snap for a brand new hour of superbly crafted gags, largely centered around his new found status as a spinster.

events.long_description:
A Very (late) Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
New date! 30 January, 2026. So this will be 'A Very (late) Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas'.

NAUTICAL GAMES /// BEST DRESSED PRIZES /// SINGALONG SHANTIES /// XMAS-TYPE STUFF

Your work Xmas-party is going to be lame or cancelled so slap a $2 shop Santa's hat on 2025 and have a sing with Aotearoa's Most Seaworthy Shanty crew.

Prepare to be hit by a wave of joy and merriment as the Full Wellington Sea Shanty Society Experience transform the Abandoned Taproom into a shanty wonderland.

We got shanty booklets for all ye faithful and merch for Xmas presents.

If there's one thing we can all agree on in this country, it's that Xmas needs more sea shanties!

Only Te Upoko o te Ika show for 2025. New EP out in April 2026.

🎅🎅🎅

WELLINGTON SEA SHANTY SOCIETY

Aotearoa New Zealand's Most 'Sea Worthy' Shanty Group™ have been belting out traditional and original sea songs from Aotearoa, France, Spain, the UK and more, since time immemorial (2012).

The W.S.S.S have toured Aotearoa and France multiple times and are known for their rowdy and participatory live shows. They've performed at Paimpol (one of the world's largest shanty festivals), Splore, Albany Folk Festival (Aus), Quebec Sea Shanty Festival (Canada) and a shipload of other festivals in NZ, France & Canada. Their new EP 'Sea Shanties of the 70s, 80s, & Today!' has just recently surfaced to complement their 'Now That's What I Call Sea Shanties' series. Another must-listen is 'Ahoy!' - a French/English album made with Nantes amis Croche Dedans.

events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 3
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2, 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

Bookings can be made by bank transfer
to account in name of Heartsong Healing (via Hnry), 12-3245-0322503-37. Reference 'YIN . MONTH' and 'YOUR NAME'

OR PAY FOR ONE OR MORE PLACE BY CARD HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/14k3g1fIa3cJboQdRI

OR BUY THREE TICKETS FOR $150 HERE -

https://buy.stripe.com/00gg2N8fI6oV3Wo9Bt

and please confirm your payment by email to . Thank you.

Policy:
depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

🌊🚤 High Seas Boat Parties - Jan 30th - Wellington Harbour🚤🌊
🌊🚤 High Seas Boat Parties – 2026 Summer 🚤🌊

We’re kicking off the 2026 summer season in style with a sunset cruise across Wellington Harbour.

Join us for two hours of good vibes, open water, and top-tier selectors as we bring the party back to the harbour.

🎧 LINE-UP
Chris Keene
Chris Keene is an Auckland-based DJ & producer with over a decade of experience across pop, rap and electronic music. His career has taken him from local clubs to major stages including Rhythm & Vines, Snowmachine, SXSW and Coachella, with support slots for artists such as Meduza, Marshmello and Denzel Curry. Known for polished, crowd-focused sets that blend groove, energy and musical depth, Chris Keene is a perfect fit for a summer sunset cruise on Wellington Harbour.

With support from The Painter Guys & Odie

📍 LOCATION
Wellington Harbour

🕓 TIME
7:00 PM – 9:00 PM
(2-hour harbour cruise)

📅 DATE
Thursday 30 January

🔥 Expect summer energy, stacked music, iconic harbour views and a proper boat party atmosphere with nibbles provided

• This is a boat cruise event – boarding times are strict. Late arrivals may miss departure and no refunds will be issued.
• Event is weather dependent. In the case of unsafe sailing conditions, the event may be postponed or cancelled at the organiser’s discretion.
• If the event is cancelled due to weather, mechanical issues, or maritime safety requirements, tickets will be transferred to a rescheduled date or refunded (excluding booking fees where applicable).
• The event will proceed rain or shine unless conditions are deemed unsafe by the vessel operator.
• The captain and crew have final authority at all times. Anyone behaving unsafely, aggressively, or intoxicated may be removed without refund.
• Valid photo ID may be required.
• No outside alcohol permitted. Venue rules apply on board.
• By attending, you acknowledge that you are participating at your own risk.

events.id: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 1-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 1
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 1
Ira Hadžić

Ira Hadžić is a Berlin-based sound artist whose musical practice moves at the intersections of improvisation, composition, and introspection. She works with gongs, radiophonic pieces, field recordings, resonances, simple sonic gestures – as well as silence as an expressive form in its own right. Trained as a Deep Listening facilitator at the Center for Deep Listening (Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute), she incorporates these practices into her compositions and sound installations.

https://www.irahadzic.com/
https://ir-a.bandcamp.com/
https://www.instagram.com/irahadzic/


Anna Fält

Vocal music from Sweden and Finland, Ancient and new songs with only one instrument - human voice !

Anna Fält is a versatile voice artist, composer and singing teacher who is passionate about Nordic folk singing. She´s been touring Nordic countries and outside Europe for years with her unique concept of solo vocal concerts. Specialising in singing traditions from her two home countries Finland and Sweden, she combines the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones, performing in churches, museums, festivals, clubs and concert halls.

Her concerts are tributes to human voice, a one woman band, singing like you’ve never heard it before. Tradition meets vocal arts, avant-garde and story telling in an innovative and personal, intimate way. People everywhere can relate to the sincerity of the human voice, and storytelling, no matter the language.

https://annafaltenglish.wordpress.com/

Presale tickets available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club

events.id: Anne-Day-Quiz-Fundraiser-17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Anne-Day-Quiz-Fundraiser
events.venue: 17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s that time of year again, when I bully everyone I know into making a Big Deal about me and all my recent milestones and accomplishments.

In 2025 (YES I KNOW I’M LATE THIS YEAR) we're celebrating;
My 34th Birthday.
A DECADE living in Aotearoa New Zealand.
My new side hustle/hobby/passion, where I managed to produce 34 shows (actually wtf.)
Doing stand up for the first, second, third, and fourth time ever.
Rufus’ life, and his newly evolved form.
Finally biting the bullet on moving to the UK and announcing my resignation at work (effective in feb but whatever we’re counting it.)
This Anne Day I’m doing something a bit different - while I’m still accepting/exceptionally keen on receiving haikus and bawdy limericks as gifts, what I really want is support getting myself and Sexy Ghost Boy to Australia. But I, always a giver, am not just going to ask for your money with nothing in it for you.

And so? Anne-Themed-Fundraiser-Quiz-Night.

Brush up on New Zealand politics, Josip Broz (Tito)’s Yugoslavia, The Rocky Horror Picture Show, Kākāpō biology, and the History of Rufus. There will be prizes! 

Important details
Tickets $10+bf each, but any additional koha appreciated <3 
Teams of 4-6, feel free to bring +1s and +mores that I don’t know. 
Can’t make it but still want to send some aroha my way? Donate direct to the fundraiser here:  https://www.thearts.co.nz/boosted/projects/sexy-ghost-boy-goes-to-australia

events.id: Journey to Serenity: Yin Yoga and Sound Healing-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Journey to Serenity: Yin Yoga and Sound Healing
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are monthly on the second Friday of each month and are held temporarily in the Meeting Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

These events sometimes sell out - so please book early 

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

Open to all: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

and please confirm your payment by email to bryony@heartsonghealing.life. Thank you.

Policy:
Depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

events.id: Weekend Laughs with Michele A'Court and Jamaine Ross-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Weekend Laughs with Michele A'Court and Jamaine Ross
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Weekend Laughs is a showcase of top Kiwi comedy at the capital's favourite comedy venue

Featuring:
Michele A'Court -Winner of Female Comedian of the Decade at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards, Michele has performed in Las Vegas, San Francisco, Vancouver and at comedy festivals in Edinburgh, Glasgow, Melbourne and Adelaide.

Michele's work turns up everywhere - on stage, television, radio; in newspapers and magazines - and she is in demand as a comic, an event MC, and also as a social commentator across all media. One of our country's best!

With headline act Jamaine Ross
Jamaine is a born and bred Christchurchian who is becoming a well-known comedic face on the stand-up circuit as 'The Maori guy with the beard and the hat'.

Over his stand-up career he has achieved a number of accolades, including winning the Raw Comedy Quest in 2012, garnering a Billy T Award nomination in 2014, and winning the inaugural NZ International Comedy Festival's 'Best Facial Hair' award in 2014. He has also opened for Tenacious D on their New Zealand tour in 2013, and opened for Demetri Martin at his Christchurch show in 2019.

Also featuring -
Friday 30th Jan
Snap
Oliver Pol
Rhian Wood-Hill
and more!

Saturday 30th Jan
Snap
Mike Fowler
and more!

events.id: Double Trouble @ Moonshine-Moonshine Park, Trentham,2 Argyle Grv, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Double Trouble @ Moonshine
events.venue: Moonshine Park, Trentham,2 Argyle Grv, Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Double Trouble @ Moonshine
Welcome to the first edition of Double Trouble @ Moonshine Park!

What?
Double Trouble is a one-day, two round Doubles disc golf tournament. The modified best-shot doubles rule applies where only two tee shots in a row from the same player can be taken.

There are two divisions available:
1) Open (no rating caps or restrictions)
2) Mixed

Mixed division is for teams of:
* male + female
* female + female
* adult + junior
* junior + junior.
The guideline for entry to the Mixed division is that the total PDGA rating for the team is less than 1700.

Registration is capped at 54 teams, so get in quick so you don't miss out (there will be a wait-list if needed).

Where?
Moonshine Park in Upper Hutt.
Parking, bathrooms and water are available on site.

When?
Saturday 31 January 2026.
Player briefing at 8:45am, with round one starting at 9:15am.
Lunch will be one hour from 12pm to 1pm, with round two starting at 1:15pm.
Timings may vary depending on speed of play.

How to enter?
This is a UDisc event. Registration is now open.

If you have a partner, complete the below form and make a team payment of $20 no later than Friday 30th January 2026, 5pm.


If you would like a randomly assigned partner, complete this form and make a payment of $10 no later than Friday 30 January 2026, 5pm. You will be notified of your partner via email by Friday 30 January, 8pm.



Catering?
Thank you to Eve Chin who has offered to provide catering for this event. This is optional, and if you wish to partake, payment for catering is on the day via bank transfer or cash. $5 for two sausages and a drink or $10 for all-you-can-eat. If the weather is a scorcher, ice-blocks for $1 will be available.


REFUND POLICY
Greater Wellington Disc Golf Club is responsible for all refunds and cancellations.
100%: refund will be issued for anyone pulling out before 8pm on 16th of January.
Any withdrawals after 8:01pm 16th January will not be eligible for any refund unless the space can be filled with the wait-list. Players may transfer their entry to another person if there is no one on the wait-list.

events.id: Lunar New Year In The Hutt: Tết Cooking Workshop-27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011,27 Hillary Ct, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Lunar New Year In The Hutt: Tết Cooking Workshop
events.venue: 27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011,27 Hillary Ct, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Lunar New Year In The Hutt: Tết Cooking Workshop
Step into the flavours of Vietnamese Lunar New Year with a special hands-on workshop that brings tradition, community, and storytelling together.Join us as part of the Lunar New Year Festival 2026 for a delicious cultural experience!� What We’ll Make Together:� Bánh Tét / Bánh Chưng – iconic sticky rice cakes wrapped in banana leaves, symbolising family reunion and prosperity� Dưa Món (Pickled Vegetables) – crunchy, colourful pickles that balance the richness of New Year dishes� Thịt Kho (Caramelized Braised Pork) – tender pork simmered in coconut water, a dish that brings comfort, warmth and the taste of TếtThis workshop is designed for all ages — beginners, families, food lovers, and anyone curious about Vietnamese culture. Learn the meaning behind each dish and how they come together on every Vietnamese New Year table.� Why Join?• Experience authentic Vietnamese Tết traditions• Learn recipes passed down through generations• Connect with community through shared stories and food• Take home what you cook• Celebrate culture in a warm, hands-on environmentSponsored & partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust, E Tū Whānau & Hutt City Council.

events.long_description:
New Year, New Venue, January Club Comp 2026 :-)
When: Saturday 31st January 2026

Where: Weights room, Upper Hutt College, Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt.

Entries are limited.

Weigh In: 9am.

Competition Start: 10am.

Entries are limited to 10 lifters, once priority spots are filled, all others will be waitlisted.

Priority will be given to Upper Hutt College students and 41° Lifters.

Sign up is via the Weightlifting NZ website calendar, make sure you select 2026 to find the entry link, entries open Nov 24th. https://weightlifting.nz/Calendar

Cost: $20 per lifter. This fee must be paid as you register via the WNZ site. (This change is to simplify the process now being followed by the club as required by WNZ)

Spectators are FREE.

Live Stream is also FREE so don't sign up anywhere else.

Detailed start list will be released closer to the date on the 41° WLC Facebook page

Registrations for this competition close at noon on the Wednesday prior to the comp, if not full before, so please sign up as soon as possible.

Any questions then please send them to Matt or contact Matt on 027-2322-701.

We are back running club comps this year, so get amongst it :-)

events.id: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt-Dowse Square Lower Hutt,Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
events.venue: Dowse Square Lower Hutt,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!

Hosted by Viet Hub NZ, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces the wider Lunar New Year traditions of diverse communities across Aotearoa.

Come and experience a day full of music, culture, food, and community connection as we gallop into the Year of the Horse!

⸻

🎭 What to Expect:
• Outdoor Cultural Market: Delicious food stalls, handmade crafts, community booths, and more
• Live Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural music and dance throughout the day on the Town Hall stage
• Cultural Games & Activities: Try your hand at Vietnamese folk games, calligraphy, lantern making, and storytelling
• Exhibition Space: Discover real stories of migration and belonging through our Immigrant Storytelling installation
• Traditional Costume Photography: Indoor photo area with Vietnamese and Lunar New Year-inspired costumes
• Children’s Zone: Face painting, interactive games, and family workshops
• Lucky Draw & Spot Prizes!

⸻

🎟️ Tickets:
• Free General Admission – Registration encouraged for updates & giveaways
• Optional Donation – Support our community initiatives and annual cultural programmes

Every ticket holder goes into the draw for a lucky Lunar prize!

⸻

💛 Why Attend?

This is Lower Hutt’s largest and most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration – welcoming all ages, all cultures, and all walks of life. Whether you’re reconnecting with your roots or exploring new traditions, there’s something here for everyone.

⸻

📢 Stay Connected:

Follow us on Facebook￼ or visit www.viethubnz.org￼
📧 Contact us:

⸻

This event is proudly supported by local businesses, volunteers, and the wider Hutt community. Proceeds support Viet Hub NZ’s year-round cultural, educational, and community programmes.

events.long_description:
NZCIS Wellington Cup Day featuring Example
NZCIS Wellington Cup Day is the biggest day of the year at RACE Trentham. A celebration of racing, style, and summer entertainment. The iconic Group 3 NZCIS Wellington Cup headlines the action, with live music from international DJ Example and the always-popular Fashion in the Field competition.

From the racing purist to the social reveller, there's something for everyone. Choose from a range of exciting hospitality options or join the party on the lawn and soak up the atmosphere. NZCIS Wellington Cup is a true highlight of the summer calendar - an unforgettable day of racing, entertainment, and celebration from start to finish.

events.id: Set your focus for 2026-Nga Manu Reserve Rd, Waikanae 5391,Waikanae, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Set your focus for 2026
events.venue: Nga Manu Reserve Rd, Waikanae 5391,Waikanae, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Set your focus for 2026
I am really excited to offer this workshop and in such an amazing space. Let's do it. Let's create a 2026 that is amazing.

Each new year we are encouraged to think about new year’s resolutions. As we know these often don’t play out, we are unable to follow through or we lose momentum or we just make them unachievable.

The purpose of this workshop is to explore what you might want to create, change, or stabilise during 2026 through the exploration and the identification of a word that brings the energy you want for the year.

I have been working with this concept of a word for a number of years now and always when I reflect at the closing of the year, I can identify how this has played out during the year. It works! Reset was my word for 2025!!!

On the day we will have a gentle yoga practice (all levels), meditation and journalling prompted by a framework (you’ll find out on the day) that encourages us to open up to the possibilities of 2026 and to set a clear intention of what we want from the year and how one word can energise that intention.

I will provide some materials for you to create a vision board if that is your intention to do so. I will also provide material (or a framework in corporate speak) to support you in your reflections on what it is that you want in 2026.

Investment is $60. If you want to explore Nga Manu as well, I would definitely encourage that, we can provide you with a discounted access ticket of $15.

events.name: Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
events.venue: 101 Glenmore Street, New Zealand 6012,Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
In this one-hour downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s past summers, namely the often-ignored ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures. A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Anna Fält - Workshop: Nordic Folk Songs-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Anna Fält - Workshop: Nordic Folk Songs
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Anna Fält - Workshop: Nordic Folk Songs
Anna Fält (Finland/Sweden) has a degree in pop/jazz singing (2006), folk music education (2011) and a master in Nordic folk music (2017). She's been studying in renowned universities such as The Royal Music Academy in Stockholm and Sibelius Academy in Helsinki.

Anna´s been teaching private lessons since 2008 both in person and online. After graduating as a folk singing teacher 2011, her educational work consists mostly of workshops and courses introducing Finnish singing traditions for non-Finnish people. All material is taught by ear and consists of simple melodies with lots of possibilities for variation - everyone can join, no matter the background! The emphasis is always in Enjoying singing & sounding together.

Anna's specialities are singing traditions from Finland and Sweden, combining the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones. She is passionate about the human voice and is known for her innovative ways to use voice as an versatile instrument. She's been teaching workshops at various universities and music schools around the world.

Koha Entry

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.name: Saturday Sounds | Unity Wara
events.venue: The Bond Store,3C Magrath Ave, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Saturday Sounds | Unity Wara
Unity Wara is a dynamic and multi-talented entertainer who moved back to Kāpiti after 13 years in Taranaki to take up her teaching role at Kāpiti college as Māori performing arts, Kapa haka and vocal kaiako.

Known for her powerful, soulful voice and captivating stage presence, she has a strong background in Māori performing arts Her performances often incorporate elements of her Māori heritage, including fire and LED poi, and Māori instruments.

Unity is a versatile performer, skilled as a vocalist, guitarist, and loop artist. She has graced stages around the world, including in Europe, the United States, Japan, and Hong Kong, and has opened for prominent artists like Stan Walker and Hollie Smith. Her performances often incorporate elements of her Māori heritage, including fire and LED poi, and Māori instruments.

Welcome back Unity Wara.

__
Check out the rest of the 2025/6 season here: https://www.mostlymusic.nz/saturday-sounds

Saturday Sounds is a partnership between Mostly Music and The Bond Store. We have worked collaboratively to create an environment where musicians are welcomed and celebrated, and where audiences are encouraged to sit and listen to the music while enjoying excellent hospitality.

For more info about Mostly Music, check out mostlymusic.nz
For more info about The Bond Store check out thebondstore.co.nz

Join Tara Goddard for this Breathwork Medicine Journey connecting through breath and alchemising its medicine through waves of the body.

Breathwork is an ancient technique used for healing & expansion to bridge the gap between your human self & higher self.

Alternate states of awareness are created, where waves of emotion, thought or somatic sensation are able to roll through and release with the breath.

BreathWav not only works with somatic intelligence, but nervous system attunement, working with the denser and more subtle layers of the body to raise & uplift.

Breathwork may cause the release of
DMT (Spirit Molecule) it is an alchemy with brainwaves and cerebrospinal fluid. Gamma brainwaves are associated with states of deep meditation, heightened awareness, and higher brain functions.

Breathwork and other deeply meditative practices activate gamma waves and there is a correlation between gamma waves and DMT release, with one seeming to stimulate the other.

Breathwork experiences and benefits so often parallel those of DMT and other psychedelic plant-medicines, DMT is produced naturally in the brain, and is released during Breathwork.

𝘽𝙍𝙀𝘼𝙏𝙃𝙒𝙊𝙍𝙆 𝘽𝙀𝙉𝙀𝙁𝙄𝙏𝙎:

• Life purpose clarity

A breathwork journey is unique to each person and and the results are profound.

𝙒𝙃𝘼𝙏 𝙏𝙊 𝙀𝙓𝙋𝙀𝘾𝙏:

• You will then be guided through a 90 minute experience recieving healing & expansion bridging the gap between your human self & higher self.

• Your only job is to be open minded, relax, and let your breath guide you on this medicine journey be open to receive any healing or guidance that comes up throughout the journey.

• We will close of with an intergration circle finishing up at 5:30PM and have an hour break, to ground, nourish our bodies, and have a swim before we prepare for the Sound Bath at 6:30PM.

𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙩𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨:

Breathwork results in certain specific physiological changes in the body and also can result in intense physical and emotional release.

As a precaution, the following conditions are contraindicated in certain breathwork practices.

It is crucial that you inform your breathwork practitioner if any of the following conditions are relevant to you:

• Pregnancy (at any stage)

• Severe PTSD or trauma

• Currently using recreational drugs

• Recent surgery

• Taking any medication that alters brain chemistry like anti-anxiety,anti-depressant, ADD, OCD medications, etc.

•Detached Retina

•Glaucoma

•Kidney disease

•High Blood Pressure

•Cardiovascular disease, including angina, previous heart attack or stroke
•Diagnosis of aneurysm in the brain or abdomen

•Uncontrolled thyroid conditions

•Diabetes

•Severe Asthma— for mild to moderate asthma, we can discuss but you must bring your inhaler to the session.

• Epilepsy

• History of Seizures

• Prior diagnosis of bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or previous psychiatric condition.

•Any other medical, psychiatric or physical conditions which would impair or affect the ability to engage in any activities that involve deep physical and/or emotional release.

𝙁𝘼𝙌’𝙨:

What can I expect?

There will be a short guided meditation, explanation of conscious connected breathwork (how to do it, tetany, things that may happen etc), a full 60 min breathwork journey and space afterwards for a few to share about their experience and any questions asked and support given if needed.

I have one or more of the listed contraindications - what should I do?

Email or message Tara to let her know what these are and she’ll let you know if she can offer adjustments so you can attend.

events.id: Fairy Tours-Kapiti Coast,Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Fairy Tours
events.venue: Kapiti Coast,Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Fairy Tours
Beyond the vials, the Unseen kingdom waits for the day they can meet you again.

I have seen and connected with these races all of my life. There are many, many races that live beyond the veil of our perception. The Green kingdom beings of the Fae and the Elves, the beings of the twigs and leaves. There are the earth-dwelling races of the dwarves and elementals. The “Unseen Kingdom” banner includes the mer people, dragons and the unicorns. In fact, they gave me the term “the Unseen Kingdom” to describe all of the hundreds of races and beings that humans seem incapable of perceiving.
In this experience, we will meet on the margins of the forest. You are invited to bring whatever you need to be comfortable sitting or lying down. We will be inviting whatever beings of the unseen kingdom who wish to, to come and interact with us.
The experience will unfold as it may. I am expecting that it will involve a meditation, lessons in Unseen Kingdom etiquette, and offerings. In my heart, I know more may come, but every time will be unique.
Please come with a calm heart and a gentle voice.
31st January- 4pm- 7pm
Location to be confirmed with the Unseens. - hopefully they have a spot on the Kapiti Coast. lol

Who says mischief 😈 has to wait till midnight? We present HOMO BEFORE TEN.

FRISKY Parties are queer, genderqueer, trans, & non-binary friendly parties where all are welcome to join in the fun.

events.id: Coven: Butch-Sweet Axe Throwing Co. (Sweet Axe Throwing Co. Wellington),60 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Coven: Butch
events.venue: Sweet Axe Throwing Co. (Sweet Axe Throwing Co. Wellington),60 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Coven: Butch
For butches and butch lovers! This night sets to make two things clear:

1. We love butches!
2. Get enough sapphics and queers in a room and anything can become a competition

Join us for axe throwing, games, kai, and as always at our events impeccable vibes. Spot prizes for the best butches, drink on arrival, and a room full of hot babes? Need we say more, so get your fits checked and grab your ticket before they go. This event has limited capacity.

Not a butch? No problem, all butch and butch appreciating Coven members of all flavours welcome.

No dress code! Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.

More info about Coven:

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
This event is located on the ground floor. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly to the Whisky & Wood team at

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!

events.id: PADI Advanced Open Water Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Wellington 5026, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: PADI Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Wellington 5026, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
PADI Advanced Open Water Course
“Your Next Step in Underwater Adventure”
Exploration excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water
course is all about. And no you don't have to be "advanced" to take it - it's designed
so both new and experienced Open Water Divers can sign up and develop better
diving skills and techniques straight away!

The Advanced Open Water Diver course helps you increase your confidence and
build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water. It’s also a great
way to get more diving experience under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
This course builds on what you've learnt and develops new capabilities by
introducing new dive activities and ways to have fun scuba diving. You will complete
5 different types of dives to build your confidence and develop your dive skills. The
dives include the basics of Deep Diving Underwater Navigation - and your choice of
Peak Performance Buoyancy Naturalist Fish Identification Wreck (weather dependant)
Enriched Air * Photography or Night during winter.

Complete the theory online then join us for a weekends diving. After the 5 dives
over the weekend you will qualify as a PADI Advanced Open Water Diver. This is the
minimum requirement for many of our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the
PADI Rescue Diver course.

If you have any questions please call so we can help you.

PADI Advanced Open Water Course “Your Next Step in Underwater Adventure” Exploration excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water course is all about.

The Advanced Open Water Diver course helps you increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water.
It’s also a great way to get more diving experience under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
This is the minimum requirement for many of our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.

events.id: Padi Advanced Open Water Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Padi Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
Exploration, excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water (AOW) Diver course is all about.

The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible. That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.

The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive. Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).

You may choose to add the 'Enriched Air' and/or the 'Dive Against Debris' specialty qualifications to your weekend experience. Simply ask to: include these dives as part of your five dives, complete the on-line study and a short practical, pay a small fee – and go diving. These Specialties count towards the prestigious PADI Master Scuba Diver rating.

Pay your deposit and you can begin the AOW theory. Make sure your dive medical is current, then join us for a weekend's fun diving. After everything is completed, you will qualify as a PADI AOW Diver. This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.
If you have any questions, please call so we can help you.

events.id: Conflict Management and Resolution Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conflict Management and Resolution Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Conflict is an inevitable part of life, arising in families, workplaces, and daily interactions.
While many strive to avoid it, suppressing thoughts, feelings, and values to sidestep disagreements can lead to unresolved issues. Learning to manage and resolve conflicts equips you with the tools to navigate these challenges effectively, fostering understanding and collaboration.

Aim of this workshop: To empower you with the skills and confidence needed to effectively manage and resolve conflicts.

Learning Outcomes:

By the end of the workshop, you will:

Recognise how your actions and behaviours influence conflict.
Develop your ability to clarify and manage expectations.
Acquire practical tools for effective conflict management.
Create a sustainable action plan to continuously apply conflict resolution strategies.

events.id: Memory Mastery for Confidence Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Memory Mastery for Confidence Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Unlock your mind's full potential with "Memory Mastery," led by Neil Thornton, award-winning educator and founder of NZ Comedy School. Drawing on over 30 years of teaching experience and cognitive research, this workshop equips you with powerful, scientifically-proven memory techniques.

Learn to retain names and lists, learn vocabulary, deliver presentations without notes, and boost your professional efficiency. Discover how to create vivid mental imagery, use spatial memory techniques, and leverage the power of association to revolutionise your recall abilities. Whether you're a busy professional, a student, or simply looking to sharpen your mental acuity, this course offers practical, immediately applicable skills for enhanced memory performance in both personal and professional settings.

Bring pen and paper if you wish to take notes.

Tea and coffee provided, please bring your lunch and snacks.

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC), and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email, so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
About 1 in 5 New Zealand adults experience a common mental illness each year. Understanding how to talk about mental health and help someone in need are important skills. This certified Mental Health First Aid course will teach you the skills and knowledge to recognise and respond to someone experiencing mental health challenges. Course fees: If you are a NZ citizen/Permanent Resident Visa the course fee is $199 (evidence of eligibility required). Others pay $499.

Description
Mental Health First Aid is an evidence-based workshop which gives people the skills and confidence to have supportive conversations with their whānau, co-workers and community and help guide them to professional help if needed.

You will learn to recognise common mental health challenges, how to provide initial help to someone experiencing a mental health challenge using a practical, evidence-based action plan, and how to respond in a crisis. During the workshop, you will have the opportunity to practice new skills in a safe environment.

You must be a NZ citizen or resident to qualify for the reduced course fee. A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Mental health challenges covered in the course include:

Depression
Anxiety
Psychosis
Substance use problems
Mental Health Crisis Covered:

Suicidal thoughts and behaviours
Non- Suicidal self-injury
Panic attack
Traumatic events
Severe effects from Alcohol or other substance use
Aggressive behaviours
People who attend Mental Health First Aid training can complete a short online assessment to be accredited as a Mental Health First Aider. You must attend the full two days to be able to do the online assessment for accreditation. The accreditation is valid for three years.

If you choose not to be accredited, you will receive a certificate of participation if you attend the full course. You will also receive a workbook as part of your course fee.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead, so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by emai,l so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
You must be a NZ citizen or resident to qualify for the reduced course fee.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

31 Jan 2026 - 1 Feb 2026
2 days, Sat & Sun 9:30 AM – 4:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Anne Troy
$499.00 incl. GST
Fee for NZ citizens and residents $219.00 incl. GST

events.id: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 2-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 2
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Anna Fält and Ira Hadžić - Night 2
Our guest artists Anna Fält (Finland/Sweden) and Ira Hadžić (Germany) in improvised collaborations with local musicians Ritual Heaps, DSLB and Erika Grant.

Ira Hadžić is a Berlin-based sound artist whose musical practice moves at the intersections of improvisation, composition, and introspection. She works with gongs, radiophonic pieces, field recordings, resonances, simple sonic gestures – as well as silence as an expressive form in its own right. Trained as a Deep Listening facilitator at the Center for Deep Listening (Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute), she incorporates these practices into her compositions and sound installations.

https://www.irahadzic.com/
https://ir-a.bandcamp.com/
https://www.instagram.com/irahadzic/

Anna Fält is a versatile voice artist, composer and singing teacher who is passionate about Nordic folk singing. She´s been touring Nordic countries and outside Europe for years with her unique concept of solo vocal concerts. Specialising in singing traditions from her two home countries Finland and Sweden, she combines the bright Scandinavian and dark East-European tones, performing in churches, museums, festivals, clubs and concert halls.

https://annafaltenglish.wordpress.com/

Presale tickets available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Jewellery-making in 6 weeks, Saturday Mornings, Level 2+-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 6 weeks, Saturday Mornings, Level 2+
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Our popular weekend block classes are the best way for keen makers to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. It starts on Sat 31 January and runs for 6 weeks till Sat 7 March.

This class is for regular students at Ōtaki who have already completed at least a beginner's 6 week block as a minimum.

Students will be supported by Vaune and the occasional guest tutor to further their jewellery making skills in the areas that interest them.

This class is a Fabrication focus. Students who have already taken a class in enamelling or wax work can continue their work in this class but the format does not allow for beginner lessons in these things.

You can purchase metals and materials for your projects as you go - in the studio.
Advanced students are encouraged to retain their silver scrap and learn to work thriftily with materials, using scrap for future projects.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH-Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH
events.venue: Valhalla,154 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SUMAC - WELLINGTON - VALHALLAH
Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.

SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.

The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork

Soon after the release SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary.

SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment.
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.
events.description:
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.
SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band.
Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation.
The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.
The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career.

events.id: Sandcasting Day - Summer-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sandcasting Day - Summer
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for this wonderful intro to sandcasting - it is a great opportunity to make some gorgeous lasting jewellery gifts for yourself or your loved ones!

Students are shown the ancient technique of sand casting, using a wax to make a simple hard model or found objects such as buttons or simple small forms - create your simple 2-part mould and melt and pour sterling silver or shibuichi (a different mix of silver and copper) to cast into the sand.

The model you have made or found enables you to make multiple pours possible, until you either get the result you are after or to create multiple pieces. This is a fun process for those who just want to try their hand at it, or a very useful low-tech process for those who are making jewellery into a career or creative activity.

Course cost includes 9g silver but students can expect to use extra $50 - $70 worth of silver or $20 - $30 of shibuichi.

This course aims to allow students to all have at least one successful cast, and to learn the finishing techniques for the pieces they cast, allowing you to leave with a gorgeous finished piece of jewellery.

events.name: Tết Cooking Workshop - Celebrate Lunar New Year Through Food
events.venue: 27 Hillary Court, Naenae, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Step into the flavours of Vietnamese Lunar New Year with a special hands-on workshop that brings tradition, community, and storytelling together.
Join us as part of the Lunar New Year Festival 2026 for a delicious cultural experience!
✨ What We’ll Make Together:
🍃 Bánh Tét / Bánh Chưng – iconic sticky rice cakes wrapped in banana leaves, symbolising family reunion and prosperity
🥒 Dưa Món (Pickled Vegetables) – crunchy, colourful pickles that balance the richness of New Year dishes
🍖 Thịt Kho (Caramelized Braised Pork) – tender pork simmered in coconut water, a dish that brings comfort, warmth and the taste of Tết
This workshop is designed for all ages — beginners, families, food lovers, and anyone curious about Vietnamese culture. Learn the meaning behind each dish and how they come together on every Vietnamese New Year table.
💛 Why Join?
• Experience authentic Vietnamese Tết traditions
• Learn recipes passed down through generations
• Connect with community through shared stories and food
• Take home what you cook
• Celebrate culture in a warm, hands-on environment
Sponsored & partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust, E Tū Whānau & Hutt City Council.

events.id: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt-45 Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
events.venue: 45 Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt 🐎
Proudly sponsored by Hutt City Council
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!
Organised by Viet Hub NZ and proudly sponsored by Hutt City Council, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces wider Lunar New Year traditions from diverse communities across Aotearoa.
Let’s gallop into the Year of the Horse together through music, food, stories, and joyful celebration!
🎭 What to Expect:
Outdoor Cultural Market: Featuring authentic street food, handmade crafts, and local community stalls
Live Stage Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural dances, and musical acts throughout the day
Cultural Games & Crafts: Hands-on activities like calligraphy, lantern making, and Vietnamese folk games
Storytelling Exhibition: An indoor showcase of migration stories, heritage, and identity from local residents
Traditional Costume Photo Corner: Indoor area to take photos in Vietnamese and cultural New Year outfits
Family Fun: Face painting, interactive workshops, lucky draws, and more.
🎟️ Tickets:
Free General Admission – Register to stay updated and be entered in giveaways
Optional Donation – Help us grow this community-led festival and support ongoing Viet Hub NZ programme
💛 Why You Should Come:
This is Lower Hutt’s largest, most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration, designed for all ages and backgrounds. Whether you’re reconnecting with your heritage or discovering new traditions — everyone is welcome.
📢 Stay Connected:
Follow us on Facebook or visit www.viethubnz.org
📧 Contact us: hello@viethubnz.org
🫶 This event is made possible thanks to the generous support of Hutt City Council and our amazing volunteers, artists, and community partners.
