events.id: Scallop Shell Zine Making Workshop: SOLD OUT-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Scallop Shell Zine Making Workshop: SOLD OUT
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join artist Cora-Allan (Ngāpuhi, Ngātitumutumu and Niue: Alofi, Liku) for a hands-on zine-making workshop. During a research trip to Massachusetts, Cora-Allan discovered scallop shell books historically used by women to archive seaweed and botanical finds. Drawing on this tradition, participants will create their own zines bound in scallop shells, exploring experimental ways of recording mauri and wairua from the natural world.

All materials are supplied. This is a one-hour session and spaces are limited—book your ticket today to secure your spot!

IMAGE Scallop pukapuka (2025) Photo courtesy of artist

events.id: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26-Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26
events.venue: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.

events.id: Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this one-hour downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s past summers, namely the often-ignored ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures. A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $10 - book now
Free for Friends

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden. They run throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: The Real Love Musical Screening- Wellington-Wellington Central Baptist Church, 46-48 Boulcott Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Real Love Musical Screening- Wellington
events.venue: Wellington Central Baptist Church, 46-48 Boulcott Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Free Event!

The Real Love Musical screening is coming to Wellington!!

Join us for a wonderful afternoon as we present this incredible, uplifting story with stellar cast including Joanna Ampil as Thanh (Les Miserables, Miss Saigon, Jesus Christ Superstar, Cats etc) and a beautiful score by Tony, Oscar, Grammy and Emmy award winning composers.

The musical is inspired by the true story of a woman propelled to make a heartrending decision as she embarks on what seems a destined journey travelling through India and the Himalayas, encountering adventure, danger, and surprises along the way.

The unforgettable story is sure to bring tears, laughter, and poignant memories for audiences of all backgrounds.

Light vegan refreshments (snacks and tea/coffee) are complementary and we will have a selection of Supreme Master Ching Hai's books and poetry available for viewing (the songs in the musical are set to this extraordinary poetry).

Don't miss this uplifting FREE event. Alongside Joanna Ampil the musical features an all star cast - Adam Pascal, Robert Torti, Faith Riveira, Shirley Jones, Daisy Eagan, Cady Huffman and more. Music by Oscar & 5-time Emmy winner Bill Conti (“Rocky”), 2-time Oscar winner Al Kasha (“The Poseidon Adventure”), Emmy nominee Doug Katsaros, Tony & Emmy winner Don Pippin (“Oliver!”), and Oscar & 2-time Grammy winner David Shire (“Baby”). The Director is Chris Shelton for this superb musical and the outstanding Choreographer is Mark Knowles.

Reserve your seats today!

Keen to meet new people face to face? Aged 25-35?
Join us for CBK Speed Dating on the Martini rooftop where awkward silences are rare and great connections are just a chat away. 😏
You’ll rotate through a series of 5-minute conversations, with fun icebreaker prompts to keep things flowing and relaxed. Our hosts welcome you at the door, get you settled, and make the whole night feel easy.
Your first drink is on us 🍹🍸
Ladies stay seated while men rotate between seats, like musical chairs but with less running. 🎶🪑
We break halfway for a 15-minute refresh and drink top-up 🍻
After the event, you’ll receive an email with your matches, and we only share details if you both say yes. 💌🤝
Whether you come solo or with a friend, CBK Social Club makes it simple:
show up, settle in, enjoy the vibe… and let the good times happen.
Good people. Good energy. Good times.
Your next great connection could be just one conversation away!

events.id: Comedy Q&A with Michele A'Court-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Comedy Q&A with Michele A'Court
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Comedy's next Comedy Q&A is with Michele A'Court, a casual chat about her career in comedy, writing, film and tv.

Michele has been part of New Zealand’s entertainment industry since she first appeared on television in 1987 as a children’s TV presenter.

In the years since she has worked in radio, theatre and television, and was an original member of the team of comedians who brought the hit TV show, “7 Days” to our screens. She performs live in pubs and clubs everywhere from the Laugh Factory in Las Vegas to the Mangawhai Tavern in Northland. Michele won “NZ Female Comedian of the Decade” in 2010, and was presented with the VAC Reilly Comedy Award for Excellence in 2015.

The bar will be open, so bring some cash, some questions, and we'll be good to go.

All welcome.

events.id: Coven: Butch-Sweet Axe Throwing Co., 60 Kent Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Coven: Butch
events.venue: Sweet Axe Throwing Co., 60 Kent Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
For butches and butch lovers! This night sets to make two things clear:

1. We love butches!
2. Get enough sapphics and queers in a room and anything can become a competition

Join us for axe throwing, games, kai, and as always at our events impeccable vibes. Spot prizes for the best butches, drink on arrival, and a room full of hot babes? Need we say more, so get your fits checked and grab your ticket before they go. This event has limited capacity.

Not a butch? No problem, all butch and butch appreciating Coven members of all flavours welcome.

No dress code! Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.

More info about Coven:

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
This event is located on the ground floor. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly to the Whisky & Wood team at hello@whiskyandwood.co.nz

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!

events.id: Star Sense: Find Your Way by the Stars-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Star Sense: Find Your Way by the Stars
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Learn the ancient art of celestial navigation under one of the world’s best night skies.

This Summer of Space, Star Safari invites you to rediscover something humanity once knew instinctively — how to read the night sky as a living map.

Under Wairarapa’s internationally celebrated dark skies (featured by Lonely Planet as one of the world’s top stargazing destinations), you’ll learn how explorers, navigators, and storytellers used the stars to orient themselves, travel across oceans, understand seasons, and pass knowledge through generations.

Guided by Hari Mogoșanu — TEDx speaker, former NASA intern, and creator of the planetarium film Ngā Tohunga Whakatere — you’ll gain practical, confidence-building skills in southern-sky star-literacy:

You’ll learn how to:
- Find south using stars and sky geometry
- Identify the key constellations of the summer sky
- Trace the Milky Way and understand its structure
- Read seasonal sky patterns and stellar motion
- Tell planets from stars
- Navigate using asterisms and star-hops
- See the sky through multiple cultural perspectives
- Understand dark-sky ethics and the importance of gentle lighting

This experience focuses on unaided stargazing — learning to understand the sky with your own eyes. By the end of the night, you’ll be able to step outside, recognise what you see, and use the stars to find direction anywhere in the world.

What’s included:
Guided instruction, southern-sky star map, orientation techniques, constellation recognition, navigation principles, cultural stories, dark-sky awareness, Q&A.

Recommended age: 10+
Duration: 2.5 hours

Come and learn the ancient skill of sky navigation — and leave with a deeper sense of place in the cosmos.

Star Sense. Find Your Way by the Stars.

events.id: SUMAC-Valhalla, Wellington-Valhalla
events.name: SUMAC
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.
SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.
The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork
Soon after the release SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary.
SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment.
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.

events.id: River City Express-Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: River City Express
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand
events.long_description:
River City Express
Travel to the beautiful river side town of Whanganui, hauled by both steam locomotive Ab 608 and diesel locomotive Da 1410. Choose between doing your own thing, or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River onboard the coal fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".

Leaving Kapiti as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua. After a stop in Palmerston North we head up the trunk through the townships of Feilding and Marton before turning onto the Marton - New Plymouth railway line for the last stretch into Whanganui. After crossing the 290km long Whanganui River, we proceed slowly down the short 5km branch line taking us to Taupo Quay.

TRAVEL ON THE PADDLE STEAMER WAIMARIE!
Salvaged from the bottom of the Whanganui River where she sat for around 50 years, the Paddle Steamer Waimarie was restored to her former glory and re-launched in 2000. She is now the only one of her kind in operation in New Zealand. Your cruise leaves the Riverboat Centre Wharf and heads upriver taking in the scenery and views of Whanganui which can only be experienced from Te Awa Tupua, the Whanganui River. The commentary shares riverboat history and points of interest along the way. Check out the boiler that powers our paddle steamer, and maybe meet the homing pigeons and send a message with them on their flight back to the Riverboat Centre.

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $209
Child 2-12yrs - $179

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $189
Child 2-12yrs - $169

Buses will transport you from your arrival at the station to the Waimarie River Boat Centre.

DO YOUR OWN THING!
There will be a collection of vintage cruiser bikes for hire for a small fee to those keen to take exploring to the next level.

There will be short tours available at the Durie Hill Elevator. It is New Zealand’s only public transport elevator and is still used on a daily basis by locals and visitors.

There are multiple places to go, and things to see on a cruiser bike or on foot. Take a tram ride for a small fee and arrive at the Riverboat museum, be blown away by NZ Glassworks, admire the sculptures and views from the Motua gardens along the river, indulge in local cuisine, or simply shop local.

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

Book at https://steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/river-city-express/

Choose between doing your own thing, or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River onboard the coal fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".
Leaving Kapiti as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua.

Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---

PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.

🎨 Art & Craft
🌳 Native trees, flowers and plants
🍶 Candles, soaps and wax melts
🕰️ Antiques and collectables
🍯 Produce, including yummy honey!
👚 Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
⚒️ Tools for the home and garden

Come for the finds, stay for the flavor.
---

STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
His music has been performed live on an Arctic ice-floe and as soundtracks for Oscar and Golden Globe-winning films. Italian pianist and composer Ludovico Einaudi is returning to Wellington with a new album to explore with audiences. The Michael Fowler Centre will be filled with Ludovico’s special mix of neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock, and experimental styles. His modern soundscapes are renowned for being able to cross artistic and generational boundaries. Because of this, he has become one of the world’s most-streamed classical music artists. 
Ludovico began composing in the 1980s for theatre and ballet. He has since gone on to write for film and television and produce multi-million-selling albums. His most recent is ‘The Summer Portraits’. Written in 2025, it is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer, and family holidays. Here, he returns to the lush full-band textures of earlier works. You’ll get to hear this first-hand, so don’t miss your chance.

events.id: LAMMAS FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: LAMMAS FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
LAMMAS FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
Come and Sing, Sound and Meditate!

Want to mark the important time of the JANUARY/ fEBRUARY LAMMAS full moon? Lammas is the Celtic festival of the first Harvest.

Come and join with us on Sunday the 1st February for a group ceremonial gathering in Paraparaumu.

We will explore sacred conscious sounding practices to balance and align the energy system, sing healing chants and songs from different traditions, and explore guided vocal improvisation for freedom, upliftment and joy!

Ceremonial cacao will be served with focus and healing intention.

There will be guided journal prompts around the energy of the Solstice and the whole session will finish with a full sound healing.

Everyone is welcome and there is no need for any particular preparation or pre existing skill.

Please get in touch with any questions or to book. Come and enjoy Song, Chant, Sound and Healing!!

So looking forward to gathering for the Lammas Full Moon. Come and join with us to invoke and celebrate the energies of balance, creation, abundance and celebration at this profound time of year.

This session will explore singing, chanting, sounding and conscious voice empowerment practices. We will also explore energy practices like Qigong and meditation. All within a ceremonial framework.

Everyone is welcome. Limited spaces. Get in touch soon

You are warmly invited to book to join this powerful sound and voice ceremony which will work with Spirit, the forces of Nature and Bryony's skill and expertise in creating sound for growth and transformation.

This is a special opportunity to tune into the sacred energies and potentialities of this time: opening us up to balance, healing, nourishment, new growth and positive change.

Bryony will invoke and work with the healing power of the supportive energies of Spirit, ancestors and our highest Selves. Bryony's has an extensive background experience with Spirit, the Earth forces and sacred lands; these forces are central to her practice and Self.

She will lead you firstly in a process of meditation, conscious sounding, toning and singing healing chants.

This use of our voices to co-create a sacred group sound is uplifting and transformative and will support you in your process of healing, releasing and visioning.

There will be time for guided journaling and intention setting.

The second section of the workshop will be a focused and dedicated sound bath which will bring balance and deep relaxation, into a sense of stillness and peace. There can be a sense of gratitude and appreciation.

Both the conscious use of the voice and the sound healing have many benefits, which are verified by science and which can effect us positively on the physical, mental, emotional, energetic and spiritual levels. A document which has more information about these benefits can be provided on request.

All are welcome:
I look forward to sharing with you and supporting you in this ceremony.

Investment for full 2.5 hours

$77 - full price - https://buy.stripe.com/bIY9Ep67A00xdwYcND

$59 - concession - https://buy.stripe.com/8wMaItcvY6oV0Kc7ti

Please contact me if finances are a challenge for you and we can make it work for you to join.

events.id: River City Express-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: River City Express
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Travel to the beautiful riverside town of Whanganui, hauled by both steam locomotive Ab 608 and heritage diesel electric locomotive Da 1410. Choose between doing your own thing or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River on board the coal-fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".

Leaving Kapiti, as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua. After a stop in Palmerston North, we head up the trunk through the townships of Feilding and Marton before turning onto the Marton - New Plymouth railway line for the last stretch into Whanganui. After crossing the 290km long Whanganui River, we proceed slowly down the short 5km branch line taking us to Taupo Quay.

From here, it's up to you what you wish to do!

- Sail On The Queen Of The River - Waimarie
This option includes a river cruise aboard the coal-fired paddle steamer Waimarie, restored after around 50 years submerged. The cruise features commentary on Whanganui’s river history, and you can view the boiler and possibly send a message via homing pigeon. The fare covers return train travel, bus transfers, and the cruise.

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $209
Child 2-12yrs - $179

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $189
Child 2-12yrs - $169

An Artisan Lunch for Two - $35 add-on

OR

- Do Your Own Thing & Explore Whanganui
You’ll be transferred by bus to the Riverboat Centre and can explore Whanganui on foot or by hiring a vintage cruiser bike. Attractions include the Durie Hill Elevator, Riverboat Museum, NZ Glassworks, Motua Gardens, and local shops and eateries. A tram ride is also available for a small fee. This option includes train fare and bus transfers.

Fares
Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Feilding
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

-Evening Meal
Sandy and the team at the Station Hotel will be on hand to provide an evening meal at your seat on departure from Marton.
Being served is a tasty chicken salad main, a freshly baked mini baguette, along with a sweet chocolate brownie to cleanse the palate!
Vegans, Vegetarians and gluten-free options available, and if there are any allergies, please let us know when booking!
$30 per person to add this to your booking.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Introductory Tour (Feb 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Introductory Tour (Feb 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Introductory Tour. 
This tour outlines the development of Karori Cemetery since the first burial in August 1891, traversing the earliest burial areas which contain many interesting memorials and monuments. 
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 45 minutes to one hour long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre-Michael Fowler Centre-All Events In
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre
events.long_description:
Ludovico Einaudi | Wellington - Michael Fowler Centre
Ludovico Einaudi
Sunday 1 February 2026
Michael Fowler Centre

The world’s most popular classical music composer, Italian pianist, Ludovico Einaudi, returns to Australia and New Zealand this January with his new album The Summer Portraits.

He has performed on an Arctic ice-floe for Greenpeace and has seen his music become the soundtrack for Oscar and Golden Globe winning films ('Les Intouchables', 'Nomadland', 'The Father') and TikTok phenomena (his 2012 track 'Experience' exploded on the app) alike. From his earliest work composing for theatre and ballet in the 1980s to his multi-million-selling albums like 'In a Time Lapse' and his popular soundtracks across film and television, Einaudi has drawn upon neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock and experimental styles to create a sound that crosses boundaries and generations, becoming the world’s best known – and most streamed – classical music artist in the process.

In January 2025, Einaudi released 'The Summer Portraits'. The record is a lush return to full-band textures and is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer and family holidays. On his last Australian tour, before a gig at the Sydney Opera House, Einaudi sat down and started composing the single 'Rose Bay', based on his sense impressions of the bay his grandfather made home.

Don’t miss your chance to experience the world’s most popular contemporary classical artist.

He has performed on an Arctic ice-floe for Greenpeace and has seen his music become the soundtrack for Oscar and Golden Globe winning films ('Les Intouchables', 'Nomadland', 'The Father') and TikTok phenomena (his 2012 track 'Experience' exploded on the app) alike.

events.id: Workshop: Wh`ānau Cyanotype with artist Claudia Jowitt-The Dowse Art Museum,45 Laings Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Workshop: Wh`ānau Cyanotype with artist Claudia Jowitt
events.venue: The Dowse Art Museum,45 Laings Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Workshop: Wh`ānau Cyanotype with artist Claudia Jowitt
Join us for a relaxed, whānau-friendly cyanotype / printing workshop led by exhibiting artist Claudia Jowitt.

About this Event

Join us for a relaxed, whānau-friendly cyanotype / printing workshop led by exhibiting artist Claudia Jowitt.
Inspired by her exhibition Uana / Carried by the Waves, this hands-on session invites tamariki and adults to play with light, water, and natural materials while learning the simple, magical process of cyanotype printing.
Cyanotype is a sunlight-based printing technique that produces striking blue images. With Claudia’s guidance, you’ll arrange flowers, leaves and other natural shapes—echoing the motifs that flow through Uana — and watch your prints develop before your eyes
.Open to all ages and experience levels, this workshop is a fun, creative moment for the whole whānau. Claudia will also share insights into her practice and the ideas behind Uana / Carried by the Waves, giving you the chance to learn directly from the artist while making your own take-home artwork.

events.id: Georgina Beyer - Diamonds are Forever Walk Tour-St Peter's on Willis, 211 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Georgina Beyer - Diamonds are Forever Walk Tour
events.venue: St Peter's on Willis, 211 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
In 2004, Georgina Beyer, the first openly transgender Member of Parliament in the world, famously confronted members of Destiny Church during the Enough Is Enough rally on the grounds of Parliament.

Never a bystander, Georgina faced down the bigots, telling them straight, “Your hatred is totally intolerable!” This was just one of many significant moments that shaped the life of the extraordinary Georgina Beyer.

Born in Wellington, Georgina went on to have an unprecedented local, national and international impact through her commitment to equality and her desire to give everyone the opportunity to reach their full potential in society.

Join us for this special 90-minute walking tour as we pay tribute to the late Georgina (1957–2023) by visiting locations around central Wellington that shaped her journey. Along the way, we’ll honour some of her heroes and listen to first-hand archival audio clips that showcase her humour and resilience.

Georgina’s story is defiantly optimistic – confronting hardship and using her lived experience to change the world for the better.

Accessibility information: the tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to approximately 20 walkers.

Time/Date: 1pm, Sunday 1 February 2026
Starts: meet outside St Peters Church, 211 Willis Street
Ends: Vivian Street
Duration: 90 minutes
Cost / Bookings: the tour is free but you do need to register

PLEASE REGISTER AT http://book.walktours.nz/
(if there are no registrations the tour won't go ahead)

Image courtesy of the amazing Kym Strathdee

events.id: Saving the Hutt’s Public Art Heritage-The Dowse Art Museum,45 Laings Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Saving the Hutt’s Public Art Heritage
events.venue: The Dowse Art Museum,45 Laings Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Saving the Hutt’s Public Art Heritage
Public artworks hold stories of place, identity and change. How do we protect and share our heritage?

About this Event

Public artworks are more than simple decoration. They hold stories of place, identity and change. When the spaces around them shift, those stories can be at risk. Who carries responsibility for protecting heritage works, and how do we ensure they remain part of our shared future?
The early spark for The Wheel of Avalon began when artist Bronwyn Holloway-Smith was invited to Avalon TV Studios in her role as Co-Director of Public Art Heritage Aotearoa New Zealand. There, viewing Bill McCardle’s mosaic mural, she reflected: “The story of the mural feels like a metaphor for the rise and fall of Avalon Studios.”
Join Holloway-Smith for an engaging and thought-provoking talk exploring this work alongside a Guy Ngan mural in Naenae and a piece by E. Mervyn Taylor in Taita. Together, these three recent projects reveal different approaches to safeguarding the Hutt’s public art heritage and open a conversation about what proactive, future-focused care and preservation of public art could look like in the years ahead.

Dr Bronwyn Holloway-Smith (Pākehā) is an award-winning conceptual artist, author, and researcher. Her interdisciplinary practice spans public art, digital media and deep-dive research, often focused on the tangled legacies of cultural memory, Pākehā identity, and the politics of preservation. She lives on Pōneke's rugged south coast with her partner and their three offspring.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This class is for level 2+ and advanced students. It is not open to beginners.

Students must have completed an 8-week block with ring-making and bezel settings or equivalent. If you have not done one of our 8-week beginner’s classes or are unsure of your level because you may have done a few different shorter classes, please contact us, and we can advise you.

This more advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing and basic tool use on their own.

A more advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you and the group to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects for you and for the class as a whole. Each 8-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than doing loads of different topics with each student over the block. This means the students will benefit from a more in-depth learning experience, supported practice and peer support from fellow students.

Level 2 students learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something to hone their skills that they are familiar with, as well as take on a new skill. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple projects they can work on self-directed in class: more chains or simple bezel settings are ideal - to help them strengthen their soldering skills - alongside a challenge project that might be a shelf setting (an adaptation of a bezel setting that can take faceted stones), a tube setting or a larger bezel setting for a box or brooch.

This class fee does NOT include materials for any student.

All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects!

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A-60 Dixon St, 6011,60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, 6011,60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners block A
Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular

..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Viradinha
Week 4: Piao
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukFunA
Location:
Classes are on the First Floor - FootNote Dance Studio, 60 Dixon Street

events.id: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026-Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026
events.venue: Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora!
Electricity and electrification are seen as the significant enablers for decarbonisation of our nation. The Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) | Te Whatunga Hiko programme aspires to meet the challenges the electrical power system will face as we journey towards sustainable decarbonisation.
Our vision is to provide an infrastructure paradigm through a hybrid AC/DC transmission and distribution system that meets the needs of tomorrow’s efficient, low-carbon, reliable and resilient electrical power system.
Funded as part of the New Zealand Government’s Strategic Science Investment Fund (SSIF) on Advanced Energy Technology Platform (AETP), the research team is investigating what the future electrical power system might look like.
Hear about the team’s latest achievements as we approach the final phase of the programme.
Attendance is in person at Victoria University Wellington.
Ngā mihi nui,
Prof. Neville Watson,
Science Leader
The detailed programme will be circulated closer to the event.
 More information on the research can be found at https://www.fan.ac.nz/
If you have any questions, please contact futurearchitecturenetwork@canterbury.ac.nz

events.id: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks for Beginners-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks for Beginners
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This class is beginner level only, with each student following the class project.

Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.

The stone-setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!

We start with basic ring-making and stone-setting in copper or brass. Students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.

Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a Cabochon stone (a cabochon has a flat bottom and a smooth, domed top) in a Bezel Setting.

As you work through your practice ring and setting, you can move on to working in silver and produce another ring with a cabochon stone that you really love. This way, you will learn the basics as you go on your practice ring, before taking the next step in costly silver.

This class has all materials included in the class fee!

Each student receives a carefully curated materials pack including copper or brass, sterling and fine silver for your ring-making projects, as well as two stones from our supply so you get a good stone for your level of experience.

We have loads of gorgeous stones of a range of colours, and they are all appropriate for beginner settings.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: Book Group: The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoevsky-The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Book Group: The Idiot by Fyodor Dostoevsky
events.venue: The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Club, we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

We return to Russia for our long summer read! The group's first-ever summer book was Anna Karenina, and we read Dostoevsky's The Brothers Karamazov over the 2018/19 summer. (We were also due to discuss his novel Crime and Punishment, but that was set down for April 2020 and, well, the world had other plans…)

This year, we read another of Fyodor Dostoevsky's masterworks: The Idiot, which was initially published as a serial in 1868-1869. Dostoevsky scholar Joseph Frank said The Idiot "is the most personal of all his major works, the book in which he embodies his most intimate, cherished, and sacred convictions."

The story revolves around Prince Lef Nicolaievitch Muishkin, a young man returning to Russia after spending several years in a Swiss sanatorium for epilepsy. Dostoevsky had set out to create a protagonist with "a truly beautiful soul" and to trace the fate of such an individual as he comes into contact with the brutal reality of contemporary society.

RSVP
If you use Facebook, you can RSVP to the event on our Facebook page (above) - it really helps us keep track of numbers. Otherwise, just come along...

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

ABOUT US
Wellington Classic Literature Club has been running for more than a decade - since the start of 2013 - and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers who come along for particular books or simply when it suits. All welcome.

events.id: Malcolm Todd tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Malcolm Todd tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

events.venue: 166 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.

events.id: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A fantastic course that's full of fun and inspiration!

It starts on Wed 4 February and runs for 6 weeks till Wed 11 March, 5.30pm - 8pm.

Create interesting designs in wax, then send them off to be professionally cast in metal. Once your pieces are back, you will be taught how to cut, file and shape them into wearable pieces.

Level 1 students: Learn to work in both soft and hard jewellers' wax and send your waxes away to be cast. When they return, you will learn how to clean them up into finished jewellery and/or incorporate them into jewellery in multiple ways. We start with rings, but encourage students to think outside the box!

Level 2 students: Advance your carving skills and learn to set stones in your waxes. This can be done either by creating claws and other settings or trying the cast-in-place technique - an organic, exciting process.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs, which vary from student to student depending on what they want to make. Small castings can cost around $7 - $10, and metals are between $0.35 per gram for bronze - $4 per gram for silver. Please see details on our Regular Classes page.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or Afterpay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.

events.id: Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae -San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Our penultimate night features two of Pōneke’s finest songwriters from two separate sonic worlds… their combination is sure to be a treat!

Sam Fowles makes music that moves the body, speaks to the heart, and touches the soul. Driven by groove and the desire to find meaning in the moments on this journey we call life, the musician, songwriter and producer has a signature sound that stands out and stuns. Fowles would describe his music as psychedelic soul laced with blues and funk. It resonates with deep grooves and driving rhythms created by vintage drum sounds, digital sonics, and electric guitars that build and blaze into billowing soundscapes. At its core is his unique, soulful voice and the punchy, heartfelt lyrics he wears on his sleeve.

Elly Mae crafts songs that encapsulate the bittersweet ache of growth, the quiet unraveling of time, and the soft glow of nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, indie, shoegaze, and anything in between. From lullabies that make you feel weightless to being wrapped in a blanket of sound, Elly Mae's folk/country melodic guitar style is accompanied by experimental, spatial bass from Arran Cargill-Brown and textured pocket drumming from Sasha Francis-Murray. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.name: Richter City Rebels - Blenheim
events.venue: 5 Tenth Lane, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Richter City Rebels have a sound that blends RnB, soul, hip-hop, jazz and funk with the heart and soul of New Orleans brass band music. Trumpets, trombones, saxes, sousaphone, and percussion bring the ultimate Mardi Gras party to any venue or festival. Incorporating stylish original melodies and shouts, funked-up pop tunes and bouncing hip-hop, the Rebels’ sound embodies the musical melting pot of Louisiana.
Energy, entertainment, and musicianship of the highest quality: the Richter City Rebels guarantee a rousing New Orleans experience.

events.id: The Park Hotel Reading Band-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: The Park Hotel Reading Band
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
The Park Hotel Reading Band brings the vibrant energy of big band jazz to life! Formed as a space for musicians to explore and perform new big band charts, the group has been meeting every week for the past year to do exactly that — keeping the spirit of live big band music alive and thriving in Pōneke.

Join us for an evening celebrating the rich tradition of big band jazz, featuring music from legends like Thad Jones and Count Basie to modern masters such as Maria Schneider and Jacob Mann.

Come experience the power, swing, and excitement of big band music — past and present — performed by the Park Hotel Reading Band.

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

events.long_description:
FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT

WINDOW KID — LIVE AT MEOW

Waitangi Weekend Thursday · February 5

This Waitangi Weekend Thursday, WINDOW KID brings his unmistakable UK bass energy to Meow for a high-pressure night of fast mixing, heavy sound system culture, and elite mic control.

An award-winning UK MC, Window Kid has earned wide recognition for his technical delivery, timing, and ability to elevate a dancefloor. His sound is rooted in drum & bass, jungle, bassline, grime, and UK garage, with sets that move fluidly across tempos while staying locked to the energy of the room.

Expect rolling low-end, sharp transitions, and a set that feels driven, dynamic, and fully engaged with the crowd from start to finish.

SUPPORT LINEUP

A stacked local lineup bringing the heat all night featuring:
RONI V B2B SNB DON
BVRBWYRE
OFFGRID
YOUNG GHOST
GEO WREN
FRONTA B2B KAMEANO

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

Meow, Wellington

CLUBS NZ @ TAUHERENIKAU
Join us for the upcoming Clubs NZ @ Tauherenikau Race Day on Waitangi Day – February 6th, 2026.
It’s a fantastic opportunity for clubs from around the lower North Island to come together and experience the excitement of the races in the heart of sunny Wairarapa!

Here’s what you can look forward to on this fun-filled day:
Delicious BBQ Lunch: Enjoy a mouth-watering BBQ lunch combined with a combination of liquid refreshments.
Sweeps: Take part in our exciting sweeps for a chance to win big.
Interclub Punting Competition: Put your racing knowledge to the test and compete against other clubs for bragging rights.
Fashion on the Field: Show off your style and join our fashion competition! Prizes await the best-dressed male, female, and the most fabulous hat.

So, gather your friends, don your finest race-day attire, and join us at Tauherenikau Racecourse on February 6th, 2026.
It’s going to be a day filled with excitement and entertainment, as we celebrate Waitangi Day in style.

Book your spot today! $50 without bus or $60 with bus

Don’t miss out on this fantastic event – See you at the races!

events.id: Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa-Tawa Community Centre,5 Cambridge St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa
events.venue: Tawa Community Centre,5 Cambridge St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me– He Māori by Īhaka Martyn in Tawa
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn

Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, with a free travelling Theatre Roadshow, He Māori by Īhaka Martyn.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians again. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

📍Tawa Community Centre, 10am – 11.30am: https://events.humanitix.com/tawa-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍Khandallah Community Centre, 1.30pm – 3pm: https://events.humanitix.com/khandallah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍The Hannah Playhouse, 4pm – 5.30pm: https://events.humanitix.com/the-hannah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

About He Māori:
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

events.name: Waitangi Day - Parent & Child Tournament
events.venue: 55 Delhi Crescent, New Zealand 6035,55 Delhi Cres, Khandallah, Wellington 6035, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Waitangi Day - Parent & Child Tournament
🎾 Ready for some Waitangi Day fun?

Our much-loved Parent–Child Tournament is back on Friday 6 February, and we’d love to see you on court! This is one of the happiest days of the year at KTSC — a relaxed, family-friendly tournament where it’s all about teamwork, laughs, and making memories. And when we say “parent–child,” we mean it broadly… parents, grandparents, aunties, uncles, older siblings, caregivers — all welcome! 💙

✨ Entry is just $15 per pair
✨ Please bring a plate to share for our communal morning tea/lunch
✨ All ages and abilities welcome

Grab your favourite little (or big!) person, dust off the racquets, and get your entry in.

Enter now and be part of a special KTSC Waitangi Day tradition! 🎉
🎟️ Don’t miss this unforgettable day—register now!
👉 https://www.ktsc.org.nz/waitangidaytournament

We can’t wait to see you on the courts! 🏅💚
events.description:
Our much-loved Parent–Child Tournament is back on Friday 6 February, and we’d love to see you on court!
And when we say “parent–child,” we mean it broadly… parents, grandparents, aunties, uncles, older siblings, caregivers — all welcome!
💙 ✨ Entry is just $15 per pair ✨ Please bring a plate to share for our communal morning tea/lunch ✨ All ages and abilities welcome Grab your favourite little (or big!)
person, dust off the racquets, and get your entry in.
Enter now and be part of a special KTSC Waitangi Day tradition!

events.id: Jim Jefferies – Son of a Carpenter-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Jim Jefferies – Son of a Carpenter
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
He never fails to light up a crowd with his provocative and biting observations.
Australian actor and comic Jim Jefferies is heading to Wellington.
His new show, Son of a Carpenter, is further proof that he is one of the most electrifying comedy stars on the scene.
He is known for his ability to push boundaries with incisive and intelligent insights.
The Times UK says his act “… increasingly finds a beautiful balance between the jagged and the shrewd, the vicious, and the vulnerable.” Jim is one of the most popular and respected comedians of his generation.

events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi is a free, whānau -friendly event to commemorate the signing of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and Aotearoa New Zealand’s national day. Kicking off at midday in Waitangi Park, you'll find the main stage programme packed with local talent. Enjoy live music, dance, and cultural performances. Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll also find a selection of delicious kai , stalls, a Kids’ Zone, a treaty education space, and much more. 
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all — where is the place you lay down your roots? Where is your family from? In 2026, Waitangi Day celebrates the things that we all share and the things that make us different.

events.id: FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua-Te Rauparaha Park,Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua
events.venue: Te Rauparaha Park,Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
FREE ENTRY: Waitangi Day in Porirua
FREE ENTRY:

We are glad to partner with mana whenua Ngāti Toa once again to deliver a fun-filled Waitangi Day event in Porirua, one of the largest Waitangi Day events to take place in New Zealand on our national day.

❤️ Waka tours are on once more!
🎤 Live music at Te Rauparaha Park
🥗 Food trucks will line Norrie Streets
😜 Fun for tamariki and rangatahi

Parking 🚙
Parking will be available on surrounding streets such as Wi Neera Drive or you can leave your car at the railway station and take the short walk to Te Rauparaha Park.

Cash 💳
It’s best to bring cash on the day as not all vendors will have eftpos available, although there are nearby ATMs on Lyttelton Avenue if you wish to top up.

The event will be alcohol-free, smoke/vape-free and there will be no dogs allowed.

events.id: Te Rā o Waitangi 2026-Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Te Rā o Waitangi 2026
events.venue: Waitangi Park,24A Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Rā o Waitangi 2026
Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, Wellington City Council’s free annual Waitangi Day event ❤️🖤

Te Rā o Waitangi 2026 acknowledges tūrangawaewae and whakapapa for all!

Bring your friends and whānau to Waitangi Park from 12 noon to 6pm on Friday 6 February for live music, kai, activities celebrating Māori culture, and the spirit of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.

He aha kei te haere? What to expect:

✨ Live performances showcasing tangata whenua and tangata tiriti talent

✨ Multicultural food stalls and a fundraiser hāngi from midday (get in quick!)

✨ Arts, crafts, and family-friendly activities, including taonga tākaro Māori

✨Pacific Media Networks 531pi audience stage activations

✨ Stunning stage artwork created at the 2024 event by artists Keri-Mei Zagrobelna and Tina Rae Carter

✨ A Treaty Education Tent to learn, reflect, and connect

Gather your whānau and join us to honour our past, celebrate our present, and dream of our future together.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we’re excited to bring the free theatre roadshow ‘He Māori?’ by Īhaka Martyn and Taki Rua Productions, this Waitangi Day. Catch a performance at one of three locations:
🕙 10am–11.30am: Tawa Community Centre
🕜 1.30pm–3pm: Khandallah Community Centre
🕓 4pm–5.30pm: The Hannah Playhouse

All shows are free, but bookings are required.

For more information, the Te Rā o Waitangi Day programme and booking information: https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/waitangi-day

Our Te Rā o Waitangi event is made possible by many, and we acknowledge our Tākai Here partners: Te Rūnanga O Toa Rangatira, Taranaki Whānui ki Te Upoko o te Ika and Te Rūnanganui o Te Āti Awa ki te Upoko o Te Ika a Māui.

events.id: Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn at The Hannah-Hannah Playhouse,12 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn at The Hannah
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse,12 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn at The Hannah
Te Tiriti and Me – He Māori by Īhaka Martyn

Nau mai, haere mai! Join us to celebrate Te Rā o Waitangi 2026, with a free travelling Theatre Roadshow, He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn.

Alongside our Te Rā o Waitangi event, we are bringing Te Tiriti and Me back to Wellingtonians again. Last year saw a travelling forum series, and this year we welcome the free Theatre Roadshow 'He Māori?' by Īhaka Martyn, which is touring three locations on Waitangi Day:

📍Tawa Community Centre, 10am – 11.30am: https://events.humanitix.com/tawa-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍Khandallah Community Centre, 1.30pm – 3pm: https://events.humanitix.com/khandallah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

📍The Hannah Playhouse, 4pm – 5.30pm: https://events.humanitix.com/the-hannah-te-tiriti-and-me-2026-taki-rua-and-wcc-present-he-maori

About He Māori:
Is 1/16th enough? Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata, and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. A 60 minute journey from total confusion to partial understanding. He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends.

He Māori? by Īhaka Martyn is presented in partnership with Taki Rua Productions and is suitable for all ages. There will be a Q&A session after each performance.

events.id: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox-34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
Join the Mystic Muses, award-winning singer/songwriters Melissa Cox (NZ/USA) and Celia Farran (USA) for an unforgettable show featuring Celtic music of the past, present, and future - Enya, Sinead O'Connor, The Cranberries, Loreena McKennitt, traditional tunes, lore & legends, sea shanties, and haunting original songs by Melissa and Celia.

-- Meet the Muses --

MELISSA COX: Multi-instrumentalist and award-winning songwriter Melissa Cox conjures a one-woman storm of Celtic tradition, tribal beats, and celestial synths to create an ethereal, danceable Elvish EDM dream. Using her looping pedal, she layers tin whistle, electric mandolin, piano, synths, drum beats, and her haunting voice to create performances reminiscent of Enigma, Enya, and Loreena McKennitt. A seasoned touring artist and classically trained vocalist, she pushes Celtic and World music into the 21st century with raw energy and fearless, honest lyrics. http://www.melcoxmusic.com

CELIA FARRAN: “A cross between an Earthy Enya, Joan Baez, and Tina Fey.” She dishes up the most delicious concoction of the silly and sacred, delighting audiences across the globe. With rusty red locks and twinkling eyes, she casts a spell of enchantment upon her listeners, bringing deep and resonating experiences to audiences across the globe. With powerful, heart-felt vocals and wacky comedic improvisations, the audience never knows what will happen with Celia on stage. http://www.celiafarran.com

events.id: TAWA Te Tiriti and Me 2026 - Taki Rua and WCC Present: He Māori?-5 Cambridge Street, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: TAWA Te Tiriti and Me 2026 - Taki Rua and WCC Present: He Māori?
events.venue: 5 Cambridge Street, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Tiriti and Me 
Wellingtonians talk about what Whakapapa and The Treaty of Waitangi means to them. 
What is it? 
After the successful delivery of Te Tiriti and Me on Waitangi Day this year, we are bringing the roadshow back! In 2026, we’re changing things up to a touring theatre show which has been designed to be presented in schools and community spaces: 
Taki Rua Productions and Īhaka Martyn present: He Māori? 
Īhaka Martyn will have you laughing and crying as he weaves elements of stand-up comedy, waiata and physical performance to explore the confusion, comedy and celebration of reclaiming his Māoritanga from a Pākehā upbringing. It is a journey from total confusion to partial understanding. 
He aha? He Māori? Is he? Maybe - it depends 
He Māori is a 60 minute performance with a short Q+A session afterwards. Suitable for all ages. 
All sessions are free, but require bookings due to venue capacities.
When is it? 
Thursday 6 February 2025 – Waitangi Day. You are warmly invited to join us for a free presentation of He Māori? Followed by a short Q+A. 
Te Tiriti and Me is part of WCC’s Te Rā o Waitangi celebrations.  Full community centre timetable below: 
10.00 - 11.30am  
SESSION #1 - Tawa Community Centre  
  1.30 - 3.00pm  
SESSION #2 - Khandallah Community Centre  
  4.00 - 5.30pm  
SESSION #3 – The Hannah Playhouse

events.id: DESSERT FIRST - petit dessert degustation-Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: DESSERT FIRST - petit dessert degustation
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
DESSERT FIRST
A Valentine’s Petit Dessert Degustation

A refined five-course dessert experience exploring balance, texture, and emotion — designed to be indulged and savoured.

The Tease

Strawberry · rose · lychee · almond tuile taco
A crisp almond tuile shell filled with strawberry and rose crémeux, layered with fresh lychee. Light, fragrant, and delicately structured.

The Crush

Chocolate lava cake · molten centre · vanilla cream
A warm petite chocolate lava cake with a flowing dark chocolate centre, balanced with soft vanilla cream.

The Slow Burn

Chai-spiced custard tart · brûléed sugar
A refined tart with silky chai-infused custard and a thin crack of caramelised sugar.

The Chaos

Raspberry · mandarin · white chocolate mille-feuille
Crisp pastry layers with white chocolate cream, sharp raspberry, and bright mandarin — structured, vibrant, and playful.

The Afterglow

Petite madeleine · honey butter · milk chocolate
A warm madeleine served with whipped honey butter and smooth milk chocolate. Soft, comforting, and nostalgic.

Optional Pairings
3-course dessert wine pairing — $28
3-course tea pairing — $15

events.long_description:
Brazza is Brazilian goodness on the dance floor at our favourite Wellington venue.

Join us at Rouge and Vagabundo to incinerate the darkness and boogie the night away.

A fusion of Brazilian Funk, famous classic tunes and original music that is sure to raise up the cold winter vibes.

Check out Abe the Babe in the kitchen, Blyn Blan Bliet and (Santo) Nicolau on wind, Frechie Fe on guitar, Pedro on bass, Fab directing traffic and Marcel keeping the pace up.

But let’s be honest, the beer is also stellar! We love Rogue!

Music from 9:30

FREE ENTRY

🌿 ReConnected Foundations Workshop (10:00am - 2:00pm): Meditation, breathwork, and sound healing.
.
.
𝗛𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲'𝘀 𝘂𝗻𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻𝘀 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗼𝗳𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝘁𝗵?
𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽?

Life throws us surprises - big or small. You're not alone. We've been there too.
That's why we created this one-day experience - a chance for us all to reconnect with the paths that matter most to us!

Get ready for an inspiring experience with like-minded friends as we lead you toward discovering new clarity about yourself and your direction moving forward.

Don't wait any longer; start taking control now by saying yes to this extraordinary opportunity!

We’re bringing a one-day immersion of profound inner work to BULLS.

On Saturday, February 7th, at Te Matapihi Town Hall, 4 Criterion Street, Bulls 4818, New Zealand, we invite you to experience a powerful session designed to awaken, clear, and elevate your energy. Choose to embrace a deeper, more transformative journey. ❤️

This is a Foundations Workshop, a session designed to clear mental fog, restore balance, and ignite your inner spark through breathwork, meditation, and sound healing. 🧘‍♀️

All our previous events have sold out, so be sure to secure your spot early.

Love and gratitude,
Matt & Guy

events.long_description:
Hoe Down
Two massive days of historic cars at Harrisville!
While you are in town for the Teams Champs make sure you head out to NZ's best privately owned track!
Watch the historic cars and bikes hit the dirt and do some laps!
ALL Vintage open wheel - Saloon cars, sprint cars, Stock cars, TQs, Midgets, Modifieds, side cars and solo bikes.
Saturday and Sunday racing starts from 11:000am and finishes about 3:00pm. Prize giving to follow on Sunday.
Harrisville Speedway merchandise will be for sale, food trucks, coffee and cold drinks on site.
Spectators are welcome, entry is a gold coin per person.
To enter your car PM Harrisville Speedway with your name, class, car number and cell phone number.
$100 per car to enter for both days, extra drivers $30.00 per day.
Camping available $10 per person per night. You must register at the Saloon prior to setting up or you may be asked to move.
NO DOGS

events.id: UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
UNLEASH THE VOICES OF YOUR SUN AND MOON
Book Soon for this special day workshop and explore and unleash the power of your Voice and Astrological Archetypes!!

We are blessed that Alignment Coach and Healer, Clare Babbage is visiting the Wellington Region from Napier, and collaborating with Voice Empowerment Coach and Healer, Bryony Rogers from Heartsong Healing, in this exciting, unique offering.

This workshop is a specially designed, transformative full day experience of Embodied Astrological Archetypes and Conscious Sound and Voice Practices.

BOOK HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

On the date of the full moon, the energies of the sun and the moon stand face to face — illuminating both our outer expression and our inner world.

In astrology, the sun represents our fullest expression, our vitality, and the way we are here to shine. The moon reveals our emotional landscape, our inner rhythms, and often the fears that arise when we dare to live that full expression. Together, they form a powerful dialogue between structure and flow, logic and emotion, masculine and feminine.

In this workshop, Clare will guide you into an embodied exploration of your own sun and moon, inviting you to feel these two archetypes within your body and notice where they support, resist, or balance each other.

Bryony will lead you into vocal practices that bring these energies into sound and voice — giving expression to what is often left unspoken. Through voice, you’ll release what holds you back and discover new harmony between your inner and outer selves.

This full moon is the perfect moment to unleash the voices of your sun and moon — and to step more fully into clarity, balance, and authentic expression.

The timing of this workshop gives you a unique opportunity to tune into these planets and benefit from their placement in the collective astrology.

The workshop will begin with the opportunity to explore powerful, enjoyable, accessible Voice Practices which open, align and strengthen your expression - and create physiological changes in your energy field.

We will then directly, bodily experience the energies of each of the Celestial Bodies through Embodied Astrology, guided by Clare.

We will integrate these energies, through further Voice Practices, including improvisation, healing chants and songs.

These two modalities will be carefully interwoven in an enjoyable, rich day's workshop that will benefit all participants.

There will be guided space in the workshop to integrate the energetic shifts and discoveries of both the Voice Practices and the Astrology.

This special workshop takes place on Saturday February 7th, 10am-4.30pm - we hope you can join us

At the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Paraparaumu.

INVESTMENT:

Your investment for this day is $233. Shared lunch.
Some concessions are available - please contact us by email .

Payment by card here - https://buy.stripe.com/aEU3g1gMecNj2SkbJI

Please contact us with any questions at all.

events.id: Danny Bhoy-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Danny Bhoy
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Danny Bhoy, New Zealand’s favourite Scottish comedian, is returning to The Opera House with his new show ‘Dear World’. His easy-going and intimate style of comedy brings banter and anecdotes that are sure to make you cackle. In ‘Dear World,’ Danny brings a thespian flair to the stage. “This is the sequel to my 2015 show ‘Dear Epson…’ My favourite ever show. It’s a hybrid of stand-up and theatre, but really that just means I get to sit down for bits of it.” 
Danny has been honing his craft and touring the world for over 25 years. Having built an impressive following in Australia, Canada and New Zealand, he knows his audience well and never shies away from playfully picking them apart. Described by The Montreal Gazette as “One of the most sparkling wits in the world,” and by The Age as having “unsurpassed storytelling”. This one-night-only show is sure to be one to remember.

events.id: Wellington Pasifika Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Pasifika Festival
events.long_description:
Experience the sights, sounds, and flavours of the Pacific. With over 15,000 people attending each year, the Wellington Pasifika Festival is a standout event for the regional and national calendar. This free, family-friendly festival celebrates the unique Pacific communities here in Wellington. There will be a special opening ceremony at midday, followed by live music and performances. Dotted around Waitangi Park, you’ll find stalls, a Kids’ Zone, stone carving, workshops, and plenty of delicious food. 
The younger ones can pick up a festival passport from the Kids’ Zone and collect stamps to win special prizes. Enjoy a festival experience based on the card game ‘Lalaga’, designed by Torisse Lalau, which uses Pasifika wisdom (talanoa) to foster empathy and connection through sharing stories. 
The theme for 2026 is ‘Arrival’ — a celebration of and a welcome to the Pasifika communities who have made New Zealand their home. Grab your friends and whanau and come along to soak up the island vibes and cultural celebrations.
