“I should have been clearer that I’m absolutely against Trumpism,” he says.

events.id: Aled Jones - My Story, My Songs tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Aled Jones - My Story, My Songs tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: TEG Live
The My Story, My Songs tour takes Aled Jones on a regional journey across Australia and New Zealand, bringing fans a rare chance to get up close and personal with one of the country’s most loved performers.
A witty raconteur, Aled also performs the hits from his extraordinary career, and a self-penned track from his Number One album Full Circle.
“The response to my most personal tour yet has been incredible. I have absolutely loved sharing some of my most special untold stories and personal photographs.”
“From growing up in Bangor and becoming the world’s most famous choir boy through to present day, as host of Songs of Praise, and appearing on Strictly Come Dancing and The Masked Singer, I’ve loved sharing my journey.
“It’s been wonderful to meet my fans, a golden opportunity to get up close and personal in some of the country’s most beautiful, intimate venues.”
Aled was the boy treble who captivated the world with his angelic voice, most notably voicing the score to Raymond Briggs’s The Snowman. Selling more than seven million albums, he’s equally at home on the classical stage, or starring in musical theatre productions in London West End, his credits include lead roles in Joseph and the Amazing Technicolour Dreamcoat, Chitty Chitty Bang Bang and Irving Berlin’s White Christmas.

events.name: R Exchange 2026
events.venue: 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Established in 2020, R Exchange provides a regional opportunity for open-source data science enthusiasts from New Zealand and Australia to connect and learn from each other about how to make the most out of R and Python in your organisation and projects – from research to corporate to public sector.
If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us  events@epi.group and keep up-to-date on the latest announcements via LinkedIn and our newsletter.
Our call for speakers is open!
Submit a talk to share your experience and ideas and join our distinguished line up of speakers at R Exchange 2026 and be a part of an event that fosters knowledge sharing and collaboration within the open-source community. If you would like to contribute, please send your proposed title and a short bio (<100 words) and abstract (<300 words) to events@epi.group.

events.id: & Juliet-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: & Juliet
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
What might have happened if Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet had ended differently?
& Juliet explores the idea of what the Bard’s heroine might have done if she’d lived beyond the end of the play.
The result is a fabulous, feel-good journey of self-discovery, empowerment, and second chances.
It features chart-toppers like Since U Been Gone, Roar, Baby One More Time, Larger Than Life, and Can’t Stop the Feeling!
The retelling of a classic love story through a bold new lens makes & Juliet more than just a musical.

events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Some of Pink Floyd’s most iconic tracks feature in a live concert destined for Wellington in May. The Pink Floyd Experience returns to the city with another show. This time, the tribute band brings back the legendary production of Pink Floyd’s eleventh studio album, ‘The Wall’. It’s an epic reimagining of the powerful concept album, complete with sound, lighting, and visual effects. 
As always with this tribute act band, the music will be performed to the highest standards. Everyone from the most casual Pink Floyd listener to the diehard fan will be impressed with the performance. From the opening notes of In the Flesh to Another Brick in the Wall you’ll love this musical experience.

events.venue: TSB Bank Arena,Queen's Wharf, Wellington, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Pink Floyd Experience 2026 Tour - Wellington
TICKETS ON SALE WEDNESDAY 3RD DECEMBER

Coming April/May 2026, an unforgettable return of one of rock’s greatest masterpieces.

After nearly three decades of captivating audiences, The Pink Floyd Experience proudly brings back the legendary production of 'The Wall', an epic live reimagining of Pink Floyd’s most powerful concept album.

This breathtaking tour recreates the spectacle of the original, complete with the monumental construction and dramatic destruction of The Wall itself. It’s not just a concert; It’s an immersive journey through sound, light, and emotion — from isolation to transcendence.

Led by the commanding vocals of Stan Gratkowski and the seasoned musicians who have shaped this act for 28 years, this show captures the magic, precision, and raw feeling that
defined Pink Floyd’s legacy.

You’ve heard the songs. You’ve seen the tributes.
But have you felt it — the pulse of the music, the surge of the light, the goosebumps as the first notes hit?

This tour promises all that — and more:

A full-scale visual and sonic experience

Prepare to be immersed, moved, and utterly blown away.

This show is a MUST-SEE for any Floyd fan!

events.id: Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Day 1 – May 10, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: Working with Dissociative Parts and Their Voices in Complex Trauma and Dissociative Disorders
Overview:
This seminar focuses on adapting EMDR for individuals with dissociative disorders, using the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) Dolores has developed. It provides strategies for working with dissociative parts and their voices and integrating a trauma-informed approach to inner conflict safely from early treatment stages.
Key Learning Points:
·         Identifying and working with dissociative parts and their voices.
·         Understanding the function and purpose of “hostile” parts.
·         Addressing dissociative phobias through EMDR informed techniques.
·         Managing resistance and treatment impasses.
·         Structuring work with dissociative parts effectively.
Program Description:
After many early cautions about the potential dangers of using EMDR with individuals suffering from dissociative disorders, limited methods have been offered for adapting standard EMDR procedures to this specific population. Based on these early cautions, EMDR is still considered by many clinicians as limited to the treatment of traumatic memories in high-functioning dissociative clients and only after a long preparation phase that depends on other treatment modalities. Confined by this conceptualisation, the use of EMDR is too often limited, and many survivors of severe traumatisation are unable to benefit from EMDR reprocessing and, if at all, only much later in the treatment process.
Dolores Mosquera developed (with AnabelGonzalez, M.D.) the Progressive Approach model for treating complex trauma and dissociation (2012) and the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) (2019, 2025). Using this trauma and AIP-informed models, clinicians can safely utilise a wide range of EMDR interventions (including BLS) from early in the preparatory phase of treatment for patients with dissociative disorders.
In this seminar, she will present her current practice of working with clients, including video demonstrations. Mosquera's deft clinical skills and ground-breaking innovative thinking teach a middle ground between "dissociation blind" aggressive EMDR interventions and overly cautious delays to the use of EMDR reprocessing.
Many dissociative clients have difficulty with hostile, critical voices. The internal conflict is sometimes so intense that the person even has difficulty carrying on an ordinary conversation. One factor that affects this conflict is how the patient deals with the voices or parts of the self.
Key Program Content:
Identify the internal system of dissociation and internal voices that are hostile and critical
How to read the function and purpose behind the saboteur parts of self
Using compassion and understanding to help deal with dissociative phobias within the internal system
Skills to reduce impasses and resistance that may complicate or reduce the efficacy of the treatment
Specific steps to organize the work with hostile parts and voices
 Days 2–3 – May 11–12, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: From Fragmentation to Integration: A Master Class in Treating Complex Trauma and Dissociation
Format: 2-Day Masterclass: Three Clinical Cases from Start to Finish
Across two days, Dolores will present three distinct new cases illustrating varying levels of dissociation — including one with frequent switching and no initial Adult Self. Each session is interactive, highlighting the therapeutic process from assessment to completion.
Over two immersive days, this advanced master class offers a rare opportunity to observe and analyse complete therapeutic processes under the expert guidance of Dolores Mosquera.

Dolores will present three new and distinct clinical cases, each representing different manifestations of complex trauma and dissociation — including one client who experiences frequent switching and begins therapy without an integrated adult self.
Participants will follow these clients’ journeys from the initial stages of therapy through to treatment completion, gaining deep insight into decision-making, pacing, and the integration of EMDR strategies within complex systems. The format is designed to be highly interactive and reflective, combining video demonstrations, live commentary, and group discussion to deepen understanding of safe, flexible, and attuned clinical practice when working with dissociative clients.
This master class is ideal for clinicians seeking to refine their skills, expand their conceptual framework, and enhance clinical confidence when navigating the challenges of trauma-related dissociation.
Additional Details
·         Eligibility: Must have completed at least Part One of EMDR Basic Training (University of Otago or equivalent).
·         Certification: Participants receive a Professional Development Certificate of Attendance.
·         Dietary needs: Provided upon registration.
·         Parking: Paid on-site parking available.
·         Accommodation: Discounted rates at a local hotel (discount code to be posted on the event site).

events.id: Connecting Aotearoa Summit 2026-Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Connecting Aotearoa Summit 2026
events.venue: Ground Floor/1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We’re excited to announce the Connecting Aotearoa Summit 2026—the premier event for shaping New Zealand’s digital future. We launched the expanded event last year to ensure the issues we cover are relevant and pertinent to the nation’s most pressing challenges. In 2026, this is more critical than ever, as the general election looms. We need to make digital connectivity and equity front-and-centre of political debate, economic prosperity, and social wellbeing. The decisions made this year will lock in New Zealand’s digital trajectory for the rest of the decade.

This year, we are proposing that the Summit tackles the crucial question: “How do we get everyone connected to the best broadband service that meets their needs to live and thrive in our digital future by 2030?”

This ambitious national goal demands immediate, coordinated action from policymakers, industry, and community leaders. Join us as we delve into the critical issues surrounding digital connectivity in Aotearoa, directly influencing the next government’s mandate. At this early stage, we are proposing that our sub-themes include:

Policy & Political Mandate: Developing the definitive roadmap for universal connectivity ahead of the 2026 election, securing cross-party commitment to the 2030 target.

Rural Connectivity: Bridging the digital divide and ensuring resilient, future-proof access for all, regardless of location.

Affordability & Digital Equity: Examining the total cost barriers (device, data, skills) to internet access and advancing practical solutions for true inclusion.

Future-Proofing Connectivity: Looking ahead to emerging technologies and innovative, sustainable solutions that will make the 2030 target a reality.

These are all critical to us meeting our vision that by 2030, everyone in Aotearoa is connected to the best broadband service that meets their needs. This prospectus outlines how you can partner with this Summit to influence the national agenda and help us address the question around how we connect all of Aotearoa.
The Minister for Media and Communications, Hon Paul Goldsmith, is confirmed to present the closing Ministerial address.
Platinum Partner for 2026:

events.id: New Zealand International Comedy Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand International Comedy Festival
events.long_description:
Every May, the capital comes alive with laughter, thanks to the New Zealand International Comedy Festival (NZICF). New Zealand’s homegrown talent shares the stage with some of the world’s most exciting comedians. You could catch a big-name international artist, or discover a new local rising star. 
Since it began in 1993, the aim of the festival has been to champion the craft of comedy so everyone can share a laugh. Every year, a huge group of comedians descend on Wellington from local shores and beyond to deliver three weeks of merriment. 
The festival offers a diverse range of high-quality laughs. It showcases the best of local comedy and gives audiences a taste of some of the world’s best acts. Catch over 100 comics performing at The Opera House, BATS Theatre, Fringe Bar, San Fran, and more.

events.id: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 19th & 20th May-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 19th & 20th May
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
Tuesday 3rd March
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Tuesday 3rd & Wednesday 4th March
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council

“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

events.name: The Waterboys New Zealand Tour tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Destroy All Lines
THE WATERBOYS make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in May 2026 their first tour in over a decade!
Critically acclaimed as one of the best live bands on the planet, the 2025 band features double keyboard players Brother Paul from Memphis and James Hallawell from Cornwall and is grounded by killer Irish rhythm section Aongus Ralston (bass) and Eamon Ferris (drums).
THE WATERBOYS will be performing tracks from their audacious new album, Life, Death and Dennis Hopper: a bold, cinematic tribute to the maverick American actor and cultural icon, along with material across their storied catalogue. From the early "big music" of The Whole Of The Moon and classic album This Is The Sea through to the roots-inspired Fisherman's Blues era and music from their ambitious post-2015 output.
Mike Scott comments: "The Waterboys live for the experience of playing, of feeling our music evolve and grow with each consecutive concert. Nothing makes us happier than seeing a long list of dates like these. How will the music change? What will happen that's never happened before? How much fun and thrills can we and the audiences have? Australia and New Zealand come and join us!"

events.id: Tommy Emmanuel CGP - Living In The Light Tour | Regent Theatre, Palmerston North-Regent on Broadway,49 Broadway Ave, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Tommy Emmanuel CGP - Living In The Light Tour | Regent Theatre, Palmerston North
events.venue: Regent on Broadway,49 Broadway Ave, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Tommy Emmanuel CGP - Living In The Light Tour | Regent Theatre, Palmerston North
Tommy Emmanuel CGP - Living In The Light Tour
NEW ZEALAND 2026

Special guest: Mike Dawes

World-renowned guitarist and master entertainer TOMMY EMMANUEL, CGP is thrilled to announce what is sure to be an unforgettable tour of New Zealand in May 2026.

The five-date tour takes in Auckland, Hamilton, Palmerston North, Wellington and Christchurch.

TOMMY EMMANUEL, CGP is a living legend in the world of acoustic guitar, celebrated for his jaw- dropping technique, innovation, and boundless musicality. He has enthralled audiences around the globe with his dazzling fingerstyle performances, and now, New Zealand will have the privilege of witnessing his mastery up close and personal.

“I feel like the Indiana Jones of the guitar world,” says the globe-trotting fingerpicker. “I’m on this wild journey, just making it up as I go, and I’m thrilled that so many people are having fun joining along with me.”

TOMMY EMMANUEL Hailed as “one of the best acoustic guitarists in the world” by NPR’s World Cafe, Tommy Emmanuel got his start at the age of six, when he first began touring his native Australia with his family’s band. As a teenager, he earned a reputation as a highly sought after sideman and session player, and by his early twenties, Emmanuel was playing on chart-topping hits and performing with acts like Air Supply and Men at Work.

TOMMY EMMANUEL, CGP, Living in the Light Tour

Sunday 17 May - Town Hall, Auckland
Tuesday 19 May - Waikato Regional Theatre, Hamilton
Thursday 21 May - Regent Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 22 May - Opera House, Wellington
Saturday 23 May - Isaac Theatre, Christchurch

events.id: Tommy Emmanuel CGP — Living In The Light Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Tommy Emmanuel CGP — Living In The Light Tour
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s a world-renowned guitarist and master entertainer. Tommy Emmanuel, CGP, is bringing his beloved Maton guitar to The Opera House stage in Wellington. He is considered a living legend in the acoustic guitar world. The Australian musical legend has enthralled audiences around the globe with his dazzling technique. The concert promises to be an inspiring journey as Tommy strums and plucks his way through jazz, rock, country and pop music. Fans will be captivated by the diverse musical landscape he creates. 
Since his career began in the 1960s, Tommy has toured with luminaries like Eric Clapton and John Denver. He has won a Grammy Award and performed for a televised audience of more than two billion at the 2000 Sydney Olympics. Collaborations include guitar greats like Les Paul, Mark Knopfler, Joe Walsh, and Richard Thompson. 
Tommy’s hero, legendary guitarist Chet Atkins, bestowed the title of Certified Guitar Player (CGP) on him. He is one of only four players in the world with the title. Tommy Emmanuel CGP continues to push the boundaries of what is possible on the acoustic guitar.

events.id: Rock Tenors — Anthems Reloaded-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Rock Tenors — Anthems Reloaded
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get ready for some of the biggest anthems in the rock world. Rock Tenors roar into The Opera House in Wellington for a night of big tunes and big voices. The Anthems Reloaded Tour celebrates key moments in the Kiwi group’s musical journey. 
The five members of Rock Tenors have wide experience. They cross multiple music genres from opera and musical theatre to contemporary rock and thrash metal. They’ve reinvented the standard rock vocal arrangements with harmonic complexity, so audiences will get a dose of skilled musicality as well as nostalgia. You’ll hear The Rock Tenors’ signature renditions of legendary anthems from bands stretching back to the 60s. Hear Queen, The Animals, Bon Jovi, Aerosmith, AC/DC, Black Sabbath, Iron Maiden, White Snake, KISS, Guns N’ Roses, Red Hot Chilli Peppers, U2, and more. 
The touring ensemble of James Adams, Luke Butson, Ben Hayward, Steve Jones, and Justin Wilson are some of New Zealand’s premier vocalists. Since forming in 2022, they have taken the South Island by storm. They have become the must-see act for their vocal mastery and high-voltage rock singing.

events.id: Beyond the Bookshelves: Diversity in Austen Retellings-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Beyond the Bookshelves: Diversity in Austen Retellings
events.venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Rachel Pilios, passionate Austen lover (owner of over 30 copies of Pride and Prejudice) and Children's Book Buyer at Unity Books, for an illuminating exploration of diversity in contemporary Austen retellings. As a mixed-race, queer, and neurodiverse bookseller, Rachel brings a unique perspective to the rich tapestry of Austen-inspired literature.
In this talk, Rachel will showcase a curated selection of titles—all available through Unity Books—that reimagine Austen's beloved stories through diverse lenses. Discover queer retellings, tales set in other cultures, modern adaptations, and even Regency-era stories that amplify marginalized voices.
Attendees will gain a deeper appreciation for the breadth of the current Austen book market and its resonance with the modern world. Prepare to expand your reading list and discover exciting new perspectives on timeless classics.
Part of the Jane Austen Society of Aotearoa New Zealand's 2026 series on diversity.
Bring a friend: purchase 2 or more tickets and get a 10% discount
Who this event is for:
People who love Austen
People who love books
People who care about diversity
Afternoon tea provided

Image: Pride & Prejudice Pride flag by AmateurAusten (available for purchase on multiple items on Red Bubble)
Austen, Maths and Queer nerds unite! A take on Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice but you don't have to be an Austenite to appreciate the sentiment because Pride truly is Greater than Prejudice.
FAQs
Do I need to know about Jane Austen?
No. Everyone is welcome.
Do I need to be a member of the society?
We don't technically have membership, if you turn up we think of you as a member.
I have accessibility or dietary requirements
We aim to meet at venues that are accessible and provide for all dietary requirements. Please check out the accessibility section or contact us if you're unsure. We want you to be there and we want you to be comfortable.

events.name: GLORY Tour - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
GLORY Tour - Wellington
🚨 AUSTRALIA + NEW ZEALAND we are SO excited for the GLORY album tour!!! With very special guest Darcie Haven !! TJJT Mailing List Pre-sale starts Wednesday 15 October at 1pm local time (check your inbox!) and general on-sale starts at 1pm local time on Friday October 17. Add on a GLORY pre-order to win the chance to come to soundcheck and meet and greet. See you there!! ** 🚨

Presented by: Live Nation & Triple j

ARIA Award-winning indie-rock four piece Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers - Anna Ryan (they/she; vocals/guitar), Scarlett McKahey (she/her; guitar/vocals), Jaida Stephenson (she/her; bass) and Neve van Boxsel (she/her; drums) - have gone from strength to strength since the release of their debut EP Pretty Good For A Girl Band (2022), with its lead single ‘Girl Sports’ landing at #55 on the triple j Hottest 100. Their debut album I Love You (2023) landed at #6 on the ARIA Charts, placed at #52 on the Hottest 100 (‘I Used To Be Fun’), with its deluxe I Love You Too (2024) featuring new singles ‘Dull’ ft. Softcult and ‘Please Me’ ft. The Linda Lindas - the former landing at #187 in triple j’s Hottest 200 this year.

They have just announced their second album GLORY - which was produced with 3x GRAMMY Award-winning, London-based Catherine Marks (boygenius’ The Record, Wolf Alice) and features the singles ‘BALCONY’, ‘UNSCARRED’, and latest single 'MOTHER' - will be released November 7, 2025 (Community Music)

Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers have raked in a slew of accolades including nominations and wins at the ARIA Awards, J Awards, APRA Awards, Rolling Stone Awards, AIR Awards and Music ACT Awards, being named one of Spotify’s Artists To Watch, and being hand-picked to open for legendary international heavyweights Foo Fighters and Pearl Jam in Australia and the US.

Now based across Ngunnawal/Canberra, and Naarm/Melbourne, Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers are just as concerned about issues facing today’s women, non-binary people and young people everywhere as they are with making music that continues to push boundaries and expectations. They are ambassadors for Green Music’s No Music on a Dead Planet, played Rising Tide on Parliament House steps, contributed to the Parliament inquiry into challenges and opportunities within the Australian live music industry and are firm supporters of Michael’s Rule. This is a band never to be pigeonholed, and definitely never underestimated.

events.long_description:
San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.
Fresh off being announced as part of the massive Laneway Festival 2026 lineup alongside Chappell Roan, Wolf Alice, Geese and more, ARIA Award-winning indie-rock four piece Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers are thrilled to today unveil national GLORY album tour dates - playing their biggest venues to date and a string of all-ages shows - across so-called-Australia and Aotearoa this May presented by triple j and Live Nation Australia with very special guests to be announced, and drop their “big ego, full menace mode” new single ‘BAIT’ along with its video. 

Eligible Westpac New Zealand customers with a Westpac New Zealand Mastercard have special access to presale tickets starting from Wed 15 Oct, 1pm (local time) until Fri 17 Oct, 12pm (local time), as well as access to exclusive preferred tickets from Fri 17 Oct, 1pm (local time). Tickets are available exclusively to eligible Westpac New Zealand customers using a Westpac New Zealand Mastercard at checkout. Visit priceless.com/westpacnz to find out more.

The Live Nation Presale starts Thu 16 Oct, 1pm (local time) until Fri 17 Oct, 12pm (local time) or until allocation is exhausted. To purchase presale tickets, sign up now at livenation.com.au/register or livenation.co.nz/register.

Tickets go on sale to the general public on Friday 17 Oct, 1pm (local time) from teenjesusandthejeanteasers.net.

TEEN JESUS AND THE JEAN TEASERS
GLORY ALBUM TOUR
AUSTRALIA & NEW ZEALAND 2026

events.id: Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Eddie’s 35 years of sell-out comedy shows stretch from ‘The Ambassadors’ in 1993 to ‘Wunderbar’ in 2019.
Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens or the monkey in the tree, did the pears ever ripen… and will God ever appear? It’s a glorious chance to ‘maybe’ find out the answers or discover more questions to those Izzard conundrums. It’s highly likely that no night will be exactly the same, so as ever with Eddie, expect the unexpected.
“In the first 35 years of my stand-up career, I came up with many weird and crazy comedy stories. The ones I like the best will be in my 2025 live Remix Tour,“ says Eddie.
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career of thought-provoking, intelligent and surreal ideas. Who could resist?
This show may contain strong and imaginative language.

events.id: Trio Korimako-St Andrew's on The Terrace,St Andrews Church & Hall, 28 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Trio Korimako
events.venue: St Andrew's on The Terrace,St Andrews Church & Hall, 28 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Trio Korimako
A new piano trio of familiar friends, with a name, inspired by the unique beauty and purity of the song of the Korimako/Bellbird.
Helene Pohl - violin, Rolf Gjelsten – cello, and Michael Endres – piano.

Joseph Haydn: Piano Trio No 44 in E Major Hob. XV:28
Rebecca Clarke: Duo for Violin and Cello (Lullaby and Grotesque)
Ross Harris: Duo for Violin and Cello
Aaron Copland: “Vitebsk” for Piano Trio
Franz Schubert: Trio in E Flat Major Op 100

Bookings:
Postal, email, Eventfinda, door sales … more information at www.sundayconcerts.org.nz

Helene and Rolf were members of the NZ String Quartet for many years. German/New Zealand pianist Michael Endres has been described by Richard Dyer of the Boston Globe as, “…one of the most interesting pianists recording today”. He has 33 recordings. Michael has previously played for Sunday Concerts, most recently with the violinist Mark Menzies.

events.id: Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

events.id: NZ Art Show-4 Queens Wharf, Wellington, NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: NZ Art Show
events.venue: 4 Queens Wharf, Wellington, NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Description
The NZ Art Show is Aotearoa’s premier celebration of contemporary visual art — showcasing more than 300 artists and over 4,000 original artworks under one roof in the heart of Wellington.
For three inspiring days each year at the end of May - Friday 29th, Saturday 30th and Sunday 31st, the TSB Arena and Shed 6 transform into a vibrant hub of creativity. Discover paintings, photography, sculpture, and mixed media works from every corner of New Zealand — all available for purchase, all created by local artists.
Whether you’re an art lover, a first-time buyer, or simply curious, the NZ Art Show offers an unforgettable experience. Meet the artists, explore a diverse range of styles and stories, and take home a piece of Aotearoa’s creative spirit.
Don’t miss New Zealand’s best art event of the year. Book your tickets now and be part of the art! 
 Choose a single-day pass or make the most of it with a 3-day pass. Door sales available throughout the event.

Wellington Motorcycle Festival
Pleased to announce that we have been asked to set up a new Motorcycle Festival in Wellington in Conjunction with Brewtown #brewtown.
The new Festival will be held on the 30th and 31st of May and celebrate all types of riders and riding including 2 day sof Adventure bikes for beginners/intermediates and advance riders. events.id: ABBA Day Party: Wellington 💃🕺-Eva Wellington,35 Dixon Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: ABBA Day Party: Wellington 💃🕺
events.venue: Eva Wellington,35 Dixon Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
ABBA Day Party: Wellington 💃🕺
Book Here → https://www.fatsoma.com/e/faj25ciu/la/mpra

Calling all Dancing Queens and Super Troupers! 🎉

Get ready for a glitter-filled afternoon of pure pop perfection as we celebrate the iconic music of ABBA! Whether you're a lifelong fan or just love a bit of feel-good disco, this is your chance to sing, dance, and party like it's Eurovision '74!

What to Expect:

🎶 Wall-to-Wall ABBA Anthems
From “Dancing Queen” to “Gimme! Gimme! Gimme!”, enjoy all the greatest hits and hidden gems that made ABBA a global sensation.

✨ Disco, Funk & 70s Classics
While ABBA takes center stage, we'll also be spinning a fabulous mix of other dancefloor-fillers from the disco era—think funky grooves, 70s gems, and all the classics that’ll keep you moving from start to finish.

💫 ABBA-Inspired Atmosphere
Think shimmering lights, tinsel wigs and more sequins than you can shake a tambourine at! Step into your own mini-Mamma Mia moment!

🌈 Feel-Good Vibes All Day Long
Celebrate friendship, freedom, and unforgettable tunes with an afternoon of singing, dancing, and joyous nostalgia.

Whether you’re a Fernando or a Chiquitita, this is your Waterloo! don’t miss it! 🎤✨


FAQ’S

🗣️ Why do the tickets come in different price tiers?

Whilst there is no physical difference. There is only a limited amount of tickets we can sell. Therefore we operate a festival style ticketing model. The earlier you buy your ticket the cheaper it will be.

🗣️ Do you do group discount? Stag/Hen etc

Yes, we offer a discounted ticket price for groups of 10 or more. These tickets can be found listed as the “Big Group Package!” above, orders for these tickets are restricted to a minimum of 10.

🗣️ Will there be more tickets available if the event is sold out?

Once this event is sold out, there will not be any additional tickets released. In addiction to this we will be unable to sell them at the door due to maximum capacity and health and safety regulations.

🗣️ Is the venue accessible?

Our events take place at a variety of locations across the UK and Ireland. As each varies please ensure to check the specific venue's website for accessibility information.

🗣️ Can I resell my tickets?

Yes, if you are unable to attend an event you are welcome to sell your tickets on. We do not use names on tickets as a condition for entry.

🗣️ Are your events 18+?

All of our events are strictly 18+. A valid photographic ID may be requested on entry.

🗣️ I have more questions?

If you have additional questions and wish to contact us directly, don’t hesitate to drop us a DM on either Facebook (Daytime Disco) or Instagram (@daytimediscoevents)

Refund Policy:
In-line with normal consumer standards for ticket purchases, tickets for Daytime Disco events are non-refundable, on the condition that we not moved the event or canceled it. If you are no longer be able to attend the event, you are of course welcome to gift or sell your tickets onwards as we do not use names on the tickets as a condition of entry.

events.id: Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekākāriki-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekākāriki
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The international guitar sensation brings his groundbreaking stage show to New Zealand shores for the very first time!
May 30 at St Peter's Village Hall, Paekākāriki
7:00pm doors / 7:30pm show
Seated Concert
FAMILY FRIENDLY with $20 tickets for under 18s
Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
St Peter’s Hall in Paekakariki is a welcoming community space that combines timeless charm with practical versatility. Its bright, open interiors and flexible layout make it perfect for a wide range of events—from concerts and theatre to meetings and celebrations. The main hall offers a stage area with quality sound and lighting, creating a comfortable setting for performances of all kinds. Additional rooms provide space for smaller gatherings or workshops, making the venue adaptable to many needs. Whether you’re attending a lively show or a community meeting, St Peter’s Hall offers a warm, inviting atmosphere that truly brings people together.

events.long_description:
KT Tunstall // Wellington // Eye To The Telescope "20th Anniversary Tour" // Meow Nui // 18+
𝑫𝒆𝒔𝒕𝒓𝒐𝒚 𝑨𝒍𝒍 𝑳𝒊𝒏𝒆𝒔 𝑷𝒓𝒆𝒔𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔

𝐊𝐓 𝐓𝐔𝐍𝐒𝐓𝐀𝐋𝐋
𝐄𝐘𝐄 𝐓𝐎 𝐓𝐇𝐄 𝐓𝐄𝐋𝐄𝐒𝐂𝐎𝐏𝐄 "𝟐𝟎𝐓𝐇 𝐀𝐍𝐍𝐈𝐕𝐄𝐑𝐒𝐀𝐑𝐘 𝐓𝐎𝐔𝐑"

Sᴀᴛᴜʀᴅᴀʏ 30 Mᴀʏ 2026
Mᴇᴏᴡ Nᴜɪ, Wᴇʟʟɪɴɢᴛᴏɴ 18+
Dᴏᴏʀs 8ᴘᴍ

𝗧𝗶𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀:
➟ https://daltours.cc/26KTT-well

KT Tunstall will return to Australia and New Zealand in May 2026 to celebrate the 20th anniversary of her groundbreaking multi-million-selling debut album, '𝐸𝑦𝑒 𝑇𝑜 𝑇ℎ𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑙𝑒𝑠𝑐𝑜𝑝𝑒’.

These exclusive shows will see KT perform the 5 x times platinum album in its entirety, offering fans a once in a lifetime experience to relive the magic of a defining era.

KT recently supported Train, in a stripped back duo mode, on their huge Australian tour in May of this year and blew everyone away, paving the way for her own headline tour in full band mode next year. The Rock Pit’s review says it all "every song in its own right deserves to be on household playlists. The happiness and joy Tunstall radiates while playing is captivating, there’s is a true art in her craft of songwriting. Tunstall’s energy is simply infectious.”

'𝐸𝑦𝑒 𝑇𝑜 𝑇ℎ𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑙𝑒𝑠𝑐𝑜𝑝𝑒’ remains an iconic and beloved record that has become a landmark moment of British music in the 2000's. Released in December 2004, it took over the world with hits like “Black Horse and the Cherry Tree” and “Suddenly I See”.

“Suddenly I See” became the song of a generation when it was featured during the opening scene of The Devil Wears Prada and led her to win the iconic Ivor Novello Award.

The tracks, “Universe & U” and “Other Side of the World” also found their way into the public consciousness as part of the hugely popular TV series Grey’s Anatomy and helped the album to reach and incredible 4 million sales around the world.

KT Tunstall live on stage is a force. Her shows are electric; loop pedals, powerful vocals and an engaging stage presence that makes everyone in the crowd feel like she is singing directly to them. Her raw, real energy and humour consistently see her receive rave reviews. With universal critical acclaim and a slew of awards, KT has become one of the most respected singer-songwriters of the modern era.

Do not miss these special shows!

events.id: Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at Old St Paul's | Wellington-34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at Old St Paul's | Wellington
events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The international guitar sensation brings his groundbreaking stage show to New Zealand shores for the very first time!
📍 May 31 at Old St Paul's - Wellington
2:30pm doors / 3:00pm show
Seated Concert
FAMILY FRIENDLY with $20 tickets for under 18s
Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!

WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!

Old St Paul’s is a stunning example of Gothic Revival architecture, constructed entirely from native timbers and consecrated in 1866. Its soaring wooden arches, stained glass windows, and rich acoustics make it a sought-after venue for a variety of events. The church offers seating for up to 460 guests, with facilities including a grand piano, organ, and a bar licence. While on-site catering isn't available, nearby venues such as Loaves & Fishes Hall, the Royal Society of New Zealand, and the Thistle Inn provide excellent options for receptions and gatherings. Located at 34 Mulgrave Street in Thorndon, Old St Paul’s is easily accessible by public transport and offers a serene setting for weddings, concerts, memorials, and other significant events.

events.id: Getdown Services - Australia & New Zealand 2026-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Getdown Services - Australia & New Zealand 2026
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Meet Getdown Services – your new favourite band and one of the UK’s hottest word-of-mouth acts! The brilliantly offbeat cult British duo has been turning heads across Britain and Europe with their balls-to-the-walls live shows, tongue-in-cheek wit, razor-sharp lyrics and infectious disco-fuelled grooves, teetering between chaos and genius. And now, after selling out tours across the UK and Europe, they’re bringing their riotous show down under for the first time in May/June 2026 – with shows in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington, presented by I OH YOU and MG Live. 
Tickets go on sale Friday 14 November at 10.00am local time, with MG Live presale commencing Thursday 13 November at 10.00am local time. Sign up for early access to the MG Live presale here.               
“I reckon we get people asking us to come to Australia probably every day, and everyone in England is moving there, so will be good to see what all the fuss is about.

“Always been one of those places where you’re like, ‘Fair enough, but I can’t be arsed with that. It looks mad – there’s snakes and also it takes 40 hours to get there.’ Will be good fun, though! Went to New Zealand to see a mate of ours get married a few years ago and thought it was a lovely country and I really liked those pies they have. It felt quite similar to the UK in a lot of ways, so playing gigs there should be fun!”
Getdown Services

For those in the know, Bristol-based duo Josh Law and Ben Sadler – aka Getdown Services – are THE must-see new act of the year. And if you don’t know yet, you will soon … and you’ll wish you got in early! Named as “one to watch” at this year’s Glastonbury Festival and dubbed (by the band themselves) “Britain’s Best Band”, their live shows are equal parts smart, sweaty and gloriously unhinged. Their sound is a wild blend of scrappy indie disco, twisted funk and post-punk energy, turning the absurdity of modern Britain into dancefloor gold.        
 
The pair met at school in Minehead, Somerset and now make music together at home in Bristol – churning out what Rolling Stone called “power disco with unrepentant silliness” with a healthy dose of satire and swagger. Their highly lauded debut album Crisps (Breakfast Records, 2023) showcased their eclectic danceable grooves and biting social commentary, and a mix of sharp, funny social observations wrapped in irresistible, funk-fuelled rhythms. Follow-up EPs Your Medal’s In The Post, Crumbs and latest, Primordial Slot Machine, cemented their cult status, alongside an arsenal of red-hot singles – including James Bay’s Hat, Dog Dribble, I Got Views and Eat Quiche, Sleep, Repeat.   
 
 “Getdown Services are unrepentantly silly and constantly deliver one of the most joyously deranged live shows – just one of the best live bands out there!”
 Rolling Stone
“Their live show is as daft and as exhilarating as they come. Five stars.”
 Buzz Magazine
 
 “Genuine contenders to being the most exciting and interesting band in the UK right now.”
 CLASH

 Getdown Services look set to gobble up the world, one crumb at a time. Whether you’re into danceable chaos, satirical genius or just want to be ahead of the curve, Getdown Services are the band you didn’t know you needed – until now! Britain’s favourite new band are about to become yours too! 

MG LIVE TERMS OF SALE

https://mg.live/termsofsale

events.id: Professor Brian Cox: Emergence-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Professor Brian Cox: Emergence
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s a stage show that covers vast rivers of galaxies in the cosmos, the ecosystems of Earth, and the structure of the human brain. Emergence is the latest show by English physicist, presenter, and personality Professor Brian Cox. He takes to the stage at TSB Arena to contemplate the dazzling complexity of the universe and how it’s built on profoundly simple principles. 
Emergence is also a scientific history of 400 years of human discovery. How did we come to understand so much about the cosmos? Guided by mathematics, curiosity, and an aesthetic sense of symmetry, our species has begun to read the story of the Universe. We’ve started to carry our spacecraft to the edge of the solar system and outwards to the stars. Brian’s engaging style makes these questions come to life. The audience will be left awestruck and thrilled as the show covers vast topics in an accessible way. 
Brian has appeared in many landmark science programs for BBC radio and television over the last 15 years, from the Peabody Award-winning Wonders of the Solar System to the worldwide hit series The Planets. His previous touring show, Horizons, was performed to nearly half a million people across the world.

events.id: The Marriage of Figaro-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Marriage of Figaro
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Written when Mozart was operating at the top of his powers, The Marriage of Figaro is considered one of the great operas. New Zealand Opera’s production in 2026 promises to bring the 240-year-old masterpiece to life in a sumptuous setting. 
Picking up narratively where The Barber of Seville left off, The Marriage of Figaro is renowned for its wit and musical sophistication. It follows Figaro and his bride-to-be, Susannah, on their wedding day. Figaro’s employer, Count Almaviva, tries to seduce Susanna, so the engaged couple seek revenge. The cast boasts an unbelievable wealth of talent from Aotearoa and Australia, including runner-up at the 2022 Lexus Song Quest Felicity Tompkins, Julien Van Mellaerts, and James Clayton. 
Trans-Tasman creative duo Lindy Hume and Tracy Grant Lord take the helm with direction and design while Orchestra Wellington and conductor James Judd lead from the pit. This season offers opera at its most gorgeous, its most vivid, its most unforgettable.

events.long_description:
Play Good Society (a Jane Austen role playing game) with your Facilitator, Johnny Bowtie.
A whimsical, Beatrix Potter-style session in which genteel birds take part in the intrigue of wealth, status, & courtship that daily plays in The Wood.
Good Society is a game of balls, estates, sly glances, and turns about the garden—at least on the surface. Underneath this, just as in Austen's own novels, it is a game about social ambition, family obligation, and breathtaking, heart-stopping longing.
Ticket includes game play and table snacks. Drinks & further food is additional.

events.id: Melanie Bracewell — Dilly Dallying-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Melanie Bracewell — Dilly Dallying
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Melanie Bracewell is back with a brand-new hour-long show. It took a long time to write because she got distracted by a Sudoku puzzle. Melanie Bracewell — Dilly Dallying is about procrastination. Come along (don’t be late) to hear the Kiwi comic’s hilarious observations about avoidance. The UK comedy guide Chortle described Melanie as a “phenomenal storyteller”. Expect some wild stories as she dissects why she ‘puts things off’ for another day. 
Stand-up comedy, radio announcing, radio producer, script writing — Melanie Bracewell has found success in multiple disciplines. Her TV appearances include ‘The Cheap Seats,’ ‘Taskmaster’ (NZ), ‘Have You Been Paying Attention,’ and ‘Thank God You’re Here.’ She has won multiple awards as well, including the Billy T Award for the country’s best emerging comedian in 2018. The same year, she won Breakthrough Comedian of the Year at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards.

events.id: Little Revolutions 2026 - Wellington-92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Little Revolutions 2026 - Wellington
events.venue: 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Little Revolutions 2026: Renewed Neighbourhoods
We follow the One who “became flesh and moved into the neighbourhood.” The way of Jesus calls us over the fence, across the road, and to the ends of the earth. True revival never ends in a Sunday gathering—it spills into transformed neighbourhoods where there is “good news for the poor, release for the captive, recovery of sight for the blind, and liberty for those who are oppressed.”
This year we’re delighted to welcome Dave Mann from Bonny Downs, London. Together with his wife Sally, Dave serves as a Baptist pastor planting new faith communities in lower socio-economic and Muslim-majority neighbourhoods. They also established the Bonny Downs Community Association, a vital vehicle for neighbourhood renewal. Their story is beautifully told in Sally’s book, Looking for Lydia.

events.long_description:
Gazley Volkswagen Wellington Marathon - 2026
The Gazley Volkswagen Wellington Marathon has been the Capital City’s favourite footrace for almost 40 years.

Based at the famous Sky Stadium, the flat, scenic and fast route around Wellington's spectacular waterfront creates an occasion for all age and ability.

Whether in the Full Marathon, Half Marathon, 10k or Kids’ Magic Mile, more than 4000 runners and walkers from more than a dozen countries line up for this great annual occasion, which is also benefits the Heart Foundation.

But don't take our word for it. Find out for yourself... Enter Now for June 28th at www.wellingtonmarathon.co.nz !

events.id: Peter Hook and The Light-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Peter Hook and The Light
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bassist Peter Hook has intimate knowledge of the music of bands Joy Division and New Order. He’s one of the founding members of both British new wave bands. In July 2026, he is bringing his band The Light to The Opera House in Wellington. Together they will perform New Order’s album ‘Get Ready’ in full to celebrate its 25th anniversary. To make the concert even better, they will also perform a selection of greatest hits from Joy Division’s and New Order’s back catalogue. Get ready to enjoy songs like Disorder, Shadowplay, Transmission, Love Will Tear Us Apart, Blue Monday, and True Faith. 
The dark and ethereal sound of Joy Division and New Order ushered in the post-punk era and continue to be influential in the rock music scene. Peter Hook and The Light are careful to meticulously recreate their music in a live setting. Audiences are in for a show where treasured songs are played with the passion and energy they deserve.

events.id: All Blacks vs Italy-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: All Blacks vs Italy
events.venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Make it your mission to support the All Blacks in 2026 when they face Italy at Sky Stadium. This is an exciting match as it’s Italy’s first test in Wellington. It’s also only the fourth time they’ve met in New Zealand since the 1987 Rugby World Cup. With a 5:10pm kick-off, the match is designed to be family-friendly. Bring the whole whanau for an action-packed afternoon at the stadium. 
The All Blacks’ fixture against Italy is part of the inaugural Nations Championship. This is a new international rugby tournament featuring 12 of the world’s top nations across July and November. Each match has competition points on the line leading to the final, so the Wellington game is important. Wellington will be awash with rugby fever, so head out, support the All Blacks and say ‘ciao’ to all the Italian fans in the city. 
Tickets to the All Blacks vs Italy match go on sale in March.

events.id: Postmodern Jukebox — The Future is Vintage-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Postmodern Jukebox — The Future is Vintage
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The world’s foremost purveyors of time-twisting hits, Postmodern Jukebox, return to Wellington for one highly anticipated show at The Opera House. 
Founded in New York, the trailblazing troupe made up of singers, dancers, and instrumentalists brings their brand new ‘The Future is Vintage’ tour to New Zealand shores. Concertgoers can expect to enter a parallel musical universe where modern-day earworms and iconic pop tracks are reimagined. Expect everything from 70s rock classics and 80s Britpop hits to current chart-toppers, movie and video game soundtracks. Dress in your vintage best for the full time-travel experience. 
“We’re humbly presenting our own unique vision of a spectacular future; one that is built upon the timeless musical genres of the past and the authentically human spirit of creativity that inspired them,” says PMJ founder and arranger, Scott Bradlee. 
Come and be swept away by the romance and swagger of the past while enjoying your favourite tunes from now.

events.id: Postmodern Jukebox [WELLINGTON]-Opera House-All Events In
events.name: Postmodern Jukebox [WELLINGTON]
events.venue: Opera House
events.long_description:
Postmodern Jukebox [WELLINGTON]
The world’s foremost purveyors of time-twisting hits, Postmodern Jukebox, have announced their highly-anticipated return to Australia and New Zealand in June and July 2026!

Having previously performed multiple sold-out tours across Oceania, the trailblazing troupe of singers, dancers and instrumentalists will hit our shores with their brand new The Future is Vintage tour.

“In the midst of the AI hype all around us, some folks have gone so far as to proclaim that in the not-so-distant future, all of the music that we listen to will be AI generated – we’ll gladly take the other side of that wager,” says PMJ founder and arranger, Scott Bradlee. “We’re humbly presenting our own unique vision of a spectacular future; one that is built upon the timeless musical genres of the past and the authentically human spirit of creativity that inspired them.”

Concertgoers can expect to enter a parallel musical universe where modern-day earworms and iconic pop tracks alike are reimagined. Expect everything from ’70s rock classics and ’80s Britpop hits, to current chart-toppers, movie and video game soundtracks. Dress in your vintage best, for the full time-travel experience!

A TEG Dainty presale begins on Thursday November 20 at 11am (local). Sign up for access:

https://www.tegdainty.com/tour/postmodernjukebox2026/

Tickets to general public go on sale on Friday November 21 at 11am (local).
events.description:
Postmodern Jukebox [WELLINGTON] The world’s foremost purveyors of time-twisting hits, Postmodern Jukebox, have announced their highly-anticipated return to Australia and New Zealand in June and July 2026!
Having previously performed multiple sold-out tours across Oceania, the trailblazing troupe of singers, dancers and instrumentalists will hit our shores with their brand new The Future is Vintage tour.
“In the midst of the AI hype all around us, some folks have gone so far as to proclaim that in the not-so-distant future, all of the music that we listen to will be AI generated – we’ll gladly take the other side of that wager,” says PMJ founder and arranger, Scott Bradlee.
“We’re humbly presenting our own unique vision of a spectacular future; one that is built upon the timeless musical genres of the past and the authentically human spirit of creativity that inspired them.” Concertgoers can expect to enter a parallel musical universe where modern-day earworms and iconic pop tracks alike are reimagined.
Expect everything from ’70s rock classics and ’80s Britpop hits, to current chart-toppers, movie and video game soundtracks.

events.name: Harlem Globetrotters — 100 Year Tour
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The year 2026 will see the American exhibition basketball team, the Harlem Globetrotters, celebrate their 100-year anniversary. Wellington gets to celebrate with them when they visit in July. The team will take over TSB Arena and again revel in 100 years of thrills, laughs, and sheer basketball joy. If you aren’t already a fan, then sit back and watch their combined athleticism, sense of theatre, and comedy play out on the court. The gravity-defying dunks and dexterous tricks will have you roaring for more. 
The team has travelled the world visiting more than 120 countries and territories. Their 26,000 exhibition games continue to win new fans wherever they go. From the epic pre-game magic to unforgettable post-game interactions — come and experience their most legendary tour yet.

events.id: Wellington Opera — Manon-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Opera — Manon
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For its 2026 season, Wellington Opera brings one of the most popular and enduring French operas to life. Manon by Jules Massenet will feature Kiwi-Samoan tenor Pene Pati and Kiwi-Egyptian soprano Amina Edris. Joining this powerhouse duo is another New Zealander, baritone Phillip Rhodes will sing the role of Lescaut. Manon tells the tragic love story of Manon Lescaut and the Chevalier des Grieux. The story unfolds in five acts, exploring themes of love, desire, and the consequences of choices made in pursuit of pleasure. 
Pene Pati is widely known for his Sol3 Mio fame. He is a recent New Zealand Arts Laureate and is the first Samoan tenor to perform on the world’s top stages, including the Opéra national de Paris, Covent Garden, London and the Metropolitan Opera, New York.
events.description:

Manon tells the tragic love story of Manon Lescaut and the Chevalier des Grieux.
The story unfolds in five acts, exploring themes of love, desire, and the consequences of choices made in pursuit of pleasure.

events.id: Alan Davies — Think Ahead Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Alan Davies — Think Ahead Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Critically acclaimed stand-up comedian, actor, writer, and TV personality Alan Davies is heading to Wellington in 2026. His new show, ‘Think Ahead’, marks his first visit to Aotearoa in a decade. Like the latest instalment of his memoirs, White Male Stand-Up, the performance covers his extensive career, and the highs and lows he’s experienced. Alan says the show is about a late middle-aged stand-up comic. He thinks he’s Marty McFly, but he’s older than Doc Brown. He spends more time in the pharmacy than the gym and is subjected to relentless eye rolls from his kids. 
Davies is a staple of British television. He’s known for his performance as the eponymous hero in the long-running TV series Jonathan Creek, and as a permanent panellist on QI. His talk show, Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled, recently reached its seventh season. He is also one of the UK’s best-loved comedians.

events.id: Rivalry and Revenge (Austen role playing)-25 Victoria Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Rivalry and Revenge (Austen role playing)
events.venue: 25 Victoria Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Play Good Society (a Jane Austen role playing game) with your Facilitator, Johnny Bowtie.
Whether it is two suitors competing for the same quarry, or two families fighting over inheritance, explore characters who seek both reconciliation and revenge.
Good Society is a game of balls, estates, sly glances, and turns about the garden—at least on the surface. Underneath this, just as in Austen's own novels, it is a game about social ambition, family obligation, and breathtaking, heart-stopping longing.
Ticket includes game play and table snacks. Drinks & further food is additional.

events.id: Daniel Champagne LIVE at Old St Paul's | Wellington (a Family Friendly Concert)-34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Daniel Champagne LIVE at Old St Paul's | Wellington (a Family Friendly Concert)
events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The young virtuoso, recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation,” has fallen in love with New Zealand! — and after sold-out shows around the globe, he’ll bring his now-famous live show to 25 intimate venues across the country in 2026!
“Do whatever it takes to get in the front row!”
– Roots Magazine, UK
“A generational talent that must be seen to be believed.”
– The Calgary Herald, CANADA
OLD ST PAUL'S - WELLINGTON
✨ August 12, 2026
✨ 7:00pm doors / 7:30pm show
✨ Seated Concert
✨ FAMILY FRIENDLY with cheaper $20 tickets for under 18s
Don’t miss your chance to experience live music at its finest!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“The word ‘prodigy’ seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills. He coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
– The Calgary Herald, Canada
“Today I saw the future of folk — festival-goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.”
– The Firefly Column, USA
“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads, fusing the strong traditions of blues, folk, and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.”
– The Indie Blender, Canada
“Reinventing roots guitar.”
– Rhythms Magazine, Australia
“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy who plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.”
– BW Review, New Zealand
Presented by Nightingale Concerts - the listening-room experience

OLD ST PAUL'S is one of Wellington’s most breathtaking and evocative performance spaces, revered for its grandeur, warmth, and extraordinary natural acoustics. Built entirely of native timber, the soaring nave and finely crafted interior create a sound that is rich, resonant, and deeply immersive. The scale of the space offers both intimacy and awe, drawing audiences into a shared listening experience where music lingers and breathes. Designed for seated performances and reverent attention, Old St Paul’s carries a rare stillness — a place where silence feels sacred, dynamics unfold naturally, and every note is given time, space, and meaning.

events.id: Dita Von Teese-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Dita Von Teese
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
With her signature mystery and old-Hollywood glamour, Dita Von Teese is a global icon in the world of burlesque. She’s bringing an exciting new show to The Opera House in August. ‘Nocturnelle’ is a sensual spectacle inspired by the golden age of magic. It blends sophisticated striptease with the art of illusion for an unforgettable evening. Dita is accompanied by an ensemble of hand-picked neo-burlesque artists, so expect to be dazzled. 
Dita Von Teese is considered to have set the benchmark for American burlesque. The exotic and provocative art form has advanced under her unrivalled artistry and flair. The performer, creative director, and choreographer has sold out some of the world’s grandest venues, from Shanghai to New York. She is also a designer, collaborator, and entrepreneur. She’s forayed into fashion, beauty, music, and publishing.

events.id: Suzanne Vega-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Suzanne Vega
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Widely regarded as one of the foremost songwriters of her generation, Suzanne Vega emerged as a leading figure of the folk revival of the early 1980s. Four decades later, she is still writing and singing great songs. In her Wellington show, Suzanne will perform a career-spanning set. See her on stage at St James Theatre performing favourites like Tom’s Diner, Luka, Marlene On The Wall, and plenty more. There’ll also be new songs from her 2025 album, ‘Flying with Angels’. Joining her on stage will be longtime guitarist, Gerry Leonard, and cellist Stephanie Winters. 
Since the release of her self-titled, critically acclaimed 1985 debut album, Suzanne Vega has played to sold-out concerts across the world. She is a masterful storyteller who, according to one The New York Times critique, “observes the world with a clinically poetic eye.” Her song lyrics often focus on city life, ordinary people, and real-world subjects. They are notably succinct, understated, and immediately recognisable.

events.name: SUZANNE VEGA | Sun 6 Sept 2026 | St. James Theatre, Wellington
events.venue: St. James Theatre,83 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
SUZANNE VEGA | Sun 6 Sept 2026 | St. James Theatre, Wellington
𝐒𝐮𝐳𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞 𝐕𝐞𝐠𝐚 will perform a career-spanning show including favorites like “𝑇𝑜𝑚’𝑠 𝐷𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑟”, “𝐿𝑢𝑘𝑎”, “𝑀𝑎𝑟𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑒 𝑂𝑛 𝑇ℎ𝑒 𝑊𝑎𝑙𝑙” and many more, plus songs from her latest album, 𝐹𝑙𝑦𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝐴𝑛𝑔𝑒𝑙𝑠, which was released in May 2025 to critical acclaim. She will be joined on stage by her longtime guitarist, Gerry Leonard (of David Bowie band), and cellist Stephanie Winters.


𝐅𝐋𝐘𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐖𝐈𝐓𝐇 𝐀𝐍𝐆𝐄𝐋𝐒 𝐑𝐄𝐕𝐈𝐄𝐖𝐒

“𝐹𝑜𝑢𝑟 𝑑𝑒𝑐𝑎𝑑𝑒𝑠 𝑎𝑓𝑡𝑒𝑟 ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑛𝑒𝑤-𝑤𝑎𝑖𝑓 𝑑𝑒𝑏𝑢𝑡, 𝐒𝐮𝐳𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞 𝐕𝐞𝐠𝐚 𝑟𝑒𝑡𝑎𝑖𝑛𝑠 ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑘𝑛𝑎𝑐𝑘 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑙𝑢𝑐𝑖𝑑 𝑟𝑒𝑓𝑙𝑒𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑐𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑝 𝑚𝑢𝑠𝑖𝑐 𝑡𝑜 𝑚𝑎𝑡𝑐ℎ… 𝐻𝑒𝑟 𝑣𝑜𝑖𝑐𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑚𝑎𝑖𝑛𝑠 𝑏𝑜𝑡ℎ 𝑘𝑛𝑜𝑤𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑜𝑏𝑠𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑎𝑛𝑡.” – 𝐑𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐞 | 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐀𝐥𝐛𝐮𝐦𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐒𝐨 𝐅𝐚𝐫

"𝑖𝑛𝑓𝑢𝑠𝑒𝑑 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝑎 𝑣𝑖𝑏𝑟𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑦 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑝𝑜𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑙 𝑢𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑦 𝑡ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑖𝑠 𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑦 ‘𝑛𝑜𝑤’”
- 𝐌𝐎𝐉𝐎

“𝑓𝑖𝑛𝑑𝑠 ℎ𝑢𝑚𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑦 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑔𝑟𝑎𝑐𝑒 𝑎𝑚𝑖𝑑 𝑡ℎ𝑒 ‘𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑒𝑛𝑡 𝑒𝑚𝑒𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑦’ 𝑜𝑓 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑒𝑛𝑡”
- 𝐔𝐍𝐂𝐔𝐓 𝐌𝐚𝐠𝐚𝐳𝐢𝐧𝐞


𝐋𝐈𝐕𝐄 𝐑𝐄𝐕𝐈𝐄𝐖𝐒 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓

"𝑉𝑒𝑔𝑎’𝑠 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑤𝑎𝑠 𝑛𝑜𝑡ℎ𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑠ℎ𝑜𝑟𝑡 𝑜𝑓 𝑚𝑒𝑠𝑚𝑒𝑟𝑖𝑧𝑖𝑛𝑔, 𝑤𝑒𝑎𝑣𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡ℎ𝑟𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑠𝑜𝑢𝑙𝑓𝑢𝑙 𝑠𝑜𝑛𝑔𝑠 𝑖𝑛 𝑎 𝑐𝑜𝑧𝑦 𝑠𝑒𝑡𝑡𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑡ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑜𝑤𝑒𝑑 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑎 𝑑𝑒𝑒𝑝 𝑐𝑜𝑛𝑛𝑒𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑎𝑢𝑑𝑖𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒."
- 𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐭

"𝑆𝑢𝑧𝑎𝑛𝑛𝑒 𝑉𝑒𝑔𝑎 𝑤𝑜𝑣𝑒 𝑎 𝑠𝑝𝑒𝑙𝑙 𝑜𝑓 𝑙𝑖𝑔ℎ𝑡 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑠ℎ𝑎𝑑𝑜𝑤, 𝑏𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑐𝑙𝑎𝑠𝑠𝑖𝑐𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑛𝑒𝑤 𝑚𝑎𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑖𝑎𝑙 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝑖𝑛𝑡𝑖𝑚𝑎𝑡𝑒 𝑠𝑡𝑜𝑟𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑎 𝑚𝑒𝑚𝑜𝑟𝑎𝑏𝑙𝑒 𝑛𝑖𝑔ℎ𝑡.”
- 𝐏𝐚𝐭𝐜𝐡

𝐀𝐁𝐎𝐔𝐓 𝐒𝐔𝐙𝐀𝐍𝐍𝐄 𝐕𝐄𝐆𝐀

Widely regarded as one of the foremost songwriters of her generation, Suzanne Vega emerged as a leading figure of the folk revival of the early 1980s. Accompanying herself on acoustic guitar, Vega sang what has been called contemporary folk or neo-folk songs of her own creation in Greenwich Village clubs. Since the release of her self-titled, critically acclaimed 1985 debut album, she has given sold-out concerts in many of the world’s best-known venues. Known for performances that convey deep emotion, Vega’s distinctive, “clear, unwavering voice” (Rolling Stone) has been described as “a cool, dry sandpaper-brushed near-whisper” by The Washington Post, with NPR Music noting that she “has been making vital, inventive music” throughout the course of her decades-long career. Bearing the stamp of a masterful storyteller who “observes the world with a clinically poetic eye” (The New York Times), Vega’s songs have tended to focus on city life, ordinary people and real-world subjects. Notably succinct and understated, her work is immediately recognizable—as utterly distinct and thoughtful as it was when her voice was first heard on the radio over 40 years ago.
events.description:
SUZANNE VEGA | Sun 6 Sept 2026 | St. James Theatre, Wellington 𝐒𝐮𝐳𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞 𝐕𝐞𝐠𝐚 will perform a career-spanning show including favorites like “𝑇𝑜𝑚’𝑠 𝐷𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑟”, “𝐿𝑢𝑘𝑎”, “𝑀𝑎𝑟𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑒 𝑂𝑛 𝑇ℎ𝑒 𝑊𝑎𝑙𝑙” and many more, plus songs from her latest album, 𝐹𝑙𝑦𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝐴𝑛𝑔𝑒𝑙𝑠, which was released in May 2025 to critical acclaim.
She will be joined on stage by her longtime guitarist, Gerry Leonard (of David Bowie band), and cellist Stephanie Winters.
“𝐹𝑜𝑢𝑟 𝑑𝑒𝑐𝑎𝑑𝑒𝑠 𝑎𝑓𝑡𝑒𝑟 ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑛𝑒𝑤-𝑤𝑎𝑖𝑓 𝑑𝑒𝑏𝑢𝑡, 𝐒𝐮𝐳𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞 𝐕𝐞𝐠𝐚 𝑟𝑒𝑡𝑎𝑖𝑛𝑠 ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑘𝑛𝑎𝑐𝑘 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑙𝑢𝑐𝑖𝑑 𝑟𝑒𝑓𝑙𝑒𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑐𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑝 𝑚𝑢𝑠𝑖𝑐 𝑡𝑜 𝑚𝑎𝑡𝑐ℎ… 𝐻𝑒𝑟 𝑣𝑜𝑖𝑐𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑚𝑎𝑖𝑛𝑠 𝑏𝑜𝑡ℎ 𝑘𝑛𝑜𝑤𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑜𝑏𝑠𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑎𝑛𝑡.” – 𝐑𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐞 | 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐁𝐞𝐬𝐭 𝐀𝐥𝐛𝐮𝐦𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐒𝐨 𝐅𝐚𝐫 "𝑖𝑛𝑓𝑢𝑠𝑒𝑑 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝑎 𝑣𝑖𝑏𝑟𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑦 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑝𝑜𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑙 𝑢𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑦 𝑡ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑖𝑠 𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑦 ‘𝑛𝑜𝑤’”
